title: Method and apparatus for instantaneous on-line carbonation of water through electrostatic charging
abstract: To provide a carbonation apparatus for carbonating a mixed input flow of pressurized and refrigerated carbon dioxide and water.SOLUTION: A first cartridge is disposed within a carbonation chamber, defining a porous micromesh net in fluid communication with the input flow and a central cavity in fluid communication with a carbonation chamber output port. The micromesh net is configured to break up chains of water molecules passing through the net, so as to enhance bonding between the water molecules and carbon dioxide molecules within the cartridge. The net also responds to a flow of the water and carbon dioxide molecules impacting and passing through the net by generating a passive polarizing field that has a polarizing effect on the water molecules, so as to further enhance the bonding. Beads may be provided within the cartridge for capturing and stabilizing carbon dioxide molecules, so as to yet further enhance the bonding between the water molecules and the carbon dioxide molecules.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 4b
claims:
【請求項1】
明細書に記載した装置。
assignee: ペプシコ インコーポレーテッド

title: Component waterproof coating treatment device with good coating capacity
abstract: The utility model discloses a component waterproof coating processing device with good glue coating capability, which comprises supporting legs, a frame, an operation table, a discharge pipe, a guide rod, a slide block, a supporting rod, a guide groove, a waterproof coating box and a stop dog, the top of the supporting legs is provided with the frame installed by screws, the frame is in a sunken design, the operation table is installed in the frame, and the discharge pipe is arranged on the operation table. The bottom of the frame is provided with a threaded connection discharge pipe, the discharge pipe upwards penetrates through the frame and the operation table, the discharge pipe is provided with a valve, the rear end of the frame is provided with a guide rod installed through a screw, the guide rod is provided with a sliding connection sliding block, the sliding block can move forwards and backwards along the guide rod, the sliding block is provided with a supporting rod installed through a screw, and the supporting rod is designed to be in an inverted L shape. A guide groove is formed in a top transverse rod of the supporting rod, and a waterproof coating box is installed at the top of the supporting rod and can move in the length direction of the guide groove. The device is reasonable in design; and the discharging pipe can recycle the flowing waterproof glue, so that resources are saved.
claims:
1.一种挂胶能力好的元器件防水涂层处理装置，包括支撑腿（1）、框架（2）、操作台（3）、排出管（4）、导向杆（5）、滑块（6）、支撑杆（7）、导槽（8）、防水涂层箱（9）、挡块（10），其特征在于，所述支撑腿（1）的顶部设有螺钉安装的框架（2），框架（2）为凹陷式设计，框架（2）内安装有操作台（3），框架（2）底部设有螺纹连接排出管（4），排出管（4）向上贯穿框架（2）、操作台（3），排出管（4）上安装有阀门，所述框架（2）的后端设有螺钉安装的导向杆（5），导向杆（5）上设有滑动连接滑块（6），滑块（6）能沿导向杆（5）进行前、后移动，滑块（6）上设有螺钉安装的支撑杆（7），支撑杆（7）呈倒L型设计，支撑杆（7）的顶部横杆处开设有导槽（8），支撑杆（7）的顶部安装有防水涂层箱（9），防水涂层箱（9）能沿导槽（8）的长度方向移动，操作台（3）内设有挡块（10）。

4.根据权利要求1所述的一种挂胶能力好的元器件防水涂层处理装置，其特征在于，所述防水涂层箱（9）上方设有加料口，加料口能进行封堵，防水涂层箱（9）内安装有输送泵（16），输送泵（16）的出口与伸缩管（17）连接，伸缩管（17）与防水涂层箱（9）的底部连接，且伸缩管（17）穿过导槽（8）向下延伸，伸缩管（17）的末端与缓冲盒（19）连接，缓冲盒（19）的下部开设有多个漏孔，缓冲盒（19）的底部粘结有毛刷（20）。

assignee: 火星新材料科技(深圳)有限公司

title: Flexible base for sterile filling bottle field
abstract: An aseptically filled beverage container may include a body and a base having an upright ring, a central portion, and an isolation ring surrounding the central portion. One or more ribs may extend from the spacer ring to the upstanding ring such that the ribs do not extend outwardly to the upstanding ring or inwardly to the central portion. The ribs may be s-shaped to provide rigidity and limit or prevent deformation of the base.

title: Beverage dispenser with beverage-level indicator
abstract: A beverage dispenser having a beverage-level indicating system. The beverage dispenser includes a housing and a dispensing head arranged on the housing for dispensing a beverage into a beverage container. The beverage dispenser further includes a beverage-level sensor arranged on the housing and which determines a beverage level within the beverage container without contacting the beverage within the beverage container, a beverage-level indicator that provides a visual indication of the beverage level within the beverage container, and a control unit that causes the beverage-level indicator to indicate the beverage level within the beverage container based on the beverage level as determined by the beverage-level sensor.
claims:
1.      A system for providing a beverage level, comprising:
a beverage dispenser, comprising:
a housing;
a dispensing head arranged on the housing for dispensing a beverage into a beverage container;
a beverage-level sensor arranged on the housing and configured to determine a beverage level of a beverage within the beverage container without contacting the beverage, wherein the beverage dispenser is configured to transmit a signal corresponding to the beverage level as determined by the beverage-level sensor; and
a mobile electronic device in communication with the beverage dispenser, wherein the mobile electronic device is configured to display a visual indication of the beverage level in the beverage container during dispensing of the beverage, wherein the visual indication is based on the signal from the beverage dispenser, wherein the visual indication comprises a real-time representation of a beverage container filled to a level indicative of the beverage level in the beverage container as determined by the beverage-level sensor.
2.      The system of claim 1, wherein the beverage dispenser is configured to receive a beverage
selection of a user from the mobile electronic device.
3.      The system of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the visual indication provided by the mobile electronic

title: Apparatus and method for producing scored dough pieces
abstract: Frozen un-proofed dough pieces are produced by cutting a dough sheet into strips and producing a score through an upper skin of each strip with at least one blunt deformation tool prior to freezing. The un-proofed dough pieces are formed by mass production, with an un-proofed dough sheet being cut to form dough strips which are then cut into the un-proofed dough pieces, with the score for each un-proofed dough piece being formed by pressing the upper skin of the dough down into the body of the dough, thereby deforming and pre-stressing the dough to create weak zones, either before, during or after the individual un-proofed dough pieces are actually created, but before freezing. Upon heating, openings are established in the upper skin along score lines.
claims:
1. A method for producing frozen un-proofed dough pieces with scores, the method comprising:
transporting an un-proofed dough as a dough sheet with a conveyor, the dough having a body, a lower skin in contact with the conveyor and an upper skin opposite the lower skin;
cutting the dough with a plurality of blades configured to cut the dough into a plurality of dough strips;
scoring the dough using a blunt deformation tool to produce a functional score for each of the plurality of dough strips by drawing the upper skin into the body to a depth above the lower skin while deforming and pre-stressing the body without cutting the dough utilizing the blunt deformation tool;
cutting the plurality of dough strips to form a plurality of un-proofed dough pieces; and
freezing the un-proofed dough pieces.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the score is formed either before or after cutting the plurality of dough strips.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein a plurality of scores is formed simultaneous with cutting the dough sheet to form the plurality of dough strips.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the plurality of blades employed for cutting the dough sheet constitutes a plurality of blunt-edge cutters, each having a dough engaging portion configured to press the upper skin toward the lower skin to pinch the uppe

title: Boil over reduction compositions for microwave cooking
abstract: An anti -boil-over composition comprising about 30% to about 60% powdered cauliflower or powdered pea fiber is added to dried rice or dried pasta within a container suitable for cooking in a microwave upon further adding water into the container. The amount of composition employed constitutes about 5% to about 13%, by weight, of the dried rice or dried pasta and can additionally include about 10% to about 45% purified starch, about 5% to about 10% fat, and up to 6% sodium chloride, potassium chloride and/or calcium chloride. A shelf stable food product including the anti-boil-over composition and a method of preparing the shelf stable food product are also encompassed.
claims:
CA 03237763 2024-05-07 WO 2023/086211 PCT/US2022/047993 CLAIMS
1. An anti-boil-over composition suitable for use in cooking dried rice or dried pasta in a microwave oven, said composition comprising about 30% to about 60% powdered cauliflower or powdered pea fiber, wherein an effective amount of the anti-boil-over composition is configured to reduce or eliminate boil-over when dried rice or dried pasta is cooked in water in a limited volume container with microwave oven heating relative to cooking the dried rice or dried pasta in the same manner in the limited volume container without the anti-boil-over composition.
2. The anti-boil-over composition of claim 1, wherein the composition additionally comprises about 10% to about 45% purified starch, about 5% to about 10% fat, and up to 6% sodium chloride, potassium chloride and/or calcium chloride.
3. The anti-boil-over composition of claim 2, wherein the purified starch comprises tapioca starch and/or corn starch.
4. The anti-boil-over composition of claim 2, wherein the fat comprises coconut oil.
5. The anti-boil-over composition of claim 1-3, wherein the composition consists essentially of: a. 30-60% powdered cauliflower or powdered pea fiber, b. 10% to 45% purified starch, c. 5% to 10% fat, and d. 1% to 3% table salt and/or sea salt.
6. A shelf stable food product comprising:

title: Unattended vending systems and methods of using the same
abstract: Embodiments described herein relate to mobile vending systems for vending products (e.g., beverages and snacks). The system can be easily repositioned from one position to another and can be operated unattended. The system can include a storage compartment for storing products and a cooling system for maintaining the temperature of the storage compartment. The system can have an integrated system for payment processing, inventory management, and powering the system. The system can detect an authorized user or a payment source to authorize vending of the products. The system can have active cooling systems, passive cooling systems, or both. The active cooling systems can include refrigeration systems for cooling products stored within the system. The passive cooling systems can use temperature control packs for maintaining temperatures within the system.
claims:
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A mobile vending system, the system comprising: a storage compartment configured to store products, the storage compartment being insulated; a temperature sensor disposed within the storage compartment, the temperature sensor configured to detect when the temperature of the storage compartment is greater than a predetermined temperature; a cooling system for maintaining the temperature of the storage compartment; a user interface, the user interface comprising a display; a scanner configured to scan the product; a payment processing unit, the payment processing unit configured to detect a payment source; a battery configured to power the user interface and the payment processing unit; and a power source comprising a plug compatible with an electrical outlet, the power source configured to power the cooling system and recharge the battery when the plug is inserted into the electrical outlet; and a control unit configured to: communicate with the payment processing unit to authorize a purchase of the product when the payment processing unit detects a payment source; and activate the cooling system when the mobile vending system is coupled to a power supply and based on the detection of the temperature sensor; and wherein the mobile vending system is movable from a first position to a second position.
2. The system of claim 1, further comprising a housing disposed on an exterior of the mobile vending system, the housing comprising the user interface, scanner, the payment processing unit, and the control unit.
3. The system of claim 1, further comprising a second battery, wherein the power

title: Interactive vending machine
abstract: The invention provides an interactive vending machine. The vending machine has an interactive customer experience. Some embodiments of a vending machine include a transparent front wall having a plurality of display units located rearward of the front wall. Each of the display units may contain an example of a product for sale. Based on input and other information received from a customer, the vending machine may provide recommendations for one or more products to be selected for purchase. The vending machine may emphasize recommendations by selectively illuminating a product display unit containing recommended products.
claims:

外壳；
展示部分，所述展示部分设置在所述外壳的前部部分中，所述展示部分包括多个展示单元，所述多个展示单元为矩形形状并且被布置成网格图案，每个展示单元被配置为容纳产品，使得所述产品从所述外壳的外部可见；

产品递送系统，所述产品递送系统设置在所述产品储存部分中，所述产品递送系统被配置为将所述产品从所述产品储存部分递送到所述递送端口，其中设置在所述展示单元中的任何所述产品均不能够被递送到所述递送端口。

title: Automatic crucible mixer
abstract: The invention discloses an automatic crucible mixing machine which comprises a rack, a mixing mechanism is rotationally connected to the rack, the mixing mechanism is driven by a driving motor to mix uniformly, the mixing machine comprises a conveying device and a pressing and sealing mechanism, the conveying device is used for conveying a tray bearing a crucible into the mixing mechanism, and the pressing and sealing mechanism is used for pressing and sealing the tray. And the pressing and sealing mechanism is used for pressing and sealing the crucible. The device can directly receive conveyed trays containing crucibles, and after automatic film covering and pressing fixing, the uniform mixing mechanism is started to mix the crucibles uniformly; the device is high in automation degree and can be arranged in an existing automatic production line, and the production efficiency is effectively improved.
claims:
1.一种自动化坩埚混匀机，包括机架，其特征在于，所述机架上转动连接有混匀机构，所述混匀机构由驱动电机驱动混匀，所述混匀机构包括输送装置以及压紧密封机构，所述输送装置用于将承载有坩埚的托盘输送至混匀机构中，所述压紧密封机构用于压紧密封所述坩埚。
2.根据权利要求1所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述混匀机构的两侧通过转轴转动连接至所述机架上，所述驱动电机通过所述转轴驱动所述混匀机构旋转。
3.根据权利要求2所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述输送装置固定至所述混匀机构的架体上，所述输送装置为辊筒输送机。
4.根据权利要求3所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述滚筒输送机上设置有定位机构，所述定位机构包括定位缸，所述定位缸固定至所述架体上并能够通过辊筒输送机的缝隙伸出。
5.根据权利要求3所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述压紧密封机构包括压紧盖以及覆膜机构，所述覆膜机构用于将薄膜覆盖至所述坩埚上方，所述压紧盖在压紧缸的作用下将薄膜压紧至所述坩埚上。
6.根据权利要求5所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述覆膜机构包括驱动辊以及从动辊，所述驱动辊与所述从动辊分设所述输送装置两侧，所述驱动辊通过伺服电机控制旋转，薄膜安装至从动轮上并通过驱动轮拉紧。
7.根据权利要求6所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述从动辊上设置有制动器，所述驱动辊的转轴处安装有编码器，所述编码器用于检测驱动辊的旋转圈数。
8.根据权利要求6所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述从动辊以及所述驱动辊的两端分别通过快拆轴承与所述架体连接。
9.根据权利要求5所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述压紧盖包括盖体以及压紧缸，所述盖体位于所述输送装置以及薄膜的上方，所述压紧缸驱动所述盖体将薄膜压紧至所述坩埚上。
10.根据权利要求8所述的自动化坩埚混匀机，其特征在于，所述盖体的四角底部设置有光杆，所述光杆滑动连接至所述架体上，所述压紧缸固定至所述架体的底面，所述压紧缸通过驱动架驱动四根所述光杆上下移动。
assignee: 青岛金木石实验室科技有限公司

title: Factory production intelligent supervision and management method and system
abstract: The invention discloses an intelligent supervision and management method and system for factory production, and relates to the technical field of production management, and the method comprises the steps: constructing a time difference chain based on an operation behavior, and extracting a fluctuation feature element through a sliding window; performing frequency domain transformation on the fluctuation characteristic elements to obtain a rhythm fluctuation spectrum; calculating a dynamic time warping distance between the rhythm fluctuation spectrum and a historical rhythm reference spectrum to obtain a spectrum deviation descriptor; mapping the spectral deviation descriptors into a standard semantic process flow diagram in a nested manner to form a rhythm process nested diagram; node-level index semantic vectors are extracted from the rhythm process nested graph based on a graph embedding algorithm, multi-dimensional semantic alignment detection is executed, and alignment residual measurement is output; and aggregating the alignment residual measurement, generating a structured dislocation score list, and constructing an abnormal behavior scene graph based on a score threshold. According to the method, the rhythm fluctuation spectrum is generated and semantic nested mapping is carried out, so that the abnormity and semantic dislocation in the production supervision process are identified.
claims:
1.一种工厂生产智能监督管理方法，其特征在于：包括，
基于操作行为构建时间差值链，通过滑动窗口提取窗口内的时间间隔统计特征及行为趋势，生成表征操作节奏的波动特征基元；
对波动特征基元进行频域变换，提取频域能量分布特征并生成节奏波动谱；
计算节奏波动谱与历史节奏参考谱的动态时间规整距离，得到谱偏离描述子；
分配偏离权重值，将谱偏离描述子按偏离权重值嵌套映射至标准语义工艺流程图中，形成节奏工艺嵌套图；
基于图嵌入算法从节奏工艺嵌套图中提取节点级指标语义向量，并执行多维语义对齐检测，输出对齐残差度量；
聚合对齐残差度量，生成结构化错位评分列表，基于评分阈值构建异常行为场景图。
2.如权利要求1所述的工厂生产智能监督管理方法，其特征在于：所述谱偏离描述子用于表征当前窗口内节奏波动谱相较于历史节奏参考谱在主频位置、高频能量分布以及谱形态特征上的整体差异程度；
通过动态时间规整算法，对节奏波动谱与历史节奏参考谱的频率分量进行逐段对齐，计算对齐路径上各对应频率幅值的累积差异值，并根据差异分布生成包含时间偏移补偿的偏离特征向量作为谱偏离描述子。
3.如权利要求1所述的工厂生产智能监督管理方法，其特征在于：所述分配偏离权重值，将谱偏离描述子按偏离权重值嵌套映射至标准语义工艺流程图中，形成节奏工艺嵌套图，具体步骤为，
解析标准语义工艺流程图中的节点标签，匹配与谱偏离描述子关联的工艺阶段标识；
将偏离特征向量按工艺阶段权重分配到对应节点，并在节点属性中记录偏离值及时间戳关联关系，形成节奏工艺嵌套图。
4.如权利要求1所述的工厂生产智能监督管理方法，其特征在于：所述时间差值链由连续操作行为之间的时间间隔构成，并结合操作行为类别和工位标识进行标记；
所述波动特征基元通过设定固定时间窗口，对时间差值链进行滑动提取，并结合窗口内的时间间隔均值、时间间隔方差、时间间隔极差及相邻窗口间的差分趋势生成结构化数据单元。
5.如权利要求1所述的工厂生产智能监督管理方法，其特征在于：所述标准语义工艺流程图为包含多个任务节点和连接关系的有向图结
assignee: 苏州火星视觉创意设计有限公司

title: Fat compositions for baked goods
abstract: Anhydrous fat compositions are described that are solid at 20° C. and include about 3% to about 10% by weight of a lecithin, distilled monoglycerides having an iodine value of less than 50, or a combination thereof. Fat compositions described are suitable for use in making doughs that can be cooked to make baked goods that advantageously maintain an acceptable eating experience over a heated hold time, achieve better eating quality after reheating, and/or exhibit improved flakiness. Also described are methods of making such fat compositions, methods of making doughs containing such fat compositions, packaged and unpackaged doughs containing such fat compositions, methods of making baked goods using the described doughs, and baked goods made using the described doughs.
claims:
1. A fat composition, the fat composition being anhydrous and solid at 20° C., and consisting of at least 99% by weight of a combination of: a. a first component consisting of a bakery compatible fat in an amount of about 90% to about 97% by weight of the composition; and b. a second component consisting of a lecithin, a distilled monoglyceride having an iodine value (IV) of less than 50, or a combination thereof, the second component included in an amount of about 3% to about 10% by weight of the composition.
2. The fat composition of claim 1, wherein the second component consists of a soy lecithin, a sunflower lecithin, or a rapeseed/canola lecithin.
3. The fat composition of claim 1, wherein the fat composition is in a form of chips or flakes.
4. The fat composition of claim 2, wherein the first component has a Mettler Dropping Point (MDP) of greater than 25° C., and consists essentially of (a) a palm oil, a palm oil fraction, palm kernel oil, a palm kernel oil fraction, a coconut oil, a coconut oil fraction, or any interesterified or non-interesterified combination thereof; or (b) an interesterified and/or non-interesterified combination of a liquid oil and a fully hydrogenated oil.
5-8. (canceled)
9. The fat composition of claim 1, wherein the fat composition is in a form of a laminating fat composition.

title: A plant growth navigation system
abstract:
본 발명은 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템에 대한 것으로, 식물 생장과 관련된 영상정보를 포함하는 정보를 기반으로 하여 식물의 생장 정도를 분석하고 이에 따른 식물 생육에 대한 가이드를 제공할 수 있는 시스템이다.
이를 위해, 사용자인 농부 또는 식물관리자가 사용자단말기(2)를 이용하여 획득한 식물의 현재상태 정보를 메인서버(1)로 전송하고 전송된 식물의 현재상태 정보를 판독하고 분석하여 식물의 현재 생육상태를 분석하고 이에 따른 생육의 적정성을 판단한 후 이를 사용자단말기로 전송하여 식물생육에 따른 미래 식물생육형태를 예측할 수 있도록 하거나, 사용자가 식물의 현재상태 정보와 함께 원하는 식물생육형태 예상값을 전송하면 이에 따른 식물 생육환경 조성을 위한 가이드 정보를 전송하는 것을 특징으로 하는 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템을 제공한다.
claims:
청구항 1
삭제
청구항 2
식물 또는 작물의 상태를 분석하고 이를 기반으로 하여 미래의 생육형태를 예측할 수 있도록 하는 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템에 있어서,사용자인 농부 또는 식물관리자가 사용자단말기(2)를 이용하여 획득한 식물의 현재상태 정보를 메인서버(1)로 전송하고 메인서버(1)는 전송된 식물의 현재상태 정보를 판독하고 분석하여 식물의 현재 생육상태를 분석하고 이에 따른 생육의 적정성을 판단한 후 이를 사용자단말기로 전송하여 식물생육에 따른 미래 식물생육형태를 예측할 수 있도록 하거나, 사용자가 식물의 현재상태 정보와 함께 원하는 식물생육형태 예상값을 전송하면 이에 따른 식물 생육환경 조성을 위한 가이드 정보를 전송하되,상기 메인서버(1)는 시스템의 운영을 제어하는 CPU(11)와, 사용자단말기(2)에 전송될 관리용 APP을 저장하고 관리하며 식물생육 관리에 이용되는 데이터를 관리하고 저장하는 메모리(12), 시스템의 망내 및 외부 통신을 관리하는 통신관리부(13), 사용자단말기(2)로부터 통신관리부(13)로 전송된 식물의 현재상태 정보를 판독하는 판독관리부(14) 및 식물의 생육상태를 분석하기 위한 분석식을 탑재하고 탑재된 분석식을 기반으로 식물의 생육상태를 연산하여 분석하는 연산관리부(15)로 구성되며, 상기 사용자단말기(2)는 영상정보를 획득할 수 있는 영상획득디바이스(21)와 획득된 정보를 저장하거나 식물의 생육관련 이력을 저장하며, 메인서버(1)로부터 전송되는 관리용 APP을 저장 및 설치할 수 있도록 하는 메모리(22) 및 영상정보를 실행할 수 있는 디스플레이디바이스(23)가 구비되는 것을 특징으로 하는 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템.
청구항 3
제 2항에 있어서,상기 통신관리부(13)는 메인서버(1)와 사용자단말기(2)의 통신을 관리할 수 있는 망내통신관리모듈과 시스템 이외의 외부와의 통신을 관리할 수 있는 외부통신관리모듈이 더 포함된 것을 특징으로 하는 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템.
청구항 4
제 2항에 있어서,상기 메모리(12)는 통신관리부(13)를 통하여 외부에 별도로 구비되는 외부메모리장치와 연결될 수 있는 것을 특징으로 하는 식물생육 네비게이션 시스템.

title: Shelf stable food with flavor
abstract: Methods are disclosed for making a shelf stable food containing a flavorant having improved intensity over shelf life. Methods include applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces prior to combining the dried fruit pieces with a binder to form an aggregate. Shelf stable foods made according to the disclosed methods are also disclosed.
claims:
1. A method of making a shelf stable food, the method comprising: a. applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces to produce powder coated fruit pieces, the powder coated fruit pieces including the powdered flavorant in an amount of 0.1% to 20% by weight of the dried fruit pieces; b. combining the powder coated fruit pieces with a fluid binder to form an aggregate; and c. setting a structure of the fluid binder in the aggregate to form the shelf stable food including particulates and a set binder, the particulates including the dried fruit pieces having the powdered flavorant localized to the surface of the dried fruit pieces.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the powdered flavorant comprises an encapsulated flavorant.
3. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the step of applying the powdered flavorant to the surface of dried fruit pieces is performed during a delumping process.
4. The method of any of claims 1-3, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of greater than 130° F during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of less than 200° F during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
6. The method of any of claims 1-5, wherein the step of setting the structure of the fluid binder comprises heating the ag

title: High protein food
abstract: Described herein is a food that is suitable for use as a filling or topping for a shelf stable snack. The food has a protein content of at least 25% by weight, and a nut butter content of at least 50% by weight. The food retains a desirable eating experience, similar to a stabilized nut butter spread despite being resistant to melting and deformation during shipping, handling, and storage.

title: Multi-ingredient ephemeral beverage pod for making beverage
abstract: To provide an ingredient pod for making a beverage..SOLUTION: A pod may include multiple layers, and each layer may include a beverage ingredient. The pod may be surrounded by a solid or gel outer layer, and inner layers may be gel, solid or liquid. Each layer may release into a liquid to form a ready-made beverage, providing a different flavor, smell, or ingredient. The pod may also be a multi-chamber pod. Each chamber may include one or more layers, and each layer may include a beverage ingredient. Other aspects of the disclosure relate to a method for making a beverage using a pod. Each layer or chamber of the pod may be activated differently depending on the application or the type of beverage.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2B
claims:
【請求項1】

前記第１の飲料成分が、固体、液体、又はゲルであり、
前記第１の飲料成分及び前記第２の飲料成分のうちの少なくとも１つが、固体であり、
前記第１の飲料成分及び前記第２の飲料成分が、前記飲料液体内の前記ポッドの浸漬に応答して、飲料液体中に放出されるように構成されている、ポッド。

title: Single tank carbonation for carbonated soft drink equipment
abstract: A carbonated beverage dispenser includes a tank to store carbonated water, a carbon dioxide source, and a release valve configured to release gas from the tank. The release valve may be actuated to mix the contents of the tank to increase the temperature homogeny and carbon dioxide homogeny in the tank. The tank may include sensors to monitor the temperature of the water and the amount of carbon dioxide dissolved therein.
claims:
1. A carbonated beverage dispensing system, comprising:
a tank for holding water with carbon dioxide dissolved therein;
a carbon dioxide source configured to deliver carbon dioxide to the tank;
a release valve in communication with the tank and configured to release gas from the tank;
a sensor; and
a release valve configured to actuate to release gas from the tank in response to a signal received from the sensor.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein release valve is configured to open for an actuation period.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein the release valve is configured to open at a pre-determined delay time after water is added to the tank.
4. The system of claim 1, further comprising a solute source configured to add a solute to the water.
5. The system of claim 4, wherein the solute source comprises a syrup pipe configured to pass through the volume of water.
6. The system of claim 1, wherein the sensor comprises a carbon dioxide sensor configured to determine the level carbon dioxide dissolved in water in the tank.

title: Oat-based peanut butter-flavored compositions and methods
abstract: The present disclosure relates to oat-based peanut butter-flavored compositions and methods of making such compositions. In particular, a method is disclosed of roasting substantially intact groats until CIELAB L*-value change per minute, and CIELAB b*-value change per minute achieve a negative slope to produce roasted oats having a peanut butter flavor. Compositions including roasted oats having a peanut butter flavor are also disclosed.
claims:
1. A method of producing roasted oats, the method comprising roasting a plurality of substantially intact groats at a temperature of at least 350° F. to about 600° F. for a time of at least 10 minutes to achieve a negative slope in CIELAB L*-value change per minute, and a negative slope in CIELAB b*-value change minute, where slopes for L*-value change per minute and b*-value change per minute are based on CIELAB measurements at intervals of 5 minutes.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the substantially intact groats are roasted for at least 15 minutes.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein CIELAB a*-value change per minute has a positive slope based on CIELAB measurements at intervals of 5 minutes.
4. The method of claim 1, further comprising a step of inactivating lipase activity in the plurality of substantially intact groats prior to roasting.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the inactivating step includes exposing the plurality of substantially intact groats to steam for sufficient time to inactivate lipase activity.
6. The method of claim 4, wherein inactivating step includes soaking the plurality of substantially intact groats in water or an aqueous solution at a temperature and pressure sufficient to inactivate lipase activity.
7. The method of claim 4, furthe

title: Low sodium food
abstract: To provide a food that has a reduced sodium content while imparting similar level of saltiness.SOLUTION: The low sodium food can be obtained by incorporating naturally occurring compounds having various chemical structures that enhance the salty taste perception of salt into a food. For example, the following compound is incorporated.SELECTED DRAWING: None

title: Compositions and methods for improving taste of non-nutritive sweeteners
abstract: The present disclosure provides a novel sweetener composition of improved taste of the sweetener (e.g., reduced bitterness and/or astringency, and improved overall sweet quality of the composition); food and beverage products containing the same; and methods of making the same.
claims:
1. A sweetener composition, comprising:
(1) a non-nutritive sweetener; and
(2) five or more compounds selected from the group consisting of furfural, 4-hexen-1-ol, trans-2,4-hexadienal, 2,4-hexadien-1-ol, 5-methyl-furfural, delta-tetradecalactone, cis-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, trans-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, butyl acetate, 3-methylbutanol, 2-methylbutanol, ethyl octanoate, ethyl decanoate, and ethyl hexadecanoate.
2. The sweetener composition of claim 1, which is substantially free of any compounds having a molecular weight of greater than 500 daltons, greater than 1000 daltons or greater than 2000 daltons.
3. The sweetener composition of claim 1, wherein
a) the compound furfural is present in an amount from about 6 ppb to about 10 ppm, from about 13 ppb to about 5 ppm, or from about 80 ppb to about 5 ppm;
b) the compound 4-hexen-1-ol is present in an amount from about 0.6 ppb to about 1 ppm, from about 1.3 ppb to about 0.5 ppm, or from about 8 ppb to about 0.5 ppm;
c) the compound trans-2,4-hexadienal is present in an amount from about 2.5 ppb to about 4 ppm, from about 5 ppb to about 2 ppm, or from about 30 ppb to about 2 ppm;
d) the compound 2,4-hexadien-1-ol is present in an amount from about 0.4 ppb to about 4 ppm, from about 2 ppb to about 3 ppm, from about 4 ppb to about 1.5 ppm, or from about 24 ppb

title: Deep cleaning chewing gum
abstract: A chewing gum and a method for preventing staining of teeth are provided. The chewing gum comprises sodium hexametaphosphate in an amount of 0.2% to 2% by weight. The method comprises providing the chewing gum to a consumer.
claims:

title: Hard TACO shell and method for producing the hard TACO shell
abstract: A taco shell (10) is produced by applying a plasticizing agent (coating 100) to a base or spine portion (25) of a hard taco shell, such as by targeted spraying, rolling, brushing or dipping of the taco shell, thereby softening the base or spine portion (25), preferably across a strip width between 4mm-20mm. As a result, when the taco shell (10) is bitten, the softened base portion (25) has some hinging flexibility or pliability which reduces the potential for any crack propagation. Therefore, the structural integrity of the hard taco shell (10) can be better maintained while be eaten, resulting in retention of the fillings and less mess. If desired, an anti- migration agent can also be applied to assure containment of the plasticizing agent in the targeted region.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of producing a hard taco shell having two sidewall portions joined by a base portion comprising applying a plasticizing agent along at least one targeted section of the base portion to soften the at least one targeted section, thereby increasing hinging flexibility or pliability of the at least one targeted section to better maintain an overall structural integrity of the hard taco shell upon subsequent consumption.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width between 4-20mm.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width between 8-16mm.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width of about 14mm.
5. The method of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied as a coating through one of spraying, rolling, brushing or dipping of the taco shell.
6. The method of any one of claims 2-4, wherein the plasticizing agent is glycerin.
7. The method of any one of claims 2-4, wherein the plasticizing agent includes: propylene glycol; sugar alcohols; low molecular weight carbohydrates; and/or polysaccharides.
8. The me

title: Moisture barrier films
abstract: A multilayer moisture barrier film includes at least one desiccant-containing layer disposed adjacent to at least one desiccant free layer, where the at least one desiccant-containing layer comprises a polymeric matrix defining a plurality of cavities and desiccant particles, wherein at least one of the plurality of cavities has at least one desiccant particle in communication therewith.
claims:
1. A barrier film comprising at least one desiccant-containing layer disposed adjacent to at least one desiccant free layer:
the at least one desiccant-containing layer comprising a polymeric matrix defining a plurality of cavities and comprising desiccant particles, wherein at least one of the plurality of cavities has at least one desiccant particle in communication therewith; and
the at least one desiccant free layer a polymer matrix, and the at least one desiccant free layer comprises from about 20% to about 60% of the overall thickness of the packaging film.
2. The film of claim 1, wherein the at least one desiccant free layer comprises from about 30% to about 50% of the overall thickness of the packaging film.
3. The film of claim 1, wherein the at least one desiccant-containing layer comprises from about 0.1 wt. % to about 12 wt. % of the desiccant particles.
4. The film of claim 1, wherein the at least one desiccant-containing layer is uniaxially or biaxially oriented.
5. The film of claim 4, wherein the at least one desiccant-containing layer is biaxially oriented and is oriented 2 to 6 times in the machine direction, and 2 to 6 times in the transverse direction.
6. The film of claim 4, wherein the at least one desiccant-contai

title: Water-retaining hydrogel based on super-hydrophilic polymer as well as preparation method and application of water-retaining hydrogel
abstract: The invention provides water-retaining hydrogel based on a super-hydrophilic polymer as well as a preparation method and application of the water-retaining hydrogel. The water-retaining hydrogel comprises a super-hydrophilic polymer unit and a unit derived from a cross-linking agent. The water retention hydrogel based on the super-hydrophilic polymer has excellent water retention capacity; besides, the water-retaining hydrogel also keeps the inherent flexibility, conductivity and biocompatibility of the hydrogel, is good in universality, can adapt to various complex conditions, not only is beneficial to prolonging the service life of the sensor, but also can keep the stable sensing capacity under various complex environmental conditions, and has a good application prospect. The application range of the hydrogel sensor in the field of flexible electronics is further expanded.
claims:

assignee: 苏州银炙新材料科技有限公司

title: Shelf-stable and satisfying soft-baked snack product
abstract: A shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product (e.g., a soft-baked snack bar) having reduced saturated fat, sodium, and/or sugar levels ("reduced SFSS") compared to prior art soft-baked snack products but that is indulgent and flavorful to the consumer. A dough composition for making reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack products includes a flour component, a fat component consisting of sunflower oil (e.g., high oleic sunflower oil), and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose. Sodium-containing leaveners are partially or completely replaced, e.g., by potassium bicarbonate. If present, cocoa powder is used in reduced amounts compared to prior art soft-baked snack products. A method of making a reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product includes a step of baking the dough composition.
claims:
1. A dough composition for making a shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product having reduced saturated fat, sodium and/or sugar levels ("reduced SFSS"), the composition comprising: a flour component; a fat component consisting of sunflower oil; and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose.
2. The dough composition of claim 1, wherein the flour component comprises at least 20% of the dough composition.
3. The dough composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the sunflower oil is high oleic sunflower oil.
4. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the sucrose-free sugar component comprises a flavor modulator that enhances sweetness upfront and a flavor modulator that enhances long lasting sweetness.
5. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the sucrose-free sugar component includes inulin or its hydrolyzed form, oligofructose.
6. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-5, further comprising potassium bicarbonate.
7. A reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product comprising: a flour component; a fat component consisting of sunflower oil; and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose.

title: Animal food composition comprising source of glycyrrhizin
abstract: The present disclosure relates to an animal food composition comprising a source of glycyrrhizin for use in the prevention and/or treatment of allergic inflammatory skin diseases wherein the animal food composition is formulated to provide glycyrrhizin to the animal in an amount of at least about 0.02 mg/kg body weight per day.

title: Emergency door opening device for drying oven
abstract: The utility model discloses a baking oven emergency door opening device which comprises a baking oven body, a door opening assembly is installed in the baking oven body and comprises a shaft seat, the shaft seat is fixedly connected to the baking oven body, a lead screw shaft is connected into the shaft seat in a threaded mode, one end of the lead screw shaft is fixedly connected with a locking block, and the other end of the lead screw shaft is fixedly connected with a second handle. A third handle is hinged to the second handle, a torsional spring is installed in the second handle, one end of the torsional spring is arranged on the third handle, the other end of the torsional spring is arranged on the second handle, a plug pin is hinged to the third handle, and the plug pin is slidably connected to the second handle; according to the oven, the door opening assembly is additionally arranged in the oven body, the door opening assembly drives the lead screw shaft through the second handle to enable the locking block to be separated from the fixing rod, and therefore the second oven door is opened in the oven body, the use safety of the oven body is improved, and due to the fact that the door opening assembly is of a pure mechanical structure, good reliability is achieved.
claims:

title: Food Safety Method
abstract: Methods for inoculating a grain suitable for use in testing methods of reducing bacterial load are disclosed. Also disclosed are methods of reducing bacterial load on a grain by using elevated temperature and an organic acid. Also disclosed are methods of tempering a grain at an elevated temperature and reduced time as compared to standard tempering methods.
claims:
1. A producing a flour, the method comprising:
a. heating grain in the absence of a tempering solution to a temperature of at least 115° F. to produce heated grain,
b. adding a tempering solution to the heated grain to arrive at a moisture content of 12% to 20% to produce a tempering mixture,
c. incubating the tempering mixture at a temperature of least 115° F. for sufficient time to achieve a tempered grain, and
d. milling the tempered grain to produce the flour.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the heating step and incubating step are performed at a temperature of from 115° F. to 170° F.
3. The method of claim 1, further comprising a step of adjusting the temperature of the tempering solution to a temperature of within 5° F. of the heated grain.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the tempering solution includes an organic acid.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the organic acid includes lactic acid, peracetic acid, acetic acid, citric acid or salicylic acid.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the organic acid is lactic acid.
7. The method of claim 4, wherei

title: Taste receptor internalization assay
abstract: This disclosure provides a taste receptor internalization assay useful for identifying taste modulators.
claims:
REIVINDICACIONES
1. title: Sweetening compositions
abstract: This disclosure provides aqueous steviol glycoside compositions as well as syrups and beverages comprising these compositions. In certain embodiments, the aqueous steviol glycoside composition comprises water and a sweetening composition, wherein the sweetening composition is solubilized in the water and comprises a stevioside composition and rebaudioside D.

2. The complex of claim 1, wherein the stevioside and the rebaudioside D are present in the complex at a ratio of from about 1:1 to about 12:1 by weight.
3. The complex of claim 1, wherein the stevioside and the rebaudioside D are present in the complex at a ratio of from about 2:1 to about 7:1 by weight.
4. The complex of claim 1, wherein the stevioside and the rebaudioside D are present in the complex at a ratio of about 2:1, about 3:1, about 5:1 or about 6:1 by weight.

water; and
the complex of claim 1.

7. The aqueous steviol glycoside composition of claim 6, wherein the rebaudioside D is present in the water at a concentration ranging from about 0.5 weight percent to about 1.5 weight percent.

title: Compounds that modulate GPRC6a receptor and pet food products containing the same
abstract: The presently disclosed subject matter relates to compounds and/or flavor compositions for enhancing palatability of pet food products. The presently disclosed subject matter also relates to compounds that modulate the activity of a GPRC6A taste receptor.
claims:
069269.0689 PATENT WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A pet food product comprising: a) one or more compounds that bind to a GPRC6A receptor or a functional fragment thereof; or b) a flavor composition comprising one or more compounds that bind to a GPRC6A receptor or a functional fragment thereof.
2. The pet food product of claim 1, wherein the pet food product has enhanced palatability.
3. The pet food product of claim 1 or 2, wherein the one or more compound increases, decreases or modulates the biological activity of the GPRC6A receptor.
4. The pet food product of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the one or more compound is selected from the group consisting of amino acids, peptides, hormones, ions, metals, butanoic acid-based compounds, propanoic acid-based compounds, pentanoic acid-based compounds, carboxylic acid-based compounds, derivatives thereof, and combinations thereof.
5. The pet food product of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the one or more compound has an EC50 value of no more than about 50 mM in connection with a biological activity of the GPRC6A receptor.
6. The pet food product of any one of claims 1-5, wherein the compound has the formula: .

title: Product information high-precision tracing auxiliary tool
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of product information, in particular to a high-precision traceability auxiliary tool for product information, which comprises a fixing seat, a threaded sleeve and a screw rod, the threaded sleeve is meshed with the screw rod through a screw hole, a hydraulic cylinder is mounted at the top of the threaded sleeve, a fixing frame is mounted at the top of the hydraulic cylinder, and the fixing frame is fixedly connected with the threaded sleeve. Second bearings are embedded in the two sides of the fixing frame correspondingly, fixing rods are fixedly installed on inner rings of the two second bearings correspondingly, air cylinders are installed at the opposite ends of the two fixing rods correspondingly, clamping plates are installed at the opposite ends of the two air cylinders correspondingly, and an information recorder body is clamped and fixed to the opposite sides of the two clamping plates; a servo motor is installed on the side face of the fixing frame. The information recorder has the advantages that a worker can conveniently adjust the information recorder body correspondingly according to the size of a packaging box on a production line and the position of a product information label, the workload of the worker is reduced, and the complete recording of product information is guaranteed.
claims:
1.一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，包括固定座(1)和螺套(12)，其特征在于：所述固定座(1)顶部两侧分别焊接有支撑板(2)，两个所述支撑板(2)分别嵌入安装有轴承一(3)，两个所述轴承一(3)内环分别固定安装有丝杆(13)，所述螺套(12)通过螺孔与丝杆(13)啮合连接，所述螺套(12)顶部安装有液压缸(4)，所述液压缸(4)顶部安装有固定架(5)，所述固定架(5)两侧分别嵌入安装有轴承二(6)，两个所述轴承二(6)内环分别固定安装有固定杆(19)，两个所述固定杆(19)相对的一端分别安装有气缸(16)，两个所述气缸(16)相对的一端分别安装有夹板(10)，两个所述夹板(10)相对一侧夹持固定有信息记录器本体(7)，所述固定架(5)侧面安装有伺服电机(11)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述丝杆(13)一端焊接有手轮(15)，手轮(15)与支撑板(2)相平行。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述螺套(12)底部安装有滑块(18)，固定座(1)顶部开设有滑槽(17)，滑块(18)和滑槽(17)滑动连接。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述信息记录器本体(7)顶部安装有接线头(8)。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述信息记录器本体(7)前端安装有摄像机构(9)。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述伺服电机(11)传动端设有连轴杆，连轴杆与固定架(5)侧面的固定杆(19)固定连接。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种产品信息高精度追溯辅助工具，其特征在于：所述固定座(1)四角处分别开设有固定孔(14)，固定孔(14)贯穿固定座(1)上下两端。

title: Compositions and comestibles
abstract: D-psicose/erythritol compositions comprise, in combination, D-psicose and erythritol as sweeteners together with one or more other edible ingredients. Comestibles are provided, including beverage products and other food products, comprising the novel D-psicose/erythritol compositions. D-psicose and erythritol may each be present in a comestible in a concentration sufficient independently of the other to perceptibly sweeten the composition. An additional sweetener component and other ingredients may be included in the formulation.
claims:
1-17. (canceled)
18. A ready-to-drink beverage product comprising: carbonated water, D-psicose in an at least a sweetening amount, but not more than 2.1 wt. %, erythritol in an at least a sweetening amount, but not more than 3.5 wt. %, acidulant comprising at least one acid, rebaudioside M in a concentration between about 50 ppm and about 600 ppm, a sweetening amount of rebaudioside D, a sweetening amount of rebaudioside A, and wherein the beverage product has a pH between 3.0 and 3.5.
19. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 18, wherein rebaudioside M is present in a concentration of about 100 ppm, about 200 ppm, about 300 ppm, about 400 ppm, or about 500 ppm.
20. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 18, wherein rebaudioside A is present in an amount up to 0.05 wt. % and rebaudioside D is present in an amount up to 0.05 wt. %.
21. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 18, wherein rebaudioside A is present in an amount of 0.01 wt. % to 0.03 wt. % and rebaudioside D is present in an amount of 0.01 wt. % to 0.03 wt. %.
22. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 18, wherein D-psicose is present in an amount of 0.5 wt. % to 2.1 wt. %, erythritol is present in an amount of 0.5 wt. % to 3.5 wt. %, rebaudioside M is present in an amount of 0.0

title: System, method, and apparatus for collecting confectionery products
abstract: A system, method, and media permit a computing system to access information associated with one or more distribution points comprising a distribution network. The computing system can receive a request from a first user to access a first distribution point of the one or more distribution points and determine that the first user has permission to access the first distribution point. The computing system can determine an account of a second user associated with the first distribution point and transmit, from the account of the second user to an account associated with the first user, one or more credits. The computing system can update one or more properties of the distribution network based on the transmittal.
claims:
1. A method comprising, by a computing device:
obtaining a current location of a first client device;
generating, for the first client device, a graphical user interface (GUI) comprising a perspective map interface centered on the current location of the first client device and a counter of confectionary credits;
accessing a database that comprises a list of virtual doorways and corresponding physical addresses, and determining a subset of virtual doorways of the list of virtual doorways that can be visible on the GUI based on the current location of the first client device and settings associated with each of one or more distribution points comprised in a confectionery distribution network, wherein the one or more distribution points are represented by the subset of virtual doorways on the GUI;
sending, to the first client device, instructions for visualizing the subset of virtual doorways on the GUI of the first client device;
when multiple virtual doorways of the subset of virtual doorways are located at a same physical address, generating a single virtual doorway icon in the GUI that indicates a number of the multiple virtual doorways located at a particular location in the GUI corresponding to the same physical address;
registering a first account with the computing device via a mobile application executed on the first client device, linking a particular virtual doorway of the subset of virtual doorways to the first account, obtaining location sensor data from a Global Positioning System (GPS) receiver of the first client device, automati

title: Confectionary with improved opacity
abstract: A confectionary that contains 3.0% to 3.5% of a short fiber length cellulose is described. The confectionary maintains a good opacity and texture after heating and good visual and textural stability over shelflife or at least one freeze/thaw cycle. A confectionary can typically have a relatively high moisture content, relatively low fat content, and relatively low non-fat solids content and retain the desired stability, opacity, and texture attributes. In some cases, a confectionary can exclude certain ingredients that consumers prefer to avoid.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A confectionary, comprising: a. cellulose in an amount of 3.0% to 3.5% by weight of the confectionary, the cellulose having an average fiber length of less than 35 pm; b. a fat content of about 10% to about 20% by weight of the confectionary, with at least 75% of the fat content being provided by a structuring fat having a melting point above room temperature; c. a water content of at least 30% by weight of the confectionary; d. a non-fat total solids content of 35% to 45% by weight of the confectionary; and e. essentially no titanium dioxide and essentially no calcium carbonate.
2. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the amount of cellulose is about 3.2% to about 3.4% by weight of the confectionary.
3. The confectionary of claim 1 or 2, wherein the cellulose has an average fiber length of about 20pm to about 25 pm.
4. The confectionary of claim 3, wherein the cellulose has a particle size where least 95% of the particles pass through a No. 400 US Mesh Size sieve.
5. The confectionary of any of claims 1-4, wherein the non-fat solids content comprises sweet whey solids in an amount of about 3% to about 4.5% by weight of the confectionary.
6. The confectionary of any of claims 1-5, wherein the confectionary has a sugar content of less than 40% by weight of the confectionary.

title: Recyclable pouch having reseal closure overlapping an edge seal, formed from rollstock film, on high speed packaging machinery
abstract: Recyclable pouches formed from rollstock and having a resealable closure that extends into both side edges of the pouch may be produced at high speeds on a single manufacturing line in which the pouches are formed, cut apart, filled, and then sealed if the film forming the pouch comprises a recyclable heat seal layer and a second recyclable layer having a melting temperature of at least 30° C. greater than the heat seal layer.
claims:
1. A method for forming a filled recyclable pouch having a sealing closure that extends to side edges of the pouch, the method performed by horizontal form-fill-seal (HFFS) equipment, the method comprising:
(a) providing a multi-ply film rollstock having a heat seal layer and a second layer having a melting temperature of at least 30° C. greater than a melting temperature of the heat seal layer, wherein the multi-ply film is recyclable;
(b) providing an elongate source of resealable closure;
(c) providing an article to be placed in the pouch;
(d) advancing a leading portion of the multi-ply film from the rollstock through the HFFS equipment;
(e) folding the advancing film such that the heat seal layer on a first side of the folded film is adjacent the heat seal layer on a second side of the folded film;
(e) applying the elongate source of resealable closure to the folded film such that the elongate source of resealable closure contacts the heat seal layer of the first side of the folded film and contacts the heat seal layer of the second side of the folded film;
(f) applying heat and pressure to the folded film and applied elongate source of resealable closure to seal the elongate source of resealable closure to the heat seal layers of the first and second sides of the folded film, wherein the heat and pressure are applied to locations of the folded film that correspond to the side edges of the pouch to be formed, wherein the application of heat and pressure cause the elongate source of

title: Sugar content detection device
abstract: The utility model discloses a sugar content detection device and relates to the field of food detection. The device comprises a bottom plate, a clamping plate, a moving block and a mounting plate, and is characterized in that the clamping plate is fixedly mounted on the outer surface of one side of the upper end of the bottom plate, the clamping plate is designed to be L-shaped, guide rails are oppositely arranged on the two sides in the bottom plate, the moving block is movably mounted in the guide rails, the mounting plate is fixedly mounted on one side of the moving block, and the mounting plate is fixedly mounted on the other side of the moving block. And a connecting rod with an adjustable position is mounted at the upper end of the mounting plate. According to the device, rapid position installation can be achieved through the clamping plate structure, rapid detection of the beverage sugar content is achieved through cooperation of the inductor with the position capable of being conveniently adjusted and the processor, and the problem that an existing sugar detection device lacks rapid and convenient detection is solved.
claims:
1.一种糖度含量检测装置，包括底板(1)、卡板(3)、移动块(7)和安装板(9)，其特征在于：所述卡板(3)固定安装于所述底板(1)上端一侧外表面，所述卡板(3)呈L型设计；
所述底板(1)内部两侧对设置有导轨(2)，所述导轨(2)内部移动安装有移动块(7)，所述移动块(7)一侧固定安装有安装板(9)，所述安装板(9)上端安装有位置可调的连接杆(4)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种糖度含量检测装置，其特征在于：所述导轨(2)内部一侧内壁设置有齿条(6)，所述移动块(7)内部转动安装有齿轮(13)，所述齿轮(13)与所述齿条(6)配合安装。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种糖度含量检测装置，其特征在于：所述移动块(7)一侧外壁固定安装有电机(10)，所述电机(10)的输出轴与所述齿轮(13)一侧转动中心固定连接。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种糖度含量检测装置，其特征在于：所述连接杆(4)材料为塑性材料，可以变换任意造型，且所述连接杆(4)头部安装有感应器(5)，所述安装板(9)一侧固定安装有处理器(8)，所述感应器(5)与所述处理器(8)相适配。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种糖度含量检测装置，其特征在于：所述底板(1)一侧外壁设置有防护板(11)，所述防护板(11)与所述底板(1)之间固定安装有弹簧(12)。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种糖度含量检测装置，其特征在于：所述移动块(7)内部呈偏心工字型设计，且所述移动块(7)内部一侧外壁与所述导轨(2)一侧内壁贴合。
