title: petfood
abstract: Disclosed herein is a method of forming a petfood, the method comprising: providing an aqueous first liquid, in which is dispersed an animal-derived product or a meat analogue and in which is dissolved a hydrocolloid, wherein the hydrocolloid is an ionotropic gelling agent; contacting droplets of the aqueous first liquid with a second liquid, the second liquid having cations dissolved or dispersed therein, to form gelled droplets comprising the animal-derived product or the meat analogue, and a metal ion- hydrocolloid; separating the gelled droplets from the second liquid containing the cations; combining the gelled droplets with a third liquid comprising water and a thickener, optionally sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener. Also disclosed herein is a petfood made according to the method. Other methods and petfoods are also described.
claims:
Claims
1. A method of forming a petfood, the method comprising: providing an aqueous first liquid, in which is dispersed an animal-derived product or a meat analogue and in which is dissolved a hydrocolloid, wherein the hydrocolloid is an ionotropic gelling agent; contacting droplets of the aqueous first liquid with a second liquid, the second liquid having cations dissolved or dispersed therein, to form gelled droplets comprising the animal-derived product or the meat analogue, and a metal ionhydrocolloid; separating the gelled droplets from the second liquid containing the cations; combining the gelled droplets with a third liquid comprising water and a thickener, optionally sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener.
2. A method according to claim 1 , wherein an alkaline substance is present in one or in all of the first, second and third liquid.
3. A method according to claim 2, wherein the alkaline substance is an alkali metal carbonate.
4. A method according to claim 2 or claim 3, wherein one or all of the first, second and third liquid have pH of greater than 6, optionally 6.5 or more, optionally 7 or more, optionally 7 to 9.
5. A method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the method involves sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener by heating the droplets to a temperature of 70 °C or more, opti

title: Automatic local delivery center
abstract: A system for automatically selling and delivering products to consumers is provided. The system may include a mobile delivery unit, a product dispenser, and a web server. The system may also include a pickup area. The web server may instruct the product dispenser to dispense a product to the mobile delivery unit. The web server may also provide instructions to the mobile delivery unit, which may then navigate to the consumer for delivery.
claims:
1.一种用于向消费者自动出售和递送产品的系统，所述系统包括：
移动递送单元；
产品分配器，所述产品分配器被配置为在第一交易中将第一产品分配给所述移动递送单元以便随后递送到远离所述产品分配器的第一消费者，并且在第二交易中将第二产品分配给所述产品分配器处的第二消费者；和
web服务器，所述web服务器与所述产品分配器和所述移动递送单元通信并且被配置为指示所述产品分配器在所述第一交易中将所述第一产品分配给所述移动递送单元。
2.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述web服务器被进一步配置为确定在所述移动递送单元与所述第二消费者之间分配的优先级。
3.根据权利要求2所述的系统，其中所述优先级基于产品订单时间、产品可用性以及所述移动递送单元和所述第二消费者到达所述产品分配器的到达时间中的至少一者。
4.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述web服务器被配置为从所述第一消费者的电子设备接收针对所述第一产品的订单。
5.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述移动递送单元包括用于导航到所述产品分配器的传感器。
6.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述移动递送单元被配置为将所述第一产品递送到拾取区域，并且
其中基于所述第一消费者的选择、与所述第一消费者的接近度和温度控制能力中的至少一者来确定所述拾取区域。
7.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述产品分配器包括通信组件，所述通信组件被配置为与所述web服务器和所述移动递送单元中的至少一者通信。
8.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述移动递送单元包括通信组件，所述通信组件被配置为与所述web服务器和所述产品分配器中的至少一者通信。
9.根据权利要求1所述的系统，其中所述产品分配器是饮料分配器。
10.一种向消费者自动出售和递送产品的方法，所述方法包括：
在电子设备上显示预定区域中可用的产品列表；
接收对所述电子设备上的所述产品列表中的产品的选择；
指示移动递送单元取回所述产品；以及
指示所述移动递送单元将所述产品递送到所述消费者。
11.根据权利要求10所述的方法，所述方法还包括：

title: Packaged Dough Product and Method of Packaging
abstract: A packaged food product includes a container having therein a cup for a food ingredient, at least one dough product and a plastic separator interposed between the cup and the at least one dough product. The separator includes a main body portion seated upon a rim of the cup, with the main body portion having a peripheral side surface in frictional engagement with an inner sidewall of the container. The separator also includes a column support extending from the main body portion and abutting a bottom of the cup. In a preferred embodiment, the column support takes an inverted frustoconical shape and is hollow, thereby enabling multiple separators to be nested for shipping and storing purposes. When the dough product(s) proof within the container, forces applied to the separator from the developed pressure are transferred through the main body portion and the column support to the bottom of the cup.
claims:
1. A packaged food product comprising:
a container including at least one sidewall, closed ends and an interior cavity;
a cup within the container, wherein the cup includes at least one sidewall, a bottom wall and an upper rim defining an opening, opposite the bottom wall, leading to an interior storage cavity of the cup;
at least one food ingredient within the cup;
at least one dough product within the interior cavity of the container; and
a separator interposed between the cup and the at least one dough product, said separator including a main body portion positioned upon the upper rim of the cup and a column support extending from the main body portion and abutting the bottom of the cup.
2. The packaged food product of claim 1, wherein the column support extends from a central portion of the main body portion.
3. The packaged food product of claim 2, wherein the column support is hollow.
4. The packaged food product of claim 3, wherein the main body portion includes an opening leading into the hollow column support.
5. The packaged food product of claim 4, wherein the hollow column support is inverted frustoconical in shape.

title: Machine pressure switching mechanism of air compressor
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of air compressors, and discloses an air compressor machine pressure switching mechanism which comprises an air compressor body, one end of the air compressor body is connected with an exhaust pipe, the interior of the exhaust pipe is connected with a connecting channel, and a machine pressure switching mechanism body is arranged in the exhaust pipe. Through the arrangement of the first blade, the second blade, the connecting round rod, the engine mounting rack, the engine body, the transmission round rod, the storage battery and the transmission belt, in the actual use, the first blade and the second blade can be driven to rotate through mechanical pressure through the arrangement of the mechanical pressure conversion mechanism body, so that the mechanical pressure conversion mechanism is convenient to use. According to the air compressor, the engine body is made to generate electricity, the electricity is stored in the storage battery, and therefore the problems that pressure energy of a traditional air compressor cannot be well utilized, energy utilization is not well optimized, the pressure energy is wasted, and long-term reasonable utilization of resources is not facilitated are effectively solved.
claims:
1.一种空压机机压转换机构，包括空压机主体(110)，所述空压机主体(110)的一端连接有排气管(111)，所述排气管(111)的内部连接有连接通道(112)，其特征在于，所述排气管(111)的内部设置有机压转换机构本体，所述机压转换机构本体包括第一桨片(113)和第二桨片(114)，所述第一桨片(113)和第二桨片(114)之间连接有连接圆杆(115)，所述空压机主体(110)的顶端连接有发动机安装机架(116)，所述发动机安装机架(116)的顶端固定安装有发动机本体(117)，所述发动机本体(117)的一端连接有传动圆杆(118)，所述发动机安装机架(116)的底端安装有蓄电池(119)，所述连接圆杆(115)上通过带轮连接有传动带(120)，且所述传动带(120)通过带轮可驱动传动圆杆(118)进行转动。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种空压机机压转换机构，其特征在于：所述传动带(120)的外部设置有防护外壳(121)，且所述防护外壳(121)的外壁表面涂覆有防锈油漆。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种空压机机压转换机构，其特征在于：所述排气管(111)的内壁上开设有第一螺纹槽(122)，所述连接通道(112)的外表面开设有第二螺纹槽(123)，且所述第一螺纹槽(122)与所述第二螺纹槽(123)相适配。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种空压机机压转换机构，其特征在于：所述空压机主体(110)的底端设置有缓冲底座(124)，所述缓冲底座(124)的底端设置有支撑底板(125)，所述支撑底板(125)与缓冲底座(124)之间通过四个缓冲杆(126)连接。
5.根据权利要求4所述的一种空压机机压转换机构，其特征在于：所述缓冲杆(126)皆由阻尼器以及缓冲弹簧组装而成。
6.根据权利要求4所述的一种空压机机压转换机构，其特征在于：所述支撑底板(125)的底端可拆卸安装有防滑套垫(127)，且所述防滑套垫(127)的材质为橡胶。
assignee: 郑州百事饮料有限公司

title: Pet food compositions and methods for modifying stool quality
abstract: Hydrolyzed keratin-containing materials, methods of preparing such materials, and compositions that include such materials are described. The method can include combining a keratin-containing material with an acid, processing the keratin-containing material by steam hydrolysis, and reducing a particle size of the keratin-containing material. The hydrolyzed keratin-containing material can include 1.0% by weight or less of lanthionine, relative to the total weight of the hydrolyzed keratin-containing material.
claims:
1. A method for preparing a hydrolyzed keratin-containing material, the method comprising:
combining a keratin-containing material with an acid;
processing the keratin-containing material by steam hydrolysis; and
reducing a particle size of the keratin-containing material to a d50 particle size of 100 μm or less.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the keratin-containing material is combined with the acid to achieve a pH ranging from about 2 to about 5 before and/or during processing by steam hydrolysis.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein reducing the particle size occurs before combining with the acid, before the processing by steam hydrolysis, and/or after the processing by steam hydrolysis.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the processing by steam hydrolysis is performed at a pressure of from about 0 to about 100 psig.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the keratin-containing material comprises feathers, hair, wool, beaks, hide, bristles, horns, hooves, claws, nails, scales, or a mixture thereof.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the hydrolyzed keratin-containing material comprises 1.0% by weight or less of lanthionine, relative to the total weight of the hydrolyzed ker

title: Dough-based food product and method of preparing
abstract: A dough- or batter-based food product is prepared by mixing dough or batter ingredients to establish a dough or batter composition, the dough ingredients including at least flour, water and salt. The salt particles have dissolution rate of at least 120 seconds. Batter or dough provided herein, and cooked foods made from the batter or dough, include pockets of salt at a higher concentration than the dough, batter, or cooked food overall. Batter- or dough-based food products provided have a saltiness perception level substantially the same as compared to batter- or dough-based food products that include table salt in an amount at least 40% greater than the provided batter- or dough-based food product.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A method of producing a packaged dough having a shelf life of over a period of 8 weeks at
10. F and formulated to produce a baked good when baked, wherein the baked good has a saltiness perception level substantially the same as compared to a first control baked good produced from a first control dough having the same formulation as the packaged dough, with the exception of the first control dough having salt particles with a dissolution rate of 100 seconds or less and containing at least 40% more salt particles by weight than the packaged dough, the method comprising: a. mixing flour, water, and encapsulated or unencapsulated salt particles, wherein, with unencapsulated salt particles, the unencapsulated salt particles have a dissolution rate of
12. seconds to 200 seconds and, with encapsulated salt particles, the encapsulated salt particles are salt particles encapsulated with a material in order to modify the dissolution rate of the salt particles to a dissolution rate of 120 seconds to 200 seconds, to form a dough having at least 10% of the salt particles being at least partially undissolved and having dissolved salt that is non- homogeneously distributed throughout the dough; b. forming the dough into pieces; c. packaging the dough pieces; and d. storing the packaged dough pieces, including the at least partially undissolved and dissolved salt, in a frozen state.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the baked good is a biscuit, scone, bread, pizza crust, dinner roll, or sweet roll.
3. A food product comprising a packaged dough, the packaged dou

title: Low sugar, high protein confection
abstract: A low or no sugar, high protein confection is described. A confection includes a beneficial combination of soluble fiber, whey protein, glycerol and fat at an acidic pH and particular Brix range to mimic the texture and mouthfeel of caramel or cream confection. Methods of making a confection are also described.
claims:
1. A confection, the confection being a caramel-like confection or a cream-like confection and comprising less than 2% sugar by weight, the confection including: a. soluble fiber having a DP of less than 10, the soluble fiber in an amount of about 30% to about 70% by dry weight of the confection; b. whey protein in an amount of at least 7% to about 25% by dry weight of the confection; c. glycerol in an amount of about 5% to about 18% by dry weight of the confection; d. a fat in an amount of from about 5% to about 20% by dry weight of the confection; and e. emulsifier in an amount of up to 5% by dry weight of the confection; wherein the confection has a pH of less than 6, a Brix of 80-85° Bx at room temperature, a viscosity of less than 1×102 Pa*s at 10 l/s at 70° C., and a viscosity of more than 4×101 Pa*s at 10 l/s at 40° C.
2. The confection of claim 1, wherein the soluble fiber comprises inulin.
3. The confection of claim 1, wherein the soluble fiber is included in an amount of about 40% to about 70% by dry weight of the confection.
4. The confection of claim 1, wherein the whey protein is included in an amount of about 8% to about 15% by dry weight of the confection.
5. The confection of claim 1, wherein the glycerol is included in an amount of about 8% to about 12%

title: High fat extruded protein product and method of making
abstract: A method of preparing a high fat extruded protein product includes feeding water, a first fat, and a blend of plant proteins to an extruder to produce an extruded protein mixture. The extruded protein mixture is directed through a cooling die and divided into pieces, with the pieces being subsequently tumbled with oil. The resulting high fat extruded protein product will have at least 15-23% total fat by weight and, upon cooking, exhibits a desirable grease-out effect (e.g., reminiscent of a traditional pepperoni product). The blend of plant proteins preferably includes soy protein, wheat gluten and a grain or starch-based ingredient, and makes up at least 40-50%, by weight, of the high fat extruded protein product.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of preparing a high fat extruded protein product, comprising: feeding water, a first fat, and a blend of plant proteins to an extruder to produce an extruded protein mixture; dividing the extruded protein mixture into pieces; and tumbling the pieces with oil to drive the oil into the pieces.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the blend of plant proteins includes soy protein, wheat gluten and a grain or starch-based ingredient.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the blend of plant proteins consists of soy protein, wheat gluten and rice flour.
4. The method of any one of claims 1-3, further comprising feeding meat to the extruder, wherein the meat constitutes no greater than 30% by weight of the high fat extruded protein product and the blend of plant proteins constitutes at least 40-50% by weight of the high fat extruded protein product.
5. The method of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the blend of plant proteins is a dry mix and the first fat is mixed with the dry mix prior to the water.
6. The method of any one of claims 1-3, further comprising cooling the extruded protein mixture by passing the extruded protein mixture through a cooling die.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein

title: Systems and methods for dosing a flowable solid
Feline food composition
abstract: Nutritionally complete feline food compositions comprising EPA/DHA and carbohydrates are disclosed herein. These nutritionally complete feline food compositions can be used in dry or wet food composition. The compositions can be used to for preventing and/or treating cardiac hypertrophy in feline animals, such as cats.
claims:
1. A method for preventing and/or treating cardiac hypertrophy in a feline in need thereof comprising at least a step of feeding the feline with a nutritionally complete feline food composition comprising eicosapentaenoic acid/docosahexaenoic acid (EPA/DHA) and 5 carbohydrates, wherein: (a) the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a dry food composition comprising: (i) EPA/DHA in an amount of at least about 0.5 gram per megacalories (g/Mcal); (ii) Nitrogen Free Extract in an amount of no more than about 60 g/Mcal; and(iii) 10 starch in an amount of no more than about 50 g/Mcal, or (b) the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a wet food composition comprising: (i) EPA/DHA in an amount of at least about 1.0 g/Mcal; 15          (ii) Nitrogen Free Extract in an amount of no more than about 35 g/Mcal; and (iii) starch in an amount of no more than about 20 g/Mcal.
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a dry food; and 20          wherein the dry food composition comprises protein in an amount of at least about 115 g/Mcal, or wherein the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a wet food; and wherein the wet food composition comprises protein in an amount of at least about 25

title: Electronic paper blessing device and electronic paper blessing system which need return to temple regularly for updating information
abstract: 一種需要定期回廟以進行資訊更新的電子紙祈福裝置，其包括電子紙顯示器、造型殼體、資料接收裝置及近端感應裝置。電子紙顯示器根據顯示資料顯示對應的畫面。造型殼體具有顯示區及非顯示區，電子紙顯示器設置於顯示區，資料接收裝置及近端感應裝置設置於非顯示區。資料接收裝置電性連接電子紙顯示器，並將顯示資料傳送給電子紙顯示器。近端感應裝置用於與設置寺廟空間的近端開通裝置相互感應，近端感應裝置與近端開通裝置在相互感應後，近端開通裝置指示其電性連接的顯示更新裝置傳遞其儲存之更新的顯示資料給資料接收裝置，進行資訊更新。
claims:
1. 一種需要定期回廟以進行資訊更新的電子紙祈福裝置，包括： 一電子紙顯示器(10)，用於根據一顯示資料顯示對應的一畫面； 一造型殼體(11)，具有一顯示區，以供該電子紙顯示器(10)設置於該顯示區； 一資料接收裝置(12)，設置於該造型殼體(11)的一非顯示區，電性連接該電子紙顯示器(10)，用於將該顯示資料傳送給該電子紙顯示器(10)； 一近端感應裝置(14)，設置於該造型殼體(11)的該非顯示區，用於與設置一寺廟空間的一近端開通裝置(20)相互感應，其中該近端感應裝置(14)與該近端開通裝置(20)在相互感應後，該近端開通裝置(20)指示其電性連接的一顯示更新裝置(21)傳遞其儲存之更新的該顯示資料給該資料接收裝置(12)。
2. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，更包括： 一計時裝置(13)，設置於該造型殼體(11)的該非顯示區，電性連接該資料接收裝置(12)，用於在電子紙祈福裝置(1)被開通後，進行計時，並於一計時值到一第一特定時間後，禁能該資料接收裝置(12)； 其中該近端感應裝置(14)電性連接該計時裝置(13)，且在該近端感應裝置(14)與該近端開通裝置(20)在相互感應後，重置該計時裝置(13)的該計時值與使能該資料接收裝置(12)。
3. 如請求項2    所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中於該資料接收裝置(12)被禁能後，該資料接收裝置(12)使該電子紙顯示器(10)所顯示的該畫面被清除或維持該畫面。
4. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中該近端感應裝置(14)儲存有該電子紙祈福裝置(1)的一第一裝置識別，該近端開通裝置(20)接收該第一裝置識別，並驗證該第一裝置識別，以判斷感應到該近端感應裝置(14)。
5. 如請求項4所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中該近端開通裝置(20)儲存有一第二裝置識別，該近端感應裝置(14)接收該第二裝置識別，並驗證該第二裝置識別後，以判斷感應到該近端開通裝置(20)。
6. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，更包括： 一行為感測裝置(15)，電性連接該近端感應裝置(14)，用於感應到一用戶的一特定行為後，於一第二特定時間內使能該近端感應裝置(14)與該近端開通裝置(20)感應。
7. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中該資料接收裝置(12)為一無線資料接收裝置，以及該顯示更新裝置(21)為一無線資料傳送裝置；或者，該資料接收裝置(12)為一有線資料接收裝置，該顯示更新裝置(21)為一有線資料傳送裝置，且該資料接收裝置(12)與該顯示更新裝置(21)以有線方式通訊連接。
8. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中電子紙顯示器(10)為一特定形狀。
9. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中該電子紙祈福裝置(1)的外觀為一錢母、一香符、一公仔、一祈福燈或一擺飾件。
10. 如請求項1所述的電子紙祈福裝置，其中該近端感應裝置(14)與該近端開通裝置(20)之間的一感應距離為0.1至1000米。
11. 一種需要定期回廟以進行資訊更新的電子紙祈福系統，包括： 如請求項1至1
assignee: 天擎積體電路股份有限公司

title: Container filing systems and valve for same
abstract: A container filling valve may include a shuttle and a drive sleeve that are magnetically coupled. Movement of the drive sleeve may move the shuttle from a position in which the filling valve is closed to a position in which the filling valve is open. A container handling arm may include a distal end configured to hold a container and a proximal end that includes a load cell. A low flow setpoint system may be configured to arrest closing of a filling valve when that filling valve is partially closed. A pressure control system may be configured to maintain a desired pressure in a reservoir or in a flow path from that reservoir. A product recirculation system may be configured to adjust flow rate in the product recirculation system.
claims:
1. A container filling system comprising:
a beverage product reservoir;
a beverage container filling valve connected to the reservoir and configured to fill containers with beverage product from the reservoir; and
a vacuum source connected to a fluid space that includes an interior of the reservoir.
2. The container filling system of claim 1, wherein the vacuum source is a vacuum pump.
3. The container filling system of claim 1, wherein the reservoir interior has a volume greater than combined volumes of multiple beverage product containers.
4. The container filling system of claim 1, wherein the reservoir interior contains beverage product.
5. The container filling system of claim 1, further comprising a pressure control valve connecting the fluid space to a source of fluid at a pressure above an ambient atmospheric pressure.
6. The container filling system of claim 1, further comprising:
a pressure transducer configured to generate pressure transducer signals indicative of pressures in the reservoir interior or in a flow path from the reservoir interior; and
a controller configured to re

title: Shelf stable confection
abstract: A food product made with simple ingredients, including fruit paste and cocoa butter-based particles, is disclosed. The food product is shelf stable and provides an eating experience resembling a chocolate truffle. Methods of making a food product are also described.
claims:
1. A food product, comprising discrete cocoa butter-based particles in an amount of from 25% to 40% by weight of the food product, wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles are embedded in a matrix that includes a fruit paste having a water activity of less than 0.73, a nut butter, and cocoa powder, wherein the matrix comprises: fruit paste in an amount of 30% to 55% by weight of the food product; nut butter in an amount of 14% to 35% by weight of the food product; and cocoa powder in an amount of 7% to 15% by weight of the food product; wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles have a size range wherein at least 90% pass through a sieve with 1.41 mm openings and are retained on a sieve with 0.105 mm openings, wherein the food product provides a truffle-eating experience which includes a smooth, dry or creamy sensation upon initial bite-down followed by a quick-melting sensation in the mouth upon chewing.
2. The food product of claim 1, wherein the fruit paste is a date paste.
3. The food product of claim 1, wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles are chocolate.
4. The food product of claim 1, wherein the cocoa powder has a fat content of from about 10% to about 22% by weight.
5. The food product of claim 1, wherein the food product is portioned into pieces that weigh from about 5 g to about 10 g.
6. The fo

title: Rainproof device for bicycle
abstract: The utility model relates to a bicycle rain-proof device, which belongs to the field of vehicle rain-proof equipment, is arranged on a bicycle body and comprises a fixed supporting framework, and the fixed supporting framework is approximately horizontally and fixedly arranged in the direction from a bicycle seat cushion to a rear seat of the bicycle seat cushion; the movable supporting framework is arranged on the bicycle body in a rotating mode with the position, close to a bicycle saddle, of the movable supporting framework as the rotating center, and flexible rainproof cloth is arranged between the movable supporting framework and the fixed supporting framework. When the rainproof device is used, the rainproof device is opened to shade sun and rain for a rider, when the rainproof device is not used, the rainproof device is closed, the rainproof device is folded on the rear seat, the occupied area is small, especially the occupied space in the left-right direction of the bicycle is small, riding is not affected when the rainproof device is folded on the rear seat, frequent disassembly and assembly are not needed, and the rainproof device is convenient to use. The rain shelter can be used in the riding process at any time, and has a good rain sheltering effect on vertical rainwater and a good effect on oblique rain.
assignee: 火星营地(北京)教育科技有限公司

title: Method of making multi-textured confectionery pieces
abstract: Multi-textured confectionery pieces, such as marbits for use in cereal, are prepared by combining particulates with a non-aerated marshmallow slurry to form a pumpable dough/particulate slurry. The pumpable confection/particulate slurry is then combined with a cooled, aerated marshmallow slurry. By first forming the confection/particulate slurry in non- aerated form and then combining with the aerated marshmallow slurry, the resulting combination slurry remains aerated, while the incorporated particulates remain intact. This resulting foam product is then extruded into a desired shape, cut into confectionery pieces and dried, thereby effectively establishing the desired multi-textured confectionery pieces.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of preparing multi-textured confectionery food pieces comprising: supplying an aerated confection slurry; supplying a non-aerated confection and particulate slurry including particulates suspended in a non-aerated confectionery body; combining the aerated confection slurry and the non-aerated confection and particulate slurry to establish an aerated, combination slurry; extruding the combination slurry, creating an extrudate; and cutting the extrudate into multi-textured, confectionery pieces including the particulates from the non-aerated confection and particulate slurry intact.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the particulates constitute about 20-50% of the non¬ aerated confection and particulate slurry.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the particulates constitute about 20-30% of the non¬ aerated confection and particulate slurry.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the particulates are hydrophobic.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the particulates constitute grain particulates, candy confections, alginates, or an internal liquid or gel encased in an outer shell.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the particulates include an encased flavored liquid or gel.
7. The method of any one of claims 1-6, wherein

title: Interactive guidance of dental implant surgery
abstract: There is provided, an interactive graphical user interface (GUI), comprising: presenting within the GUI, a first overlay of a target virtual vector overlaid on an image(s) of an oral cavity of a subject captured by an image sensor during a dental session of the subject, wherein the target virtual vector denotes a target vector defining a target location and/or a target angle for drilling by a real-world bur of a real-world drill for insertion of a dental implant, monitoring a real-world location and/or angle of the real-world bur of the drill during manipulations by a user, and dynamically updating, within the GUI, a second overlay of a current virtual vector overlaid on the image(s) including the first overlay, the current virtual vector including a virtual location and/or virtual angle corresponding to a current value of the monitored real-world location and/or angle of the real-world bur of the drill.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for processing data using at least one processor coupled to a memory, the method comprising:
displaying via a display unit of a client computing device, an interactive graphical user interface (GUI) for guiding positioning of a dental implant in a subject;
presenting within the GUI, a first overlay of a target virtual vector overlaid on at least one image of an oral cavity of a subject captured by at least one image sensor during a dental session of the subject,
wherein the target virtual vector denotes a target vector defining a target location and a target angle for drilling by a real-world bur of a real-world drill for insertion of a dental implant;
monitoring a real-world location and angle of the real-world bur of the drill during manipulations by a user; and
dynamically updating, within the GUI, a second overlay of a current virtual vector overlaid on the at least one image including the first overlay, the current virtual vector including a virtual location and virtual angle corresponding to a current value of the monitored real-world location and angle of the real-world bur of the drill,
wherein the current virtual vector is presented as a first line parallel to a long axis of the bur and as a plurality of first concentric circles arranged along a first plane, the first line is normal to the first plane, the target virtual vector is presented as a second line parallel to a direction for drilling for insertion of the dental implant and as a plurality of second concentric circles arranged along a second plane, the second line

title: Soft baked snack.
abstract: A low net carbohydrate soft baked snack having a good texture, flavor, structure, and shelf stability is described. A soft baked snack includes a beneficial combination of fiber, sugar alcohol, including erythritol, and protein. Methods of making a soft baked snack are also described.
claims:
1. Un bocadillo blando horneado, caracterizado porque comprende: a. un contenido de proteínas del 3% al 20% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado; b. un contenido de alcohol de azúcar de entre el 15% y el 35% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado, incluyendo el eritritol; c. un contenido de fibra de al menos el 20% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado; d. un contenido de azúcar inferior al 15% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado, en el que el contenido de alcohol de azúcar, el contenido de fibra, el contenido de azúcar y el contenido total de carbohidratos del bocadillo blando horneado se combinan para lograr un contenido neto de carbohidratos inferior al 25% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado; e. un contenido calórico igual o inferior a 100 calorías por cada 25 g del bocadillo blando horneado; f. un contenido de humedad de entre el 10% y el 18% en peso del bocadillo blando horneado; y ινΐΛ/a/zuzz/u i uood g. una actividad del agua inferior a 0.70.
2. El bocadillo blando horneado de conformidad con la reivindicación 1, caracterizado porque tiene una textura medida mediante un panel de análisis descriptivo (DAP) que tiene una primera densidad de mordida, una primera dureza de masticación, una primera densidad de masticación y una primera cohesión de masticación que son mayores que el pastel, y una primera dureza de masticación que es menor que una galleta cruj iente.
3. El bocadillo blando horneado de conformidad con la reivindicación 1, caracterizado porque tiene una textura medida mediante el análisis de perfil de textura instrumental (TPA) que tiene una resiliencia, una elasticidad y una cohesión que son significativamente (>95% de confianza) inferiores a las de un pastel, y una dureza que es significativamente (>95% de confianza) inferior a la de una galleta crujiente.
4. El bocadillo blando horneado de conformidad con la reivindicación 3, caracterizado porque la resiliencia es inferior al 25%, la elasticidad es inferior al 80%, la cohesión es inferior a 0.

title: Sea area nuclear sewage detection device based on Geiger counter principle
abstract: The utility model relates to a sea area nuclear sewage detection device based on the principle of a Geiger counter, and belongs to the field of nuclear sewage detection equipment, the sea area nuclear sewage detection device comprises an upper shell and a lower shell, the upper shell and the lower shell are connected in a sealing manner, and sealing cavities are formed in the upper shell and the lower shell respectively, the maximum cross section area of the lower shell is larger than that of the upper shell; a mounting cavity is formed between the upper partition plate and the side wall of the upper shell, and a balancing weight is arranged in the lower shell. The Geiger counter is horizontally arranged in the lower shell; the microcontroller and the battery pack are both arranged on the upper partition plate and located in the mounting cavity, the microcontroller is connected with the battery pack, and the Geiger counter is connected with the microcontroller; according to the scheme, the sewage detection device can vertically float in seawater all the time, the Geiger counter can be in a horizontal state all the time to detect the nuclear pollution condition in the seawater, and the sewage detection device can drift to a farther sea area to detect deeper and farther sea areas.
claims:
1.一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，包括：
上壳体和下壳体，所述上壳体与所述下壳体之间密封连接在其各自内部形成密封腔体，所述下壳体的最大横截面积大于所述上壳体的最大横截面积，所述上壳体内具有上隔板，所述上隔板与所述上壳体的侧壁之间形成安装腔，所述下壳体内设有配重块；
盖革计数器，所述盖革计数器水平设置于所述下壳体内；
微控制器和电池包，其均设置于所述上隔板且位于所述安装腔内，所述微控制器与所述电池包连接，由所述电池包为其供电，所述盖革计数器与所述微控制器连接，其能够将脉冲信号传递给微控制器。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，还包括：
GPS定位模块，所述GPS定位模块设置于所述上壳体内。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，还包括：太阳能板，所述太阳能板设置多个，多个所述太阳能板沿所述上壳体的周向均匀间隔设置于所述上壳体的外壁，多个所述太阳能板串联并与所述电池包连接。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，所述上壳体和所述下壳体分别呈半椭圆状，所述上壳体与所述下壳体之间螺纹连接，所述上壳体与所述下壳体之间的螺纹连接的接触面之间设有密封圈。
5.根据权利要求4所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，所述下壳体内还设有下隔板，所述下隔板靠近所述下壳体的连接面设置，所述盖革计数器设置于所述下隔板的下方且通过连接胶固定于所述下壳体的最低位置处。
6.根据权利要求5所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，所述配重块设置多个，多个所述配重块沿所述下壳体的周向均匀间隔设置。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种基于盖革计数器原理的海域核污水检测装置，其特征在于，所述上壳体和所述下壳体分别为塑料壳体。
assignee: 火星营地(北京)教育科技有限公司

title: Vending machine
abstract: To provide a vending machine having a curved outer shape.SOLUTION: Some embodiments of the vending machine include a transparent upper housing designed to be circular and enabling a customer to see the inside of the vending machine. A dispensation product may be stored in a non-transparent lower housing. A product delivery system arranged at the center transports the product from the lower housing to a delivery portal arranged on the upper housing. The product delivery system can move along a vertical line and can rotate through a horizontal plane, and can deliver the product from any portion of the lower housing to any delivery portal arranged on the upper housing.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
claims:
【請求項1】
製品ディスペンサであって、
下部ハウジングと、
円形状を有し、前記下部ハウジングの上方に配設された上部ハウジングと、
前記上部ハウジング上に配設された送達ポータルと、
前記下部ハウジング及び前記上部ハウジング内に配設された製品送達システムであって、前記製品送達システムが、前記下部ハウジングから前記送達ポータルに製品を輸送するように構成され、前記送達ポータルが、前記製品送達システムが前記下部ハウジングから前記送達ポータルに前記製品を輸送した後に、ユーザが前記製品を受け取ることを可能にするように構成されている、製品送達システムと、を備える、製品ディスペンサ。
【請求項2】
前記上部ハウジング上に配設された３つの送達ポータルを更に備え、前記送達ポータルの各々が、他の２つの送達ポータルから１２０度離間されている、請求項１に記載の製品ディスペンサ。

【請求項4】
前記上部ハウジング内に配設された複数の水平に配向された展示棚を更に備え、前記展示棚の各々が、前記展示棚内の前記製品が前記製品ディスペンサの外部から見えるように、前記製品を保持するように構成されている、請求項３に記載の製品ディスペンサ。

前記下部ハウジングが、前記ハウジングの外部

title: Multi-sensor perception for resource tracking and quantification
abstract: Disclosed herein are system, method, and computer program product embodiments for multi-sensor perception for resource tracking and quantification. An embodiment operates by receiving resource information indicating a resource identifier, a resource location, and a resource amount. Based on sensor data received from a first sensing device and the resource identifier, a resource removed from the resource location and placed at a predefined location may be tracked. An amount of the resource placed at the predefined location may be determined based on depth information from sensor data received from a second sensing device. A notification that indicates that additional resources that match the resource should stop being removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location may be generated based on a match between the resource amount and the amount of the resource placed at the predefined location.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for multi-sensor perception for resource tracking and quantification, the method comprising:
receiving resource information indicating a resource identifier, a resource location, and a resource amount;
tracking at the resource location, based on sensor data received from a first sensing device and the resource identifier, a resource removed from the resource location and placed at a predefined location;
determining, based on depth information indicated by sensor data received from a second sensing device, an amount of the resource removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location;
determining a match between the resource amount and the amount of the resource removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location; and
generating, based on the match between the resource amount and the amount of the resource removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location, a notification that indicates that additional resources that match the resource should stop being removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the tracking the resource removed from the resource location and placed at the predefined location further comprises:
identifying, based on a correspondence between feature classification data and a feature extracted from the sensor data received from the first sensing device, a type of the resource;

title: Cacao variety 'mini'
abstract: A new and distinct variety of cacao plant designated as ‘Mini’, particularly selected for its size, leaf structure, coloring, and self-compatibility, is disclosed.
claims: 1. A new and distinct variety of cacao plant named ‘Mini’ as shown and described herein.

title: Organ cooling apparatus and organ cooling method
abstract: In the present invention, it becomes possible to suppress the putrefaction of an organ by cooling the organ in the body of a person who has expressed their decision to donate the organ, until the organ is isolated after the confirmed death of the person.　The organ cooling apparatus 1 includes: a flow passage part 2 that is placed in a dead body H; a cooling medium supply device 3 for supplying a cooling medium C into the flow passage part 2; and a blood circulation device 4 for circulating blood in the dead body H. The blood circulating in the dead body H by means of the blood circulation device 4 is cooled by the cooling medium C supplied from the cooling medium supply device 3 into the flow passage part 2. As a result, the organ in the dead body H is cooled through the blood.
claims:
1. 　死体に配置される流路部と、 　前記流路部内に冷媒を供給する冷媒供給装置と、 　前記死体の血液を循環させる血液循環装置と、を有し、 　前記血液循環装置によって前記死体内で循環する前記血液を、前記冷媒供給装置から前記流路部内に供給される前記冷媒によって冷却することにより、前記血液を介して前記死体内の臓器を冷却することを特徴とする臓器冷却装置。
2. 　前記流路部は、可撓性を有し、前記死体に巻き付けられる請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
3. 　前記血液循環装置は、心臓マッサージ機である請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
4. 　前記流路部は、前記死体の前頸部に巻き付けられる請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
5. 　前記流路部は、前記死体の腋窩部に巻き付けられる請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
6. 　前記流路部は、前記死体の鼠径部に巻き付けられる請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
7. 　前記冷媒供給装置は、前記流路部内に前記冷媒を循環させる請求項１に記載の臓器冷却装置。
8. 　前記冷媒は、氷スラリーであり、 　前記冷媒供給装置は、前記氷スラリーを貯留する貯留部と、前記貯留部に貯留された前記氷スラリーを前記流路部に供給するポンプと、を有する請求項７に記載の臓器冷却装置。
9. 　前記氷スラリーの融点は、－２５℃以上、０℃以下である請求項８に記載の臓器冷却装置。
10. 　死体に流路部を配置する流路部配置ステップと、 　前記流路部内に冷媒を供給する冷媒供給ステップと、 　前記死体の血液を循環させる血液循環ステップと、を有し、 　前記死体内で循環する前記血液を、前記流路部内に供給される前記冷媒によって冷却することにより、前記血液を介して前記死体内の臓器を冷却することを特徴とする臓器冷却方法。

title: Graphene copolymer high polymer material surface treatment equipment
abstract: The utility model discloses graphene copolymer high polymer material surface treatment equipment which is characterized in that a motor is mounted in a protective cover, a switch connected with the motor is mounted on the side edge of the protective cover, a polishing sheet is mounted at the bottom of the motor, a dust cover is mounted at the top of the polishing sheet through a bearing, and a handle is mounted at the rear end of the protective cover; a grip groove is formed in the handle, a lithium battery connected with the motor through the handle is installed at the rear end of the handle, a dust suction pipe is installed at the top of the dustproof cover, a negative pressure pipe connector is arranged in the front end of the handle, and the bottom of the negative pressure pipe connector is connected with the top of the dust suction pipe. And the negative pressure pipe connector can be connected with an external negative pressure machine connecting pipe. The material surface detection device is reasonable in design, scraps polished by the polishing piece are sucked away through the dust suction pipe arranged on the dust cover and an external negative pressure machine, and the surface of a material can be rapidly detected after treatment is completed.
claims:

2.根据权利要求1所述的石墨烯共聚物高分子材料表面处理设备，其特征在于：所述打磨片（4）还包括有连接块（11）、橡胶清洗刷头（12）、伸缩腔（13）、T形伸缩刷毛（14）和弹性支撑片（15），所述打磨片（4）底部等距安装有若干连接块（11），所述连接块（11）底部均安装有橡胶清洗刷头（12），所述橡胶清洗刷头（12）内开设有伸缩腔（13），所述伸缩腔（13）内均安装有T形伸缩刷毛（14），所述T形伸缩刷毛（14）顶部两侧位于伸缩腔（13）内安装有弹性支撑片（15），所述T形伸缩刷毛（14）在打磨片（4）转动时通过离心力摆动甩出，并在停下转动时通过弹性支撑片（15）收缩至伸缩腔（13）内。

title: Proactive equipment machine health monitoring and self-healing using sensors & artificial intelligence (AI)
abstract: Disclosed herein are system, method, and computer program product embodiments for proactive equipment machine health monitoring and self-healing using sensors & AI, comprising: applying a machine learning model to a first sensor reading, wherein the first sensor reading comprises a condition associated with a beverage system; predicting a repair action based on applying the machine learning model, wherein the repair action comprises a step to address the condition at the beverage system; executing the repair action at the beverage system; and generating an output by applying the machine learning model to a second sensor reading.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method, comprising:
applying a machine learning model to a first sensor reading, wherein the first sensor reading comprises a condition associated with a beverage system;
predicting a repair action based on applying the machine learning model, wherein the repair action comprises a step to address the condition at the beverage system;
executing the repair action at the beverage system; and
generating an output by applying the machine learning model to a second sensor reading.
2. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, wherein the output indicates the repair action addressed the condition, the method further comprising:
adding the first sensor reading, the second sensor reading, and the repair action to a training data set at the beverage system; and
retraining the machine learning model on the training data set.
3. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, wherein the output indicates the repair action addressed the condition, the method further comprising:
transmitting the first sensor reading, the second sensor reading, the repair action, and the output to a cloud server; and
receiving an updated machine learning model from the cloud server, wherein the updated machine

title: Beverage dispensing system
abstract: The invention relates to a beverage dispensing system. Systems and methods for dispensing a composition, such as a beverage, are provided. The beverage dispenser may be configured to receive an input corresponding to a selection of a beverage. The beverage dispenser may receive an additional input corresponding to an adjustment to an ingredient of the selected beverage.

title: Stabilized frozen dairy products and mixes comprising denaturized WHEY protein
abstract: Mixes for making frozen dairy products that include 1% to 5% denaturized whey protein, and products made from such mixes, are described. Methods of making mixes including denaturized protein are described, as well as methods for making frozen dairy products from such mixes.
claims:
CLAIMS

title: Carbonation cup for carbonated beverage maker
abstract: A carbonated beverage maker includes a water reservoir, a carbon dioxide creation chamber, and a carbonation chamber. The water reservoir holds ice water and has a first impeller and a shroud surrounding the first impeller. The carbon dioxide creation chamber contains chemical elements and receives warm water. The chemical elements react with each other to create carbon dioxide when the warm water is introduced to the carbon dioxide creation chamber. The carbonation chamber is connected to the water reservoir and the carbon dioxide creation chamber. The carbonation chamber has a second impeller that includes a stem portion and blades. The stem portion and the blades define conduits therein. The blades create a low pressure region in a lower portion of the carbonation chamber such that carbon dioxide from the carbon dioxide creation chamber flows through the conduits to the low pressure region.
claims:
1. A carbonation cup comprising:
a transparent plastic layer forming a base and a cylinder;
a metal sheath disposed outside the transparent plastic layer, the metal sheath defining a plurality of holes so that a portion of the transparent plastic layer is visible from outside the carbonation cup;
a magnetically-driven impeller disposed at an inner side of the base of the transparent plastic layer; and
an attachment member disposed at an end of the cylinder opposite the base, the attachment member configured to seal the carbonation cup when attached to a carbonated beverage maker having a carbonation source.
2. The carbonation cup of claim 1, further comprising a fill line indicator to suggest a fill line of a diluent.
3. The carbonation cup of claim 1, wherein the transparent plastic layer comprises a thermal insulating material.
4. The carbonation cup of claim 1, wherein the carbonation cup is a pressure vessel, and the metal sheath is configured to maintain a pressure at which a beverage is carbonated.
5. The carbonation cup of claim 1, wherein the attachment member comprises an attachment projection to support the carbonation cup within the carbonated beverage maker.
6. The carbonat

title: Multi-language automatic translation conference system
abstract: 揭露一種布建於私有網路中的多語言自動翻譯會議系統。多個會議設備之至少一部分被歸屬為第一使用者群組。多個會議設備的一者獲取第一語言的第一語音信號。主機對第一語音信號之第一文字資料進行翻譯以產生多個第二語言之多個第二文字資料。多個第二語言彼此不同，且不同於第一語言。主機根據第一使用者群組的設定資訊將第一文字資料與多個第二文字資料的對應至少一者傳遞給第一使用者群組的多個會議設備。第一使用者群組的設定資訊記錄第一使用者群組的多個會議設備之多個使用者的至少一使用語言。
claims:
1. 一種多語言自動翻譯會議系統，布建於一私有網路中，包括： 複數個會議設備(100a～100j)，其中該複數個會議設備(100a～100j)之至少一部分被歸屬為一第一使用者群組(GR1)；以及 一主機(102)，通訊連接該複數個會議設備(100a～100j)； 其中該複數個會議設備(100a～100j)的一者獲取一第一語言的一第一語音信號，該主機(102)對該第一語音信號之一第一文字資料進行翻譯以產生複數個第二語言之複數個第二文字資料，該複數個第二語言的每一者彼此不同，該複數個第二語言不同於該第一語言，該主機(102)根據該第一使用者群組(GR1)的一設定資訊將該第一文字資料與該複數個第二文字資料的對應至少一者傳遞給該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)，以及該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊記錄該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)之複數個使用者的至少一使用語言。
2. 如請求項1所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中該複數個會議設備(100a～100j)之至少另一部分被歸屬為一第二使用者群組(GR2)，該主機(102)根據該第二使用者群組(GR2)的一設定資訊將該第一文字資料與該複數個第二文字資料的對應至少一者傳遞給該第二使用者群組(GR2)的該複數個會議設備(100e、100f)，以及該第二使用者群組(GR2)的該設定資訊記錄該第二使用者群組(GR2)的該複數個會議設備(100e、100f)之複數個使用者的至少一使用語言。
3. 如請求項2所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中該第二使用者群組(GR2)的該設定資訊所記錄之該至少一使用語言不同於該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊所記錄之該至少一使用語言。
4. 如請求項1所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊更記錄該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)之該複數個使用者的一權限等級，當該第一文字資料的一權限等級大於該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊所記錄的該權限等級，該主機(102)不傳遞該第一文字資料與該複數個第二文字資料的任一者給該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)。
5. 如請求項1所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊所記錄之該至少一使用語言為複數個使用語言，該主機(102)根據該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該設定資訊將該第一文字資料與該複數個第二文字資料的複數者傳遞給該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)，且該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)的每一者依據其使用的一語言設定資訊接收對應的一文字資料。
6. 如請求項1所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中獲取該第一語言的該第一語音信號的該會議設備(100a)將該第一語音信號轉換為該第一文字資料，該主機(102)對該第一文字資料進行翻譯以產生該複數個第二文字資料，以及該第一使用者群組(GR1)的該複數個會議設備(100b～100d)將其接收的一文字資料轉換為一第二語音信號。
7. 如請求項1所述的多語言自動翻譯會議系統，其中該複數個會議設備(100a～100j)的每一者包括： 一聲音獲取裝置(201)，用於獲取該會議設備(100a～100j)對應之該使用者的一語音信號； 一處理器(200)，電性連接該聲音獲取裝置(201)，用於將該聲音獲取裝置(201)獲取的該語音信號轉換為一文字資料；以及 一通訊裝置(202)，電性連接該處理器(200)，並通訊連接該主機(102)，用於將該處理器(200)所轉換之該文字資料傳遞至該主機(102)，或接收來自於該主機(
assignee: 天擎積體電路股份有限公司

title: Smart vending machine with modular control assembly
abstract: A vending machine includes a product storage cabinet having a housing defining a storage compartment for storing a product and a door movably connected to the housing. A product sensor is configured to detect removal of the product from the storage compartment. The vending machine further includes a control assembly configured to control operation of the vending machine. The control assembly includes a support structure, a control unit mounted on the support structure, a transceiver mounted on the support structure, and a power supply mounted on the support structure. The control assembly is configured to receive information from collected by the product sensor to determine an identity of the product removed from the storage compartment.
claims:
1.     A vending machine, comprising:
a product storage cabinet, comprising:
a housing defining a storage compartment for storing a product;
a door movably connected to the housing;
a product sensor configured to detect removal of the product from the storage compartment,
a control assembly configured to control operation of the vending machine, the control assembly comprising:
a support structure;
a control unit mounted on the support structure;
a transceiver mounted on the support structure; and
a power supply mounted on the support structure,
wherein the control assembly is configured to receive information collected by the product sensor to determine an identity of the product removed from the storage compartment.
2. The vending machine of claim 1, further comprising a user interface comprising a display, and wherein the user interface is in communication with the control assembly.
3. The vending machine of claim 1, wherein the product storage cabinet further comprises a cooling unit.
4. The vending machine of claim 1, wherein

title: Analogue cheese with whey protein cream
abstract: An analogue cheese composition can be formulated using a whey protein cream ingredient that has historically been considered a waste byproduct of the whey protein isolate production process. The whey protein cream has been found to found to function as a source of protein in the analogue cheese and provide emulsification properties to the other constituent ingredients incorporated into the analogue cheese composition. Accordingly, in some formulations, the analogue cheese composition may include a comparatively low amount of casein protein, with the whey protein cream functionally compensating for the removed casein protein.
claims:
1. A cheese composition comprising:
from 5 to 40 weight percent fat;
from 15 to 60 weight percent water;
from 5 to 20 weight percent hydrocolloid; and
at least 0.5 weight percent whey protein cream.
2. The cheese composition of claim 1, wherein the cheese composition comprises from 1.0 weight percent to 5.0 weight percent whey protein cream
3. The cheese composition of claim 1, further comprising less than 1.5 weight percent emulsifying salt.
4. The cheese composition of claim 1, further comprising casein protein in an amount not greater than 12 weight percent.
5. The cheese composition of claim 4, wherein substantially all protein in the cheese composition is the casein protein and protein in the whey protein cream.
6. The cheese composition of claim 1, further comprising casein protein in an amount not greater than 5 weight percent.
7. The cheese composition of claim 6, wherein a ratio of a weight of the whey protein cream divided by a weight of the casein protein ranges from 0.5 to 8.

title: Preparation technology of salad juice with fruit flavor and product
abstract: The invention relates to the field of food seasonings, and discloses a preparation process of fruit-flavored salad juice and a product. Comprising the following steps: S1, cleaning and juicing fruits, and filtering to obtain fruit juice; s2, glucose oxidase accounting for 0.08-0.15% of the weight of the fruit juice and D-sodium erythorbate accounting for 0.05-0.12% of the weight of the fruit juice are added for enzymolysis, heating and enzyme deactivation are performed, and enzymatic hydrolysate is prepared; s3, adding a compound enzyme accounting for 0.1-0.2% of the weight of the enzymatic hydrolysate and an enzymolysis assistant accounting for 0.1-0.3% of the weight of the enzymatic hydrolysate for enzymolysis, and heating for enzyme deactivation to prepare flavored fruit juice; s4, adding a thickening agent, a sweetening agent, an acidulant and a preservative into water, and adding the flavored fruit juice to prepare salad juice with fruit flavor; the compound enzyme is a combination of at least two of beta-glucosidase, hemicellulase, naringinase and xylanase, and the enzymolysis auxiliary agent is soybean polysaccharide and/or hydroxyethyl chitosan. The salad juice with fruit flavor is not easy to generate non-enzymatic browning, and keeps good color, flavor and nutritional value.
assignee: 广东百利食品股份有限公司

title: Beverage dispenser water supply connector

title: Beverage can with ingredient chamber
abstract: A beverage can with an ingredient chamber for storing functional ingredients independently of a base beverage until the beverage can is opened by a consumer. The ingredient chamber may be disposed on a can end of the beverage can. When the consumer opens the beverage can, the ingredient chamber may be broken open to automatically release functional ingredients. In some embodiments, the dosing chamber includes a membrane forming a sealed cavity. In some embodiments, the dosing chamber includes a deformation cavity at the end of the tank.

title: Unattended vending systems and methods of using the same
abstract: Embodiments described herein relate to mobile vending systems for vending products (e.g., beverages and snacks). The system can be easily repositioned from one position to another and can be operated unattended. The system can include a storage compartment for storing products and a cooling system for maintaining the temperature of the storage compartment. The system can have an integrated system for payment processing, inventory management, and powering the system. The system can detect an authorized user or a payment source to authorize vending of the products. The system can have active cooling systems, passive cooling systems, or both. The active cooling systems can include refrigeration systems for cooling products stored within the system. The passive cooling systems can use temperature control packs for maintaining temperatures within the system.
claims:
1. A mobile vending system, the system comprising:
a storage compartment configured to store products, the storage compartment being insulated;
a temperature sensor disposed within the storage compartment, the temperature sensor configured to detect when the temperature of the storage compartment is greater than a predetermined temperature;
a cooling system for maintaining the temperature of the storage compartment;
a user interface, the user interface comprising a display;
a scanner configured to scan the product;
a payment processing unit, the payment processing unit configured to detect a payment source;
a battery configured to power the user interface and the payment processing unit; and
a power source comprising a plug compatible with an electrical outlet, the power source configured to power the cooling system and recharge the battery when the plug is inserted into the electrical outlet; and
a control unit configured to:
communicate with the payment processing unit to authorize a purchase of the product when the payment processing unit detects a payment source; and
activate the cooling system when the mobile vending system is coupled to a power supply and based on the detection of the temperature sensor; and
wherein

title: Method of glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) stabilization
abstract: A method is provided, comprising feeding a cat a foodstuff comprising a protein to fat ratio of 1:0.27 to 1:0.63 on a gram:gram as fed or dry matter basis, and measuring the level of glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) in a blood sample from the cat before and after feeding the foodstuff. A reduction in GIP levels and/or maintaining low levels of GIP post-prandially is indicative of a foodstuff useful in preventing accumulation of and/or reducing body fat in a cat and therefore controlling the body weight of a cat.
claims:
1. (canceled)
2. A GIP-stabilizing foodstuff comprising:
each of amino acids aspartic acid, serine, glutamic acid, glycine, alanine, and proline, and each of fatty acids myristic acid, palmitic acid, stearic acid, palmitoleic acid, oleic acid, and linolenic acid in a ratio of 1:0.45 amino acid:fatty acid; and
a protein to fat ratio of 1:0.37 on a gram:gram as fed or dry matter basis.
3. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 2, comprising a moisture content of 5% to 15%.
4. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 2, comprising a moisture content of 15% to 70%.
5. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 2, comprising a moisture content of 70% to 90%.
6. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 2, wherein the protein is provided by an animal-derived material.
7. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 6, wherein the animal-derived material comprises beef, chicken, turkey, lamb, fish, blood plasma, marrow bone, or any combination thereof.
8. The GIP-stabilizing foodstuff of claim 2, wherein the protein is provided by a meat substitute.
9. The GIP-stabilizing

title: System and methods for carbonating a liquid
abstract: Embodiments described herein relate to systems and methods for carbonating a liquid at ambient temperature. The system may include a liquid source; a carbon dioxide source; and a contactor for carbonating the liquid. The contactor may include channels and a sparge for carbonating liquid flowing through the channels. The system may produce a liquid having high levels of carbonation at ambient temperature. The sparge may generate microbubbles or nanobubbles to allow for cost-effective carbonation at ambient temperatures. The bubbles may have an average diameter of 100 μm or less. The system may carbonate liquid at a rate of 1 gram to 10 grams carbon dioxide per liter.
claims:
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A system for carbonating a liquid, the system comprising: a liquid source; a carbon dioxide source; and a contactor for carbonating the liquid, the contactor comprising: a first channel in communication with the liquid source, the first channel having a first inner diameter, the first channel comprising a first end, a second end, and a first inlet defined in a sidewall of the first channel; a second channel comprising a first end in fluid communication with the second end of the first channel, the second channel having a second inner diameter that is smaller than the first inner diameter; and a sparge disposed at least partially within the first channel and at least partially within the second channel, wherein the sparge is configured to generate bubbles having an average diameter of 100 pm or less, and wherein the sparge is configured to provide carbon dioxide to the second channel at a rate of 1 gram to 10 grams carbon dioxide per liter of the liquid flowing through the contactor; wherein the system is configured to operate at ambient temperature.
2. The system of claim 1, further comprising a restrictor disposed at the second end of the first channel, the restrictor comprising a tapered inner surface.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein the sparge comprises pores through which carbon dioxide flows.
4. The system of claim 3, wherein the pores are disposed only on the portion of the sparge disposed in the second channel.

title: Interactive vending machine
abstract: A vending machine has an interactive customer experience. Some embodiments of the vending machine include a transparent front wall with a plurality of display units located behind the front wall. Each of the display units may contain an example of a product available for vending. Based on input received from a customer and other information, the vending machine may provide a recommendation for a product or products to select for purchase. The vending machine may highlight the recommendation by selectively illuminating the product display units that contain the recommended products.
claims:
1. A vending machine, comprising:
a housing;
a display section disposed in a front portion of the housing, the display section comprising a plurality of display units configured to contain a product such that the product is visible from an exterior of the housing;
a transparency control element disposed in the front portion configured to selectively vary the transparency of a portion of a front wall through which at least one of the plurality of display units are visible;
a product storage section disposed in a rear portion of the housing configured to releasably store a plurality of the products;
a plurality of display products, each of the plurality of display products disposed in one of the plurality of display units;
a delivery portal disposed on a front of the housing such that the delivery portal is horizontally centered on a front wall of the housing;
a user interface disposed on the housing;
a controller configured to receive input from the user interface and to display a product recommendation based on that input by commanding the transparency control element to selectively modify the transparency of the front portion corresponding to the product recommendation to make the display unit containing the product corresponding to the product recommendation visible through the front portion, wherein the product recommendation is different from the input; and

title: Compounds that modulate GPR92 receptor activity and pet food products containing the same
abstract: A flavor composition comprising at least one compound that modulates, increases and/or enhances the activity of a GPR92 receptor that can be used to enhance palatability of pet food products is described herein. Also disclosed herein are methods for identifying said compounds.

3. The flavor composition of claim 2, wherein one or more double bond is substituted with hydrogen, methyl, or C1 to C12 alkyl.
4. The flavor composition of claim 1, wherein one or more of the carbons in the hydrocarbon chain is substituted by an oxygen, sulfur, nitrogen, ketone, sulfone, sulfoxide, amide, urea, or sulfonamide.
5. The flavor composition of claim 1, wherein R is a s

title: Roll-like dough product and method for producing same
abstract: A roll-like dough product, such as a croissant (100), is made by layering fat between thin-layer dough, forming a multi-layer dough sheet (10); a compressed multi-layer dough sheet (10); cutting the dough sheet (10); repositioning the cutting block (65); stretching the cutting block (165); a curl block (185); flattening (85) the block; performing coating or surface treatment on the block; and a freezing block can be selected. By this method, making a FROM-TO-Oven (FTO) dough product does not require thawing and fermentation steps while significantly increasing the yield of the desired sheet-like, rich, breathable final pastry product. The method may include, prior to cutting the dough sheet (10), depositing one or more stuffing materials: depositing a stuffing layer (30), such as a chocolate cream sandwich, in a central region of the multi-layer dough sheet (10); and folding the sides (35, 36) of the dough sheet (10) onto the central region to enclose the filling layer (30).

title: Hard taco shell and method for producing the hard taco shell.
abstract: A taco shell (10) is produced by applying a plasticizing agent (coating 100) to a base or spine portion (25) of a hard taco shell, such as by targeted spraying, rolling, brushing or dipping of the taco shell, thereby softening the base or spine portion (25), preferably across a strip width between 4mm-20mm. As a result, when the taco shell (10) is bitten, the softened base portion (25) has some hinging flexibility or pliability which reduces the potential for any crack propagation. Therefore, the structural integrity of the hard taco shell (10) can be better maintained while be eaten, resulting in retention of the fillings and less mess. If desired, an anti- migration agent can also be applied to assure containment of the plasticizing agent in the targeted region.

title: Workshop auxiliary machine regulation and control assembly
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of workshop auxiliary machines, in particular to a workshop auxiliary machine regulation and control assembly which comprises a fixing plate, an air compressor body and a concentric-square-shaped pipe, an air tank is installed at the top of the fixing plate, the air compressor body is installed at the top of the air tank, and an air suction pipe is installed on one side of the air compressor body. An air outlet pipe is installed at the bottom of the air compressor body, a shell is installed at the top of a fixing plate at the front end of the air tank, a heat dissipation pipe is installed at the front end of the air compressor body in an embedded mode, the end, away from the air compressor body, of the heat dissipation pipe extends into the shell from the top of the shell, and a concentric-square-shaped pipe is installed in the shell. A water inlet pipe is embedded in one side of the shell, and a water outlet pipe is embedded in the other side of the shell. The air compressor has the advantages that cold water can be heated through high-temperature air exhausted during heat dissipation of the air compressor body, and heat energy waste is avoided.
claims:
1.一种车间辅机调控组件，包括固定板(1)、空气压缩机本体(3)和回形管(13)，其特征在于：所述固定板(1)顶部安装有气罐(2)，所述气罐(2)顶部安装有空气压缩机本体(3)，所述空气压缩机本体(3)一侧安装有吸气管(8)，所述空气压缩机本体(3)底部安装有出气管(9)，所述气罐(2)前端的固定板(1)顶部安装有壳体(5)，所述空气压缩机本体(3)前端嵌入安装有散热管(4)，所述散热管(4)背离空气压缩机本体(3)的一端从壳体(5)顶部伸入其内部，所述壳体(5)内部安装有回形管(13)，所述壳体(5)一侧嵌入安装有进水管(6)，所述壳体(5)另一侧嵌入安装有出水管(12)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述出气管(9)背离空气压缩机本体(3)的一端从气罐(2)顶部伸入其内部。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述气罐(2)一侧嵌入安装有连接管(7)，连接管(7)上安装有阀门。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述进水管(6)伸入壳体(5)内部的一端与回形管(13)连接，出水管(12)伸入壳体(5)内部的一端与回形管(13)连接。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述出水管(12)上方的壳体(5)侧面嵌入安装有固定管(11)。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述固定板(1)底部四角处分别安装有固定座(10)，固定座(10)与固定板(1)底部相垂直。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种车间辅机调控组件，其特征在于：所述气罐(2)底部两侧分别安装有支撑架(14)，两个支撑架(14)底部与固定板(1)顶部固定连接。
assignee: 郑州百事饮料有限公司

title: Animal food compositions with improved palatability and customizability and methods of making same
abstract: The present disclosure relates to a method of making and processing an animal food composition with improved palatability and customizability. The method comprises providing a dry food composition comprising a first coating consisting of a fat-containing composition and applying a second coating to the dry food composition, the second coating comprising a palatability enhancer product in liquid form and a palatability enhancer product in powder form. The present disclosure also relates to animal food compositions and kits for preparing animal food compositions.
claims:
1.一种制备动物食品的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)提供干食物组合物，所述干食物组合物包含第一涂层，所述第一涂层由含脂肪组合物组成，所述含脂肪组合物包含为所述含脂肪组合物总重量的约0.5％至约10％的干物质中脂肪(FDM)；和
b)将第二涂层施加到所述干食物组合物上，所述第二涂层包含(i)液体形式的适口性增强剂产品和(ii)粉末形式的适口性增强剂产品；
其特征在于，所述第二涂层在低于约37℃的温度下和/或在环境温度的约10℃内施加。
2.一种制备动物食品的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)提供干食物组合物，其包含第一涂层，所述第一涂层由含脂肪组合物组成，所述含脂肪组合物包含为所述含脂肪组合物总重量的约0.5％至约10％的干物质中脂肪(FDM)；
b)将第二涂层施加到所述干食物组合物上，所述第二涂层包含粉末形式的适口性增强剂产品；和
c)将第三涂层施加到所述先前步骤b)中获得的涂层的干食物组合物上，所述第三涂层包含液体形式的适口性增强剂产品；
其特征在于，所述第三涂层在低于约37℃的温度下和/或在环境温度的约10℃内施加。
3.一种制备定制动物食品的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)提供干食物组合物，其包含第一涂层，所述第一涂层由含脂肪组合物组成，所述含脂肪组合物包含为所述含脂肪组合物总重量的约0.5％至约8％的干物质中脂肪(FDM)；和
b)将第二涂层施加到所述干食物组合物上，所述第二涂层包含至少一种食品添加剂产品；
其特征在于，所述第二涂层在低于约37℃的温度下和/或在环境温度的约10℃内施加。
4.一种制备动物食品的方法，所述方法包括以下步骤：
a)提供干食物组合物，其包含第一涂层，所述第一涂层由含脂肪组合物组成，所述含脂肪组合物包含为所述含脂肪组合物总重量的约0.5％至约8％的干物质中脂肪(FDM)；和
b)将第二涂层施加到所述干食物组合物上，所述第二涂层包含粉末形式和/或液体形式的至少一种食物添加剂产品。
5.根据前述权利要求中任一项所述的方法，其中，所述施加第二涂层的步骤通过喷涂来完成。

title: Beverage dispensing system
abstract: Systems and methods for dispensing compositions, such as beverages, are provided. A beverage dispenser may be configured to receive input corresponding to a selection of a beverage. The beverage dispenser may receive additional input corresponding to an adjustment of an ingredient of the selected beverage.
claims:
1. A beverage dispenser, comprising:
an upper housing;
a lower housing disposed below the upper housing;
a flavoring source disposed in one of the upper housing and the lower housing;
a display window disposed in one of the upper housing and the lower housing and positioned to allow the flavoring source to be visible from an exterior of the upper housing and the lower housing;
a nozzle disposed on an exterior of the upper housing; and
a diluent source disposed in one of the upper housing and the lower housing and configured to supply a diluent to the beverage dispenser, wherein the beverage dispenser is configured to use the nozzle to dispense a beverage formed from at least the diluent.
2. The beverage dispenser of claim 1, further comprising a gas tank disposed in the lower housing, the beverage dispenser configured to use a gas disposed in the gas tank to form the beverage.
3. The beverage dispenser of claim 2, wherein the gas is nitrogen gas.
4. The beverage dispenser of claim 1, further comprising a user interface disposed on an exterior of the upper housing vertically above the nozzle, the user interface configured to receive an input from a user.
5. The beverage dispenser

title: Preparation method of fiber-based curry sauce capable of resisting reheating nutrition loss and curry sauce
abstract: The invention relates to a preparation method of a fiber-based curry sauce capable of resisting reheating nutrition loss and the curry sauce. Comprising the following steps: 1) juice absorption: long protein fibers absorb turmeric juice to obtain a fiber material A; 2) rubber powder film coating: uniformly mixing the fiber material A with vegetable rubber powder, and shearing to obtain a fiber material B; 3) oil-emulsion blocking: uniformly mixing an emulsifier and vegetable oil, and uniformly mixing the obtained oil-emulsion material C with the fiber material B to obtain a protein fiber base material; and 4) stir-frying and curing: weighing vegetable oil, heating, adding a flavoring agent, mixing with the vegetable oil, stir-frying, adding a mixture of wheat flour, mashed potato and water, uniformly mixing to obtain a seasoning sauce, adding the protein fiber base material, uniformly mixing, curing, packaging, and sterilizing to obtain the curry sauce. Through the processes of juice absorption, rubber powder film covering, oil emulsion blocking and stir-frying and curing, the curry sauce is repeatedly heated for multiple times, so that the loss of curcumin can be reduced, and the curry sauce can be easily adhered to the surface of food to obtain better taste and flavor.
claims:
1.一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于包括以下步骤：
1）吸收汁液：将长蛋白纤维进行吸收姜黄汁液，得到纤维料A；
2）胶粉覆膜：将纤维料A与植物胶粉混合均匀，剪切，得到纤维料B；
3）油乳阻隔：称取乳化剂和植物油混合均匀，得到油乳料C，再将油乳料C与纤维料B进行混合均匀，得到蛋白纤维基料；
4)爆香熟化：称取植物油加热，再加入调味剂与其混合，爆香，再加入小麦粉、土豆泥、水的混合物混合均匀，得到调味酱，再加入蛋白纤维基料至调味酱中，混合均匀，熟化，封装，杀菌，得到纤维基咖喱酱料；
所述植物胶粉为纳米桃胶粉、纳米雪燕粉以及纳米皂角米粉中多种的组合物，其中，至少一种为纳米桃胶粉。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于：所述姜黄汁液含有盐，所述盐的含量为姜黄汁液含量的5wt%以下。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于，所述步骤2）的具体工艺为：植物胶粉均匀散落于纤维料A的表面，使其充分与纤维料A表面接触，抖落未被吸收的植物胶粉，剪切，形成纤维料B。
4.根据权利要求3所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于，所述长蛋白纤维的线径为5-50微米，所述纤维料B的长度为55-80微米。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于：所述植物胶粉由纳米桃胶粉、纳米雪燕粉以及纳米皂角米粉组成。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于：所述乳化剂为椰桨、蔗糖脂肪酸酯、单硬脂酸甘油酯、卵磷脂中的多种的组合物。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于：所述步骤3）和步骤4）中的植物油均为椰子油、橄榄油、大豆油、花生油中一种或多种的组合物。
8.根据权利要求1所述的一种具有抗复热营养流失的纤维基咖喱酱料的制备方法，其特征在于：所述调味剂为生姜、洋葱
assignee: 广东百利食品股份有限公司

title: Clamping device for cutting robot
abstract: The utility model discloses a clamping device for a cutting robot, which belongs to the related technical field of cutting robots and comprises a mounting seat, a clamping component and a cleaning component. The clamping device for the cutting robot has the advantages of being high in stability, good in clamping effect and convenient and fast to clean chippings, the two air cylinder guide rods push the two clamping plates in a centering mode by controlling the two arranged guide rod air cylinders, meanwhile, the two arranged first connecting pieces are matched with traction limiting of one second connecting piece, and the clamping effect is good. Finally, the two clamping plates can always keep centering for clamping, the plates can be clamped more stably, the possibility of displacement in the cutting process is reduced, the accuracy and precision of a cutting line are kept, deviation or dislocation of the cutting line is avoided, chippings can be stacked in a centralized mode through an arranged cleaning assembly, and the cutting efficiency is improved. And therefore, the subsequent cleaning work is more convenient and efficient, and meanwhile, the potential influence of chippings on machining can be reduced.
claims:

5.根据权利要求1所述的切割机器人用夹持装置，其特征在于，所述安装座(1)内装配有两个侧限位杆(34)且两个侧限位杆(34)呈平行设置，两个所述侧限位杆(34)外部均滑动设有一个滑动块(341)，两个所述滑动块(341)均与下端尼龙毛刷(33)相连接。

title: Interactive closure device and beverage container
abstract: The invention relates to an interactive closing device and a beverage container. An interactive beverage container includes a beverage container defining an opening sealable by a closure. The enclosure may also include circuitry configured to transmit data to the mobile device. When the closure is in the closed configuration, where the closure is attached to the opening, the circuitry does not transmit data to the mobile device, and when the closure is in the open configuration, where the closure is removed from the opening, the circuitry transmits data to the mobile device. The data may include nutritional information, marketing materials, videos, tracking member plans, and/or providing games or matches.

title: System, method, and apparatus for fume extraction
abstract: A system, method, or apparatus for controlling the ignition of a volatile organic compound cloud. The system can include a laser source configured to emit one or more laser beams, one or more fume cells, and a conveyor carrying one or more confectionery products. The system is configured to etch the one or more confectionery products using the one or more laser beams. The etching creates a volatile organic compound cloud above the one or more confectionery products. The system is also configured to control one or more factors of the system, where the one or more factors include at least one of laser power, laser wavelength, geometry of laser beam, etch geometry, or fume extraction air flow. The system is further configured to ignite the volatile organic compound cloud based on the controlled one or more factors.
