title: System and method for bottom coating food products
abstract: A product conveying and coating system (2) includes at least first and second, sequentially arranged conveyor belts (12,63), with at least the second conveyor belt (63) being a solid belt. Interposed in a gap (151) between the first and second belts (12,63) is a dispenser head (164) of a coating manifold (157). The dispenser head (164) spans the gap (151) between upper surface portions (21,73) of the first and second conveyor belts (12,63), with an elongated side wall outlet portion (173) of the dispenser head (164) being exposed, in a downstream direction of the overall conveyor unit (9), to the upper surface (73) of the second conveyor belt (63). The system (2) provides for dispensing of coating material (180) directly onto the second, solid conveyor belt (63) and enrobing at least bottom and partial side portions (47,50,51) of food products (45) upon the solid belt (63). Provisions are made for scraping from the solid belt (63), removing from the coated food products (298) and recycling excess coating material (180).

title: Beverage dispenser systems and methods
abstract: A beverage dispensing system is provided, including a main body having a base portion, and a cradle portion configured to support a beverage container including a beverage to be dispensed. The cradle portion may include an elongated cavity, and a shoulder configured to receive an inverted beverage container. The beverage dispensing system may further include an adaptor, and a self-venting tap, and the adaptor is configured to couple a beverage container to the self-venting tap, such that a beverage may be dispensed through the tap.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing system, comprising:
a main body, comprising:
a base portion; and
a cradle portion configured to support a beverage container including a beverage to be dispensed, the cradle portion comprising:
an elongated cavity; and
a shoulder disposed below the elongated cavity, the shoulder having a curved surface, the curved surface of the shoulder configured to support a curved surface of an inverted beverage container;
an adaptor; and
a self-venting tap, wherein the adaptor comprises an inlet portion configured to be coupled to the beverage container and an outlet portion configured to be coupled to the self-venting tap.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the cradle portion is configured to support a beverage container at an inclined angle.
3. The system of claim 2, wherein the inclined angle is between about 0 degrees and about 60 degrees with respect to a vertical axis.
4. The system of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the base portion and cradle portion are integrally formed as a single piece.
5. The system of any one of claims 1 to 4, further comprising

title: Paperboard product
abstract: The present disclosure relates to paperboard having an improved basis weight to bending strength relationship and methods of making paperboard having an improved basis weight to bending strength relationship. In particular, a paperboard provided herein includes a refined cellulose in at least 1 ply.
claims:
1. A method of making a paperboard product, comprising: a. depositing a layer of a suspension of cellulose fibers, the suspension including a bond strengthening agent and having a cellulose content of about 80% to about 95% cellulose from a paper and/or recycled furnish and about 5% to about 20% refined cellulose; and b. applying pressure to the layer to form at least 1 ply of a paperboard product having 1 or more plies, wherein the paperboard product has: a basis weight reduction of 5% to 30% or a basis weight of about 90% to about 110% of a control paperboard having a single ply with a cellulose content that is 100% cellulose from the paper furnish; a bending stiffness of at least 90% of the control paperboard having a single ply with a cellulose content that is 100% cellulose from the paper furnish; and a thickness of about 90% to about 110% of the control paperboard having a single ply with a cellulose content that is 100% cellulose from the paper furnish; and wherein either: refined oat hulls are included in the at least 1 ply in an amount of about 5% to about 15% of the cellulose content of the at least 1 ply; or the refined cellulose is refined oat hulls and the bond strengthening agent is highly refined wood cellulose in a 3:1 to 4:1 ratio of refined oat hulls to highly refined cellulose.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the bending stiffness is at least 115% of the control paperboard.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the thickness is about 95% to about 105% of
assignee: UNIVERSITY OF MAINE SYSTEM BOARD OF TRUSTEES

title: Boiler overflow reducing composition for microwave cooking
claims:
1.一种适于在微波炉中烹饪干米或干面食时使用的防沸溢组合物，所述组合物包括约30％至约60％的粉末化花椰菜或粉末化豌豆纤维，其中，相对于在不含所述防沸溢组合物的有限容积容器中以相同方式烹饪干米或干面食，有效量的所述防沸溢组合物被配置成能够在用微波炉加热的有限容积容器中在水中烹饪干米或干面食时减少或消除沸溢。
2.根据权利要求1所述的防沸溢组合物，其中，所述组合物还包括约10％至约45％的精制淀粉、约5％至约10％的脂肪和至多6％的氯化钠、氯化钾和/或氯化钙。
3.根据权利要求2所述的防沸溢组合物，其中，所述精制淀粉包括木薯淀粉和/或玉米淀粉。
4.根据权利要求2所述的防沸溢组合物，其中，所述脂肪包括椰子油。
5.根据权利要求1-3所述的防沸溢组合物，其中，所述组合物基本上由以下组成：
a.30-60％的粉末化花椰菜或粉末化豌豆纤维，
b.10％至45％的精制淀粉，
c.5％至10％的脂肪，和
d.1％至3％的精盐和/或海盐。
6.一种耐贮存食物产品，所述耐贮存食物产品包括：
a.干米或干面食；
b.有效量的防沸溢组合物，所述防沸溢组合物适于在微波炉中烹饪干米或干面食时使用，所述组合物包括约30％至约60％的粉末化豌豆纤维，其中，相对于在不含所述防沸溢组合物的有限容积容器中以相同方式烹饪干米或干面食，所述有效量的防沸溢组合物被配置成能够在用微波炉加热的有限容积容器中在水中烹饪干米或干面食时减少或消除沸溢；以及
c.含有所述组合物和干米或干面食的有限容积的可应用微波的容器。
7.根据权利要求6所述的耐贮存食物产品，其中，所述有效量包括约5％至约13％重量的干米或干面食。
8.根据权利要求6或7所述的耐贮存食物产品，其中，

title: Roller with Replaceable Shell
abstract: A roller is provided with replaceable shells formed of panels. The roller includes a shaft extending in a longitudinal direction. A center flange and two end flanges are mounted on the shaft and extend radially outward from the shaft at axially spaced locations. Between each end flange and one side of the center flange, a replaceable shell is provided. Preferably, multiple additional center flanges and replaceable shells are mounted on the shaft between the end flanges. An internal pin system is employed to ensure no screws are visible while holding the shell panels in place.
claims:
1. A roller comprising:
a shaft extending in a longitudinal direction and having a central section including an axially facing wall formed with mounting holes;
a center flange extending radially outward from the shaft;
an end flange extending radially outward from the shaft and including inner mounting holes and outer mounting holes located radially outward of the inner mounting holes, wherein a fastener extends through one of the inner mounting holes in the end flange aligned with one of the mounting holes in the axially facing wall to fasten the end flange to the shaft; and
a replaceable shell removably mounted on the shaft between the center flange and the end flange.
2. The roller of claim 1, further comprising an outer fastener extending through one of the outer mounting holes in the end flange into a mounting hole in the replaceable shell, to fasten the replaceable shell to the end flange.
3. The roller of claim 2, wherein the fastener is a threaded fastener extending through one of the inner mounting holes in the end flange, and one of the mounting holes in the axially facing wall to fasten the end flange to the shaft.
4. The roller of claim 3, wherein the outer fastener is a pin extending through one of the outer mounting holes in the end flange into a mounting hole in the replaceable shell, to fasten the replaceable shell to the end flange.

title: Multi-sensor awareness for resource tracking and quantization
claims:
1.一种用于资源跟踪和量化的多传感器感知的计算机实现的方法，所述方法包括：
接收指示资源标识符、资源位置和资源数量的资源信息；
基于从第一感测设备接收的传感器数据和所述资源标识符，在所述资源位置处跟踪从所述资源位置移除并放置在预定义位置处的资源；
基于由从第二感测设备接收的传感器数据指示的深度信息，确定从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述资源的数量；
确定所述资源数量与从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述资源的数量之间的匹配；以及
基于所述资源数量与从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述资源的数量之间的所述匹配，生成指示与所述资源匹配的附加资源应当停止被从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的通知。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中跟踪从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述资源还包括：
基于特征分类数据与从接收自所述第一感测设备的所述传感器数据提取的特征之间的对应关系，识别所述资源的类型；
基于所述资源的类型与由所述资源标识符指示的资源的类型之间的对应关系，识别所述资源；
至少基于从接收自所述第一感测设备的所述传感器数据提取的第一图像中指示的所述资源的位置与从接收自所述第一感测设备的所述传感器数据提取的第二图像中指示的所述资源的位置之间的差异，确定所述资源被放置在所述预定义位置的区域中；以及
使得显示放置在所述预定义位置的区域中的所述资源的指示。
3.根据权利要求2所述的方法，其中放置在所述预定义位置的区域中的所述资源的指示包括与所述资源相关联的值、所述资源的图像或所述资源的图形表示中的至少一者。
4.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中确定从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述资源的数量还包括：
使得显示放置在与所述资源的资源类型相关联的所述预定义位置的区域中的所述资源的指示；以及
基于由所述深度信息指示的深度值和与所述资源类型的数量相关联的深度值之间的匹配，确定所述资源的数量。
5.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中使得与所述资源匹配的附加资源停止被从所述资源位置移除并放置在所述预定义位置处的所述通知包括声音通知、文本通知或

title: Enzymatic method for preparing Rebaudioside J
abstract: Provided is a method for preparing Rebaudioside J using an enzymatic method, comprising using rebaudioside A as a substrate, and making the substrate, in the presence of a glycosyl donor, react under the catalysis of a UDP-glycosyltransferase-containing recombinant cell and/or UDP-glycosyltransferase prepared therefrom to generate Rebaudioside J.
claims:
1. An enzymatic method for preparing Rebaudioside J, the method comprising reacting Rebaudioside A with a rhamnosyl donor in a reaction system comprising: recombinant cells comprising a UDP-glycosyltransferase, a UDP-glycosyltransferase prepared therefrom, or both the recombinant cells comprising the UDP-glycosyltransferase and the UDP-glycosyltransferase prepared therefrom, wherein the UDP-glycosyltransferase comprises an amino acid sequence having at least 80% sequence identity to SEQ ID NO: 2, wherein Rebaudioside A is converted to Rebaudioside J at a conversion rate greater than 90%.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the UDP-glycosyltransferase comprises an amino acid sequence having at least 90% sequence identity to SEQ ID NO: 2.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the rhamnosyl donor is a UDP-rhamnose.
4. The method of claim 2, wherein the UDP-glycosyltransferase is a UGT-B from Oryza sativa.
5. The method of claim 2, wherein the reaction system is aqueous and has a temperature of 35-45° C. and a pH of 7.5 to 8.5.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the reaction system comprises a phosphate buffer solution.
7. The method of claim 5, wherein the reaction system further comprises a cell-permeabilizing agent.

title: Method for binding particulates to a snack base
abstract: The invention provides novel products and methods. The composition of the invention is a coated food product generally comprising: a product base, a slurry coating and a dry set coating. Specifically, there is disclosed a food product with a cookie and cream coating and a method of coating a food product with a cookie and cream coating.
claims:
1. A method of preparing a coated food product including individual coated snack pieces comprising the steps of:
A. providing individual product base pieces;
B. applying a slurry coating to an exterior surface of said product base pieces; and
C. applying a dry set coating to said product base pieces thereby providing a substantially coated food product including individual coated snack pieces,
wherein said dry set coating comprises both a dry set material having a particle size of 500 micrometers or less and particulates having a particle size of greater than 500 micrometers to about 5000 micrometers, and
wherein a weight ratio of the product base pieces to the slurry coating is between 1:1 and 1.25:1 and a weight ratio of the product base pieces to the dry set coating is at least 2:1 and
wherein the slurry coating is configured to reduce stickiness and reduce bridging between the individual coated snack pieces.
2. The method as in claim 1, further comprising the step of:
D. removing said substantially coated food product from an enrobing/tumbling device when the substantially coated food product has a temperature of at most about 5 degrees fahrenheit below a melting point of said slurry coating.
3. The method as in claim 1, wherein said slurry coating is applied

title: Sweetening compositions
abstract: This disclosure provides aqueous steviol glycoside compositions as well as syrups and beverages comprising these compositions. In certain embodiments, the aqueous steviol glycoside composition comprises water and a sweetening composition, wherein the sweetening composition is solubilized in the water and comprises a stevioside composition and rebaudioside D.

title: System and method for automatically detecting and initiating a walk
abstract: A system, method, and apparatus for detecting the start of a walk event. The method comprises identifying the location of a wearable device; determining if the wearable device has exited a geo-fence zone; confirming that a wearable device is in a walk mode if it is determined that the wearable device has exited a geo-fence zone and that the wearable device is not connected to a wireless network; enabling a GPS receiver; continuously recording the location of the wearable device received from the GPS receiver while the wearable device is in a walk mode; and transmitting the recorded location of the wearable device while the wearable device is in a walk mode.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A method for detecting the start of a walk event, the method comprising: identifying the location of a wearable device; determining if the wearable device has exited a geo-fence zone; confirming that a wearable device is in a walk mode if it is determined that the wearable device has exited a geo-fence zone, wherein confirming that a wearable device is in a walk mode further comprises: retrieving current environment details associated with the wearable device; retrieving past walk environment details associated with the wearable device; comparing the current environment details to the past walk environment details to identify at least one similarity between the current environment details and past walk environment details; and confirming that a wearable device is in a walk mode upon identifying at least one similarity between the current environment details and past walk environment details; enabling a GPS receiver; continuously recording the location of the wearable device received from the GPS receiver while the wearable device is in a walk mode; and transmitting the recorded location of the wearable device while the wearable device is in a walk mode.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein the current environment details include the date and time it is determined that the device has exited a geo-fence zone and the location of the wearable device.
3. The method according to claim 2 wherein past walk environment details include the date, time, and location of past walks, a list of scheduled walks, and one or more previous responses to a walk mode prompt. 19 Date Reçue/Date Received 2023-11-09

title: Systems, methods, and apparatus for predicting and reducing pre-and post-harvest aflatoxin contamination of corn using machine learning
abstract: The present disclosure provides a method for evaluating a decision for processing batches of corn in a selected area. The method includes obtaining a time series of meteorological data associated with a selected region and predicting an amount of aspergillus flavus and aflatoxin contamination of a plurality of batches of corn in the time series using an integrated mechanism model based on the meteorological data. The integrated mechanism model may include estimated parameters and reference parameters. Estimation parameters may be optimized based on a comparison of a historical measurement data set and a historical prediction data set. The method further includes evaluating a decision to process the plurality of batches of corn in the selected area based on the predicted amount of Aspergillus flavus and the predicted aflatoxin contamination.
claims:
1.一种方法，其包括由一个或多个计算系统：
获得与选定区域相关联的时间序列的气象数据；
基于所述气象数据使用集成机理模型预测多个批次作物在时间序列中的黄曲霉的量和黄曲霉毒素污染，其中所述集成机理模型包括估计参数和参考参数，其中所述估计参数基于历史测量数据集和历史预测数据集的比较进行优化；和
基于预测的黄曲霉的量和预测的黄曲霉毒素污染评估在所述选定区域加工所述多个批次作物的决策。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述集成机理模型包括与收获前阶段、收获加工阶段和收获后阶段相关联的机制。
3.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述气象数据包括温度数据、湿度数据和降雨数据。
4.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述气象数据具有三小时的时间分辨率以及十公里的空间分辨率，时间数据被线性插值到1小时的时间分辨率。
5.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述历史测量数据集包括用于参数化所述集成机理模型的第一数据集，以及用于验证所述集成机理模型的第二数据集。
6.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述估计参数包括孢子形成率、收获前黄曲霉生长率、收获前黄曲霉毒素产生率、干燥保护期、收获后黄曲霉生长率以及收获后黄曲霉毒素产生率。
7.一种或多种包含软件的计算机可读非暂时性存储介质，其在被执行时可操作以：
获得与选定区域相关联的时间序列的气象数据；
基于所述气象数据使用集成机理模型预测多个批次作物在时间序列中的黄曲霉的量和黄曲霉毒素污染，其中所述集成机理模型包括估计参数和参考参数，其中所述估计参数基于历史测量数据集和历史预测数据集的比较进行优化；和
基于预测的黄曲霉的量和预测的黄曲霉毒素污染评估在所述选定区域加工所述多个批次作物的决策。
8.根据权利要求7所述的介质，其中，所述集成机理模型包括与收获前阶段、收获加工阶段和收获后阶段相关联的机制。
9.根据权利要求7所述的介质，其中，所述气象数据包括温度数据、湿度数据和降雨数据。
10.根据权利要求7所述的介质，其中，所述气象数据具有三小时的时间

title: Cereal Food Product and Method of Making the Same
abstract: Cocoa or cinnamon is mixed at least one enzyme to form a mixture, and the mixture is combined with a cereal food composition. In one embodiment, the cereal food composition is extruded or otherwise formed into a plurality of cereal pieces after the mixture is combined with the food composition. In another embodiment, the mixture is coated onto cereal pieces formed from the food composition. Preferably, the at least one enzyme includes at least two carbohydrases, and can also include soluble fiber enzymes, and even one or more fat soluble enzymes. In each case, the at least one enzyme is deactivated, either during working of the cocoa or cinnamon after combining with the cereal food composition or prior to the mixture being combined with the cereal food composition.
claims:
1. A cereal food product comprising:
a cereal composition;
at least one of cocoa and cinnamon; and
at least one deactivated enzyme mixed with the at least one of cocoa and cinnamon, wherein the at least one deactivated enzyme includes a carbohydrase.
2. The cereal food product of claim 1, wherein the at least one deactivated enzyme constitutes cellulase and xylanase.
3. The cereal food product of claim 1, wherein the at least one deactivated enzyme further includes at least two soluble fiber enzymes.
4. The cereal food product of claim 3, wherein the at least two soluble fiber enzymes include pectinase and protease.
5. The cereal food product of claim 3, wherein the at least one deactivated enzyme further includes at least one fat soluble enzyme.
6. The cereal food product of claim 5, wherein the at least one fat soluble enzyme constitutes lipase.
7. The cereal food product of claim 3, wherein the at least one of cocoa and cinnamon constitutes cocoa, and the at least one deactivated enzyme constitutes cellulase, xylanase, pectinase, protease and lipase.

title: System, method, and apparatus for dental pathology detection on x-ray images in veterinary ecosystems
abstract: In one embodiment, a method includes accessing a first image depicting an oral cavity of an animal, detecting multiple teeth of the animal from the first image based on machine-learning models, identifying each detected teeth based on a numbering protocol based on the machine-learning models, determining whether the tooth is healthy or has any dental pathology for each of the identified teeth based on the machine-learning models, localizing each tooth that has any pathology based on the numbering protocol, and generating a first report comprising a localization of each tooth that has any pathology.
claims:
1. A method comprising, by one or more computing systems:
accessing a first image depicting an oral cavity associated with an animal;
detecting, based on one or more machine-learning models, a plurality of teeth associated with the animal from the first image;
identifying, based on the one or more machine-learning models, each of the detected teeth based on a numbering protocol;
determining, for each of the identified teeth based on the one or more machinelearning models, whether the tooth is healthy or has any dental pathology;
localizing each tooth that has any pathology based on the numbering protocol; and
generating a first report comprising a localization of each tooth that has any pathology.
2. The method of Claim 1, wherein the first image comprises an X-ray image.
3. The method of Claim 1 or 2, wherein the first image is based on PNG format or DICOM format.
4. The method of any of Claims 1-3, further comprising:
determining a quadrant for the first image based on the numbering protocol.
5. The method of any of Claims 1-4, further comprising:

title: Ready-to-eat protein fortified cereal
abstract: A ready-to-eat breakfast cereal includes a plurality of base cereal pieces fortified with high quality protein. The base cereal pieces consist of a starch-based ingredient, a protein ingredient component, oil and optionally a bran ingredient or other ingredients, but no added gums. The protein ingredient component includes wheat protein isolate or vital wheat gluten, as well as legume protein concentrate or legume protein isolate. A method of making ready-to-eat breakfast cereal incorporating the plurality of the base cereal pieces includes processing dough to form pellets, drying the pellets to form dried pellets and forming the dried pellets into cereal base pieces. Forming the dried pellets can include forming the dried pellets into flakes or shredded cereal biscuits. Another method of making ready-to-eat breakfast cereal incorporating the plurality of the base cereal pieces includes processing dough to form an expanded rope and forming the rope into pillow-shaped pieces.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A ready-to-eat breakfast cereal, comprising a plurality of base cereal pieces, the base cereal pieces consisting of a. a starch-based ingredient having a starch content of 65% to 100% by dry weight, the starch-based ingredient included in an amount of at least 30% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces; b. a protein ingredient component in an amount sufficient to achieve a protein content of greater than 20% to about 55% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces, the protein ingredient component comprising: i. wheat protein isolate or vital wheat gluten in an amount of about 12% to about 50% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces; and ii. legume protein concentrate or legume protein isolate in an amount of up to about 20% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces; c. oil in an amount of up to about 10% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces; d. a bran ingredient in an amount of up to 25% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces; e. no added gums; and f. other ingredients in a total amount of less than 10% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces.
2. The cereal of claim 1, wherein the starch-based ingredient is included in an amount of at least 45% by dry weight.
3. The cereal of claim 1 or 2, wherein the protein ingredient component is included in an amount sufficient to achieve a protein content of greater than 20% to about 40% by dry weight of the base cereal pieces, the protein ingredient component comprising: i. wheat

title: Crunchy aggregate food with reduced sugar, low fat, and improved flavor
abstract: Described herein is a shelf stable crunchy edible aggregate that includes an oat flour-based binder. The snack food includes visible particulates bound together with a rigid binder, where the binder includes a non-hydrolyzed oat flour, and sugar, where the ratio of sugar to oat flour is about 1:1 to about 2:1 by dry weight.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A packaged food product having a crunchy texture, the food product comprising an aggregate of visible particulates bound by a rigid binder, the binder being included in an amount of about 14% to about 30% by dry weight of the aggregate, and comprising: a. a non-hydrolyzed oat flour in an amount of about 20% to about 40% by dry weight of the binder; b. sugar in an amount of about 40% to about 60% by dry weight of the binder; c. a fat ingredient in an amount of about 5% to about 12% by dry weight of the binder, the fat ingredient having a melting point of 32° C or less; and d. no gluten-containing ingredients.
2. The packaged food of claim 1, wherein the binder contributes sugar in an amount of less than 10% by dry weight of the aggregate.
3. The packaged food of claim 1 or 2, wherein the aggregate comprises added sugar in an amount of less than 18% by dry weight of the aggregate.
4. The packaged food of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the aggregate contains no gluten-containing ingredients.
5. The packaged food of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the visible particulates comprises at least 50% by weight particulates with low permeability.
6. The packaged food of any one of claims 1-5, wherein the fat ingredient comprises coconut oil, palm kernel oil, canola oil, soybean oil, s

title: Bottle blowing mold
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of bottle blowing molds, in particular to a bottle blowing mold, which comprises a base plate, a left mold and a right mold, an adjusting mechanism comprises an adjusting box, a threaded rod is rotatably mounted in the adjusting box, movable blocks which are symmetrically distributed are mounted on the threaded rod in a threaded manner, first fixing rods are mounted at the upper ends of the movable blocks, and a second fixing rod is mounted at the lower ends of the first fixing rods. A first fixing rod is installed on the left mold, a second fixing rod is installed on the first fixing rod, an air box is arranged at the upper end of the adjusting box, the left mold and the right mold are installed at the tail end of the second fixing rod respectively and are symmetrically distributed, bottle blowing cavities are formed in the left mold and the right mold respectively, partition plates are installed in the left mold and the right mold respectively, and air blowing cavities are formed between the partition plates and the bottle blowing cavities. A cooling water cavity is formed between the partition plate and the inner wall of the left mold and the inner wall of the right mold, and cooling fins are arranged on the outer surface of the bottle blowing cavity and extend into the cooling water cavity. The bottle blowing device has the advantages that the cooling efficiency of bottle blowing products is high, and demolding is facilitated.
claims:
1.一种吹瓶模具，包括底座板(101)、左模(401)和右模(404)，其特征在于：所述底座板(101)的上端设置有调节机构(201)，调节机构(201)包括：
调节盒(203)，所述调节盒(203)内转动安装有螺纹杆(204)，螺纹杆(204)上螺纹安装有呈对称分布的活动块(202)，活动块(202)的上端安装有第一固定杆(305)，第一固定杆(305)上安装有第二固定杆(304)；
所述调节盒(203)的上端设置有风箱(301)，风箱(301)的上端呈开口设置，风箱(301)的侧端开设有进风口(306)；
所述左模(401)和右模(404)分别安装在第二固定杆(304)的末端，左模(401)和右模(404)呈对称分布，所述左模(401)和右模(404)内均设置有吹瓶腔(403)，左模(401)和右模(404)内均安装有隔板(407)，所述隔板(407)与吹瓶腔(403)之间构成吹风腔(402)，隔板(407)与左模(401)和右模(404)内壁之间构成降温水腔(405)，所述吹瓶腔(403)外表面设置有散热片(406)，散热片(406)延伸至降温水腔(405)内。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述螺纹杆(204)上设置有正螺纹结构和反螺纹结构，正螺纹结构和反螺纹结构关于螺纹杆(204)呈阵列分布。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述调节盒(203)的上端开设有呈对称分布的活动口(206)，第一固定杆(305)从活动口(206)延伸出调节盒(203)。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述调节盒(203)的侧端安装有第一驱动设备(205)，第一驱动设备(205)的主轴与螺纹杆(204)的轴心连接。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述风箱(301)内安装有第二驱动设备(302)，第二驱动设备(302)的主轴末端安装有扇叶(303)。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述左模(401)和右模(404)的上端和下端均安装有进水管(408)和出水管，进水管(408)和出水管与降温水腔(405)连通，且进水管(408)和出水管上均设置有阀门。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种吹瓶模具，其特征在于：所述左模(401)和右模(404)的上端和下端均设置有与吹风腔(402)连通的开口。
assignee: 郑州百事饮料有限公司

title: Vegetable and/or fruit-containing snack product and manufacture thereof
abstract: A non-fried fruit and/or vegetable containing snack product comprising: a hard starch matrix comprising potato starch and one or more fruits and/or vegetables; and one or more phytochemicals comprising a carotenoid, a glucosinolate, a flavonoid, or a mixture thereof; wherein the fruit and/or vegetable content of the product is 15-28 wt% based on the weight of the product; and the fruit and/or vegetable content of the product is derived from undehydrated, non-powdered fruits and/or vegetables. A dough for making the snack product and a method of making are also disclosed.
claims:
1.一种非油炸的含水果和/或蔬菜的零食产品，包含：硬质淀粉基质，其包括马铃薯淀粉和一种或多种水果和/或蔬菜；以及一种或多种植物化学物质，其包括类胡萝卜素、硫代葡萄糖苷、类黄酮或其混合物；其中：
基于所述产品的重量，所述产品的水果和/或蔬菜含量为15-28wt％；并且
所述产品的水果和/或蔬菜含量源自未脱水、非粉状的水果和/或蔬菜。
2.根据权利要求1所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的所述水果和/或蔬菜含量中的至少一些以碎片或颗粒的形式可见。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的所述水果和/或蔬菜含量中的至少一些具有完整的细胞结构。
4.根据权利要求1至3中任一项所述的零食产品，其中，基于所述产品的重量，所述产品的所述水果和/或蔬菜含量为18-27wt％。
5.根据权利要求1至4中任一项所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的所述水果和/或蔬菜含量源自新鲜的或单体速冻(IQF)的水果和/或蔬菜。
6.根据权利要求1至5中任一项所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的类胡萝卜素含量为约2至约25mg/100g零食产品；硫代葡萄糖苷含量为约10至约58mg/100g零食产品；和/或类黄酮含量为约85至约170mg/100g零食产品。
7.根据权利要求1至6中任一项所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的所述水果和/或蔬菜含量源自新鲜水果和/或蔬菜；并且
其中，所述产品的类胡萝卜素含量为16.5-25mg/100g零食产品；硫代葡萄糖苷含量为45-55mg/100g零食产品；和/或类黄酮含量为155-170mg/100g零食产品。
8.根据权利要求7所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的类胡萝卜素含量为19-22.5mg/100g零食产品；硫代葡萄糖苷含量为46-54mg/100g零食产品；和/或类黄酮含量为158-168mg/100g零食产品。
9.根据权利要求8所述的零食产品，其中，所述产品的类胡萝卜素含量为19-22.5mg/100g零食产品；硫代葡萄糖苷含量为46-54m

title: System and methods for carbonating a liquid
abstract: Embodiments described herein relate to systems and methods for carbonating a liquid at ambient temperature. The system may include a liquid source; a carbon dioxide source; and a contactor for carbonating the liquid. The contactor may include channels and a sparge for carbonating liquid flowing through the channels. The system may produce a liquid having high levels of carbonation at ambient temperature. The sparge may generate microbubbles or nanobubbles to allow for cost-effective carbonation at ambient temperatures. The bubbles may have an average diameter of 100 μm or less. The system may carbonate liquid at a rate of 1 gram to 10 grams carbon dioxide per liter.
claims:
1. A system for carbonating a liquid, the system comprising:
a liquid source;
a carbon dioxide source; and
a contactor for carbonating the liquid, the contactor comprising:
a first channel in communication with the liquid source, the first channel having a first inner diameter, the first channel comprising a first end, a second end, and a first inlet defined in a sidewall of the first channel;
a second channel comprising a first end in fluid communication with the second end of the first channel, the second channel having a second inner diameter that is smaller than the first inner diameter; and
a sparge disposed at least partially within the first channel and at least partially within the second channel, wherein the sparge is configured to generate bubbles having an average diameter of 100 pm or less, and wherein the sparge is configured to provide carbon dioxide to the second channel at a rate of 1 gram to 10 grams carbon dioxide per liter of the liquid flowing through the contactor;
wherein the system is configured to operate at ambient temperature.
2. The system of claim 1, further comprising a restrictor disposed at the second end of the first channel, the restrictor comprising a tapered inner surface.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein the sparge comprises pores through which carbon dioxi

title: Palatable animal food composition
abstract: The present disclosure relates to the field of palatabity. In particular, the present disclosure relates a palatable food composition for a companion animal including from about 11% to about 50%, by weight, of fat, wherein from about 1.5% to about 90%, by weight of the fat content, is butterfat.
claims:
CLAIMS

title: High protein food
abstract: Described herein is a food that is suitable for use as a shelf stable nut butter based spread. The food has a protein content of at least 25% by weight, and a nut butter content of at least 50% by weight. The food retains a desirable eating experience, similar to a natural nut butter spread or a stabilized nut butter spread despite having a high protein content.
claims:
8.989960 CLAIMS:
1. A food, comprising: a. at least 25% protein by weight of the food, the protein including a powdered protein ingredient contributing at least 12% protein by weight of the food; b. a nut butter in an amount of at least 50% by weight of the food; c. a stabilizing fat in an amount of about 14% to about 22% by weight of the food, the stabilizing fat exhibiting at least one of: 1) having a Mettler Dropping Point of from about 32 C to about 48 C, and a C to 40 C solid fat content (SFC1O-40) profile, the SFC10-40 profile having a foimula of y = mx + b, where y is solid fat content, x is temperature in Celsius, m is slope having a value between about -1.5 and about -3.5, and b is a y-intercept having a value between about 60 C and about 120 C; and 2. contributing lauric acid in an amount of about 3% to about 10% by weight of the food; and d. a powdered food ingredient in an amount of about 8% to about 25% by weight of the food.
2. The food of claim 1, wherein the stabilizing fat contributes the lauric acid and the food further comprises: e. a shelf stability of at least 60 days; f. a structure that facilitates spreadability; and g. a texture that exhibits a decrease in shear resistance at 37 C relative to 21 C.
3. The food of claim 2, wherein the powdered food ingredient comprises erythritol in an amount of about 5% to about 15% by weight of the food.
4. The food of claim 2 o

title: Self-pressurized concentrate source for post-mix equipment
abstract: A post-mix beverage dispenser utilizing a liquid concentrate in a self-pressurized container is provided. The beverage dispenser includes a connector and flow control valve to regulate the pressure of the liquid concentrate in the system. The liquid concentrate and diluent are mixed at the nozzle of the post-mix beverage dispenser.
claims:
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A post-mix beverage dispensing system comprising: a nozzle; a diluent conduit in fluid communication with the nozzle; a concentrate conduit in fluid communication with the nozzle; a flow control valve in fluid communication with the concentrate conduit and a source conduit; and a self-pressurized concentrate source connected to the source conduit by a connector, the self-pressurized concentrate source including: a concentrate chamber containing a beverage concentrate, a pressurized outer container surrounding the concentrate chamber and exerting a pressure on the concentrate chamber, and a valve assembly in fluid communication with an interior of the concentrate chamber, such that the connector opens the valve assembly, wherein the beverage concentrate and a diluent mix at the nozzle to dispense a beverage.
2. The post-mix beverage dispensing system of claim 1, further comprising a housing, such that the diluent conduit, concentrate conduit, flow control valve, and self- pressurized concentrate source are positioned within an interior area of the housing.
3. The post-mix beverage dispensing system of claim 1, wherein the concentrate chamber and the pressurized outer container are transparent, and wherein the concentrate chamber is a bag.
4. The post-mix beverage dispensing system of claim 1, wherein the beverage concentrate has a concentration ratio of greater than or equal to approximately 30:1.

title: Handheld fan
abstract: The utility model discloses a handheld fan which comprises a handle, a circuit board, a key switch, a rotary encoder and a control assembly, a mounting cavity is formed in the handle, and an exposing opening communicated with the mounting cavity is formed in the handle; the circuit board is arranged in the mounting cavity; the key switch is arranged on the circuit board and comprises a pressed part and an elastic piece, the pressed part can trigger or disconnect a switch control circuit of the circuit board when pressed, and the elastic piece is in transmission connection with the pressed part so as to drive the pressed part to move and reset; the rotary encoder is arranged on the circuit board and is connected with the circuit board; the control assembly comprises a rolling piece and a shaft body, part of the structure of the rolling piece is arranged in the installation cavity, the other part of the structure of the rolling piece is exposed out of the handle through the exposing opening, the part, located in the installation cavity, of the rolling piece is connected with the shaft body, and part of the structure of the shaft body is arranged on the side, back to the circuit board, of the pressed part. And the other part of the structure of the shaft body is connected with the rotary encoder. According to the technical scheme, fine wind speed adjustment can be achieved.
claims:

所述第二转轴(522)设于所述滚动件(51)靠近所述转动编码器(4)的一侧，并分别与所述滚动件(51)和所述转动编码器(4)相连。
3.如权利要求2所述的手持式风扇，其特征在于，所述第一转轴(521)的轴线和所述滚动件(51)的轴线重合，所述第一转轴(521)在所述手柄(1)的宽度方向上延伸，并在所述手柄(1)的厚度方向上可移动设置，以按压所述受压部(31)；
所述手持式风扇还包括第一限位件(6)，所述第一限位件(6)设于所述安装腔(11)，所述第一限位件(6)包括两个第一限位臂(61)，两个所述第一限位臂(61)在所述手柄(1)的长度方向上间隔设置，所述两个第一限位臂(61)分别位于所述第一转轴(521)相对的两侧，以共同限制所述第一转轴(521)在所述手柄(1)的长度方向上移动。

title: Heat stable extruded protein composition and related food products
claims:
1. A method of making a packaged food product, comprising: a. producing a heat stable extruded protein composition from a stream comprising a proteinaceous composition having a protein content of about 70% to about 85% by dry weight, a moisture content of from about 45% to about 56%, and an oil content of about 3% to about 10% by dry weight at a barrel temperature of from about 270° F. to about 330° F.; b. producing a thermally processed protein composition by applying to the heat stable extruded protein composition heat in an amount sufficient to render the heat stable extruded protein composition pasteurized or commercially sterile, the thermally processed protein composition having protein fibers in a generally parallel orientation and having a protein content of about 70% to about 85% by dry weight, a hardness greater than 3 kg, a chewiness greater than 10 kg*mm, and a springiness of at least 0.90; and c. packaging the thermally processed protein composition in a hermetically sealed container.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the heat stable extruded protein composition is placed in the hermetically sealed container prior to applying heat to produce the thermally processed protein composition.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the heat stable extruded protein composition is thermally processed with or in a liquid comprising a coloring agent or a flavoring agent.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the liquid is a sauce or a broth.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the hardness

title: Rotary dough cutter and method of operation
claims:
1. A rotary dough cutter comprising:
a shaft;
a plurality of walls extending radially outward from the shaft, wherein the plurality of walls are configured to cut a plurality of dough pieces from a dough sheet, the plurality of walls define a plurality of dough cutter molds each having an interior surface that is curved, the plurality of dough cutter molds include a first dough cutter mold and a second dough cutter mold, and a first wall of the plurality of walls defines part of both the first dough cutter mold and the second dough cutter mold; and
a plurality of interior blades extending radially outward from the shaft, wherein the plurality of interior blades are configured to score the plurality of dough pieces so to cut into but not all the way through the dough sheet, and each of the plurality of interior blades is located in one of the plurality of dough cutter molds wherein each of the plurality of interior blades in height is shorter than a height of each of the plurality of the walls and each of the plurality of interior blades is integrated with the respective curved interior surface of the one of the plurality of dough cutter molds.
2. The rotary dough cutter of claim 1, wherein each of the plurality of dough cutter molds has an interior, with the interior surface being curved inward towards the interior.
3. The rotary dough cutter of claim 1, wherein the plurality of dough cutter molds include a third dough cutter mold that is adjacent both the first and second dough cutter molds.

title: Compositions and comestibles
abstract: D-psicose/erythritol compositions comprise, in combination, D-psicose and erythritol as sweeteners together with one or more other edible ingredients. Comestibles are provided, including beverage products and other food products, comprising the novel D-psicose/erythritol compositions. D-psicose and erythritol may each be present in a comestible in a concentration sufficient independently of the other to perceptibly sweeten the composition. An additional sweetener component and other ingredients may be included in the formulation.
claims:
1. A ready-to-drink beverage product comprising: carbonated water, D-psicose in an at least a sweetening amount, but not more than 2.1 wt. %, erythritol in an at least a sweetening amount, but not more than 3.5 wt. %, acidulant comprising at least one acid, rebaudioside M in a concentration between about 50 ppm and about 600 ppm, a sweetening amount of rebaudioside D, a sweetening amount of rebaudioside A, and wherein the beverage product has a pH between 3.0 and 3.5.
2. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 1, wherein rebaudioside M is present in a concentration of about 100 ppm, about 200 ppm, about 300 ppm, about 400 ppm, or about 500 ppm.
3. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 1, wherein rebaudioside A is present in an amount up to 0.05 wt. % and rebaudioside D is present in an amount up to 0.05 wt. %.
4. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 1, wherein rebaudioside A is present in an amount of 0.01 wt. % to 0.03 wt. % and rebaudioside D is present in an amount of 0.01 wt. % to 0.03 wt. %.
5. The ready-to-drink beverage product according to claim 1, wherein D-psicose is present in an amount of 0.5 wt. % to 2.1 wt. %, erythritol is present in an amount of 0.5 wt. % to 3

title: System and method for coating soft and sticky food cores
abstract: A product conveying and coating system (2) includes multiple, sequentially arranged conveyor units (7; 55; 80), with at least one conveyor unit (80) being an open belt type. A carrier sheet (18) is placed on a first of the conveyor units (7), a web (23) of coating material in liquid form is deposited on the carrier sheet (7) and spaced ropes (40, 41) of soft and sticky material are deposited on and settle into the web (23). The carrier sheet (18), web(23) and ropes (40, 41) are transferred to a second conveyor unit (55) after the coating material of the web (23) solidifies, whereupon the ropes (40, 41) are cut into bar-length pieces (70). Thereafter, the carrier sheet (18) is removed while the web (23) and pieces (70) are transferred to the open belt conveyor unit (80) and exposed to an enrober (90). The enrober (90) coats the pieces (70) while melting portions of the web (23) between the pieces (70) in order to form full coated or encapsulated food products (97) with soft and sticky cores.
claims:
CA 03232460 2024-03-13 WO 2023/039273 PCT/US2022/043295 I/WE CLAIM:
1. A method of producing coated food products comprising: applying a carrier sheet upon a first conveyor unit; dispensing a web of coating material laterally across a portion of the carrier sheet, with the coating material being in liquid form; delivering a plurality of laterally spaced ropes upon the web, with the ropes being made of a soft and sticky material; solidifying the coating material to form a solid web; transferring the soft and sticky material upon the carrier sheet and solid web onto a second conveyor unit; cutting the plurality of laterally spaced ropes into food pieces; removing the carrier sheet from beneath the solid web; transferring the soft and sticky material upon the solid web, without the carrier sheet, onto a third conveyor unit; and enrobing the food pieces while removing portions of the solid web between the food pieces in forming the coated food products having cores of the soft and sticky material.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the third conveyor unit includes an open conveyor belt and removing portions of the solid web comprises melting the portions, with the coating material of the portions flowing through the open conveyor belt.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the plurality of laterally spaced ropes are extruded onto the web.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the plurality of laterally sp

title: Compositions providing slow release of caffeine
abstract: The present disclosure relates to complexes comprising caffeine and tannic acid as well as emulsions and beverages comprising these complexes which slow the release of the caffeine. Also described are methods of preparing the complexes and emulsions and beverages comprising caffeine-tannic acid complexes.
claims:
1. An emulsion comprising: a. an oil phase comprising at least one oil comprising a complex comprising caffeine and tannic acid; and b. an aqueous phase comprising water; wherein the emulsion comprises from about 2 wt % to about 30 wt % of the at least one oil.
2. The emulsion of claim 1, further comprising one or more stabilizers.
3. The emulsion of claim 1, further comprising one or more emulsifiers.
4. The emulsion of claim 1, wherein the emulsion comprises about 5 wt % to about 10 wt % of the at least one oil.
5. The emulsion of claim 1, wherein the at least one oil is selected from the group consisting of one or more edible oils, one or more edible waxes, and combinations thereof.
6. The emulsion of claim 1, wherein the at least one oil is selected from the group consisting of ghee, mustard oil, olive oil, rice bran oil, flaxseed oil, groundnut oil, sesame oil, almond oil, cashew oil, canola oil, soybean oil, avocado oil, walnut oil, grapeseed oil, sunflower oil, medium chain triglycerides, coconut oil, palm kernel oil, carnuba wax, beeswax, paraffin wax, rice bran wax, candelilla wax, sunflower wax, sugarcane wax, propolis wax, shellac wax, and combinations thereof.
7. The emulsion of claim 1, wherein the at least one oil is selected from the group consisting of sunflower

title: Automatic flux racking machine
abstract: The invention discloses an automatic flux racking machine which comprises a discharging mechanism and a racking mechanism, the discharging mechanism is arranged above the racking mechanism and comprises a hanging frame used for hanging a material bag and a discharging hopper, and the discharging hopper is located on one side of the top of the racking mechanism; the sub-packaging mechanism comprises a mounting flat plate, a sub-packaging funnel and a plurality of charging barrels, the charging barrels are mounted at the bottom of the mounting flat plate and are flush with the surface of the mounting flat plate, the distribution of the charging barrels is consistent with the material level of the crucible disc, and switching mechanisms are arranged on the charging barrels and used for closing or opening bottom openings of the charging barrels; the split charging funnel can slide back and forth on the mounting flat plate under the driving of the driving mechanism so as to charge materials into the charging barrel; and a guide frame is arranged below the sub-packaging mechanism and is used for guiding the crucible tray transfer frame. All crucibles on the crucible disc can be automatically filled at a time, the filling amount can be finely adjusted according to different crucibles, and the automation degree is improved.
claims:
1.一种助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，包括放料机构以及分装机构，其中：
所述放料机构设置于所述分装机构上方，包括用于悬挂料包的挂架以及放料斗，所述放料斗位于所述分装机构的顶部一侧；
所述分装机构包括安装平板、分装漏斗以及若干料筒，所述料筒安装至所述安装平板底部并于所述安装平板表面齐平，所述料筒的分布与坩埚盘的料位一致，所述料筒上设置有开关机构用于封闭或打开所述料筒底部开口，所述分装漏斗能够在驱动机构的驱动下在所述安装平板上来回滑动以向所述料筒中加料；
所述分装机构的下方设置有导向架，所述导向架用于对坩埚盘转运架进行导向。
2.根据权利要求1所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述安装平板固定至安装架上，所述驱动机构固定至安装架上，所述驱动机构包括伺服电机以及驱动链条，所述分装漏斗滑动连接至所述安装架上并与驱动链条连接，所述伺服电机驱动所述驱动链条前后移动。
3.根据权利要求2所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述分装漏斗的宽度与所述安装平板的宽度一致，所述分装漏斗中设置有绞龙。
4.根据权利要求2所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，还包括调节机构，所述调节机构包括调节盘，所述调节盘的四角通过伺服电缸支撑至所述安装架上，所述料筒为伸缩筒，所述料筒的底部连接至所述调节盘，所述料筒的顶部固定至所述安装平板上。
5.根据权利要求4所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述开关机构固定至所述调节盘上，所述开关机构包括开关板以及开关缸，所述开关板上设置有与所述料筒对应的漏料口，所述开关缸驱动所述开关板移动以使所述漏料口与所述料筒重合或错开。
6.根据权利要求5所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述调节盘包括上调节盘以及下调节盘，所述上调节盘与所述下调节盘之间通过固定块固定连接并留有缝隙，所述料筒包括调节筒以及套设置所述调节筒底部的装料筒，所述装料筒固定至所述上调节盘上，所述调节筒顶部固定至所述安装平板上，所述开关板滑动连接至所述上调节盘与所述下调节盘之间。
7.根据权利要求6所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述下调节盘上设置有与所述料筒一一对应的导向筒，所述导向筒用于对接坩埚。
8.根据权利要求5所述的助熔剂自动分装机，其特征在于，所述调节盘上设置有若干震动电机；所述调节盘的一侧设置有指针，所述安装架上设置有与所述指针相匹配的标尺。
assignee: 青岛金木石实验室科技有限公司

title: Composition for pet drinking water
abstract: The present disclosure relates to flavor compositions and pet foods for preventing and/or treating chronic kidney disease (CKD) and/or urinary tract diseases in an animal. In certain embodiments, the flavor compositions and pet foods have enhanced palatability.
claims:
1.一种预防和/或治疗有需要的动物的慢性肾病的方法，所述方法包括施用宠物食品，所述宠物食品包含能够激活鲜味受体的第一氨基酸和不能激活鲜味受体的第二氨基酸。
2.一种预防和/或治疗有需要的动物的尿路疾病的方法，所述方法包括施用宠物食品，所述宠物食品包含能够激活鲜味受体的第一氨基酸和不能激活鲜味受体的第二氨基酸。
3.一种增加动物饮水量的方法，所述方法包括施用含有乳蛋白和核苷酸或其衍生物的宠物食品。
4.一种增加动物补水的方法，所述方法包括施用包含乳蛋白和核苷酸或其衍生物的宠物食品。
5.一种预防和/或治疗有需要的动物的慢性肾病的方法，所述方法包括乳蛋白和核苷酸或其衍生物。
6.一种预防和/或治疗有需要的动物的尿路疾病的方法，所述方法包括乳蛋白和核苷酸或其衍生物。
7.根据权利要求1或2所述的方法，其中，所述第一氨基酸是丙氨酸、组氨酸、甘氨酸、丝氨酸、酪氨酸或它们的混合物。
8.根据权利要求1或2所述的方法，其中，所述第二氨基酸是脯氨酸、羟脯氨酸、缬氨酸、苏氨酸、赖氨酸或它们的混合物。
9.根据权利要求1或2所述的方法，其中
a)所述第一氨基酸是丙氨酸、组氨酸、甘氨酸、丝氨酸、酪氨酸或它们的混合物，并且所述第二氨基酸是脯氨酸、羟脯氨酸、缬氨酸、苏氨酸、赖氨酸或它们的混合物；
b)所述第一氨基酸是组氨酸，并且所述第二氨基酸是脯氨酸、羟脯氨酸、缬氨酸、苏氨酸、赖氨酸或它们的混合物；或
c)所述第一氨基酸是丙氨酸、组氨酸、甘氨酸、丝氨酸、酪氨酸或它们的混合物，并且所述第二氨基酸是脯氨酸。
10.根据权利要求9所述的方法，其中，所述第一氨基酸是组氨酸并且所述第二氨基酸是脯氨酸。
11.根据权利要求9所述的方法，其中，所述第一氨基酸和所述第二氨基酸的摩尔比为约1:1。
12.根据权利要求9所述的方法，其中，所述第一氨基酸和所述第二氨基酸的摩尔比为约1:1.3。
13.根据权利要求9所述的方法，其中，所述第一氨基酸和所述第二氨基酸各自的量为约1mM至约1M。

title: Graphene coated chamber and fluid processing
claims:
1. A device comprising:
a body having a first end and a second end with at least one internal wall disposed between the first end and the second end, the at least one internal wall being formed of a first material to define a closed internal chamber having a interior configured to retain a fluid;
an inlet provided at the first and end in fluid communication with the internal chamber;
at least one pressure source in fluid communication with the inlet and configured to move material through the inlet into the internal chamber;
at least one layer of a two-dimensional material on at least a portion of the at least one internal wall, wherein the at least one layer of the two-dimensional material has at least one edge that protrudes from the at least one internal wall inwardly toward the interior of the internal chamber, wherein the first material is different from the two dimensional material.
2. The device of claim 1, further comprising pressurized carbon dioxide or processing fluid in the internal chamber.
3. The device of claim 2, further comprising a fluid in the internal chamber with the pressurized carbon dioxide or processing fluid.
4. The device of claim 1, further comprising a pathogen in the internal chamber.

title: Beverage dispenser consumable systems and methods
abstract: Aspects of the present disclosure include a water filter mount for a beverage dispenser. The water filter mount releasably mounts a water filter to the beverage dispenser using a rotating motion that does not require any tools. Aspects of the present disclosure also include a gas cylinder mount for a beverage dispenser. The gas cylinder mount releasably mounts a water filter to the beverage dispenser using a rotating motion that does not require any tools. Aspects of the present disclosure also include a concentrate vial mount for a beverage dispenser. The concentrate vial releasably mounts a water filter to the beverage dispenser using a rotating motion that does not require any tools.
claims:
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
A water filter mount for a beverage dispenser, the water filter mount comprising: a base; a manifold pivotably mounted to the base such that the manifold can be pivoted outwards from the base from a closed position into a loading position; and a filter head attached to the manifold, the filter head configured to receive an end of a water filter and to fluidly connect an interior of the water filter with the manifold; wherein the base comprises first and second protrusions that are configured to be received by a groove in the water filter when the water filter is inserted into the filter head and the water filter and filter head are pivoted into a closed position.
The water filter mount of claim 1, further comprising: a receptacle disposed in the filter head configured to receive the end of the water filter, wherein the end of the water filter comprises a first annular seal disposed at a first cylindrical portion of the end of the water filter and a second annular seal disposed at a second cylindrical portion of the end of the water filter, wherein the first cylindrical portion and the second cylindrical portion have different diameters, and wherein the interior of the receptacle is formed with a first cylindrical receiving portion configured to receive the first cylindrical portion and a second cylindrical receiving portion configured to receive the second cylindrical portion, wherein the first cylindrical receiving portion and the second cylindrical receiving portion each have different diameters that correspond to the diameters of the first cylindrical portion and the second cylindrical portion, respectively.
The water filter mount of claim 1,

title: Multi-layered frozen dessert bar
abstract: A method of making a frozen dessert bar includes forming an intermediate body layer of a first confectionary material, filling a central portion of the intermediate body layer with a second confectionary material, which is distinct from the first confectionary material, to establish a dual confection product, inserting a handle member into the dual confection product to enable support by a hand of a consumer, coating the dual confection product with a third confectionary material, having a composition distinct from both the first and second confectionary materials, to establish a three confection product, and freezing the three confection product. In a preferred form, the frozen dessert bar has a core of ice cream, an intermediate body layer constituted by sorbet, and a fruit juice based outer layer.
claims:
1. 一種製造冷凍甜點棒的方法，包括： 形成一第一糖果材料的一中間主體層； 用與所述第一糖果材料不同的一第二糖果材料填充所述中間主體層的一中心部分，以建立一雙糖果產品； 將手柄構件插入所述雙糖果產品中以能夠由消費者的手支撐；以及 用一第三糖果材料塗覆所述雙糖果產品以建立三糖果產品，所述第三糖果材料具有不同於所述第一糖果材料和第二糖果材料的成分；以及 在製造冷凍甜點棒的過程中，冷凍所述三糖果產品， 其中所述第一糖果材料是雪酪，所述第二糖果材料是霜淇淋，並且所述第三糖果材料是基於果汁的。
2. 根據請求項1所述的方法，其中，形成所述中間主體層包括在一模具中成形所述第一糖果材料。
3. 根據請求項2所述的方法，還包括透過從所述模具移除一些中間主體層來建立所述中心部分。
4. 根據請求項3所述的方法，其中，建立所述中心部分包括使用一真空源從所述模具中抽空所述一些中間主體層。
5. 根據請求項2所述的方法，還包括在將所述第三糖果材料塗覆於所述雙糖果產品之前從所述模具移除所述雙糖果產品。
6. 根據請求項5所述的方法，其中，塗覆所述雙糖果產品包括將所述雙糖果產品浸入所述第三糖果材料中。
7. 根據請求項1所述的方法，還包括在將所述第三糖果材料塗覆於所述雙糖果產品以形成所述三糖果產品之前，使所述雙糖果產品經受低溫流體。
8. 根據請求項7所述的方法，還包括在將所述第三糖果材料塗覆於所述雙糖果產品之後，使所述三糖果產品經受低溫流體。
9. 根據請求項1所述的方法，還包括在用所述第二糖果材料填充所述中心部分之前固化所述第一糖果材料。
10. 根據請求項1所述的方法，還包括在插入所述手柄構件之前至少部分地固化所述雙糖果產品。
11. 根據請求項10所述的方法，其中，所述手柄構件直接插入所述第二糖果材料中。
12. 根據請求項1所述的方法，還包括包裝多個冷凍甜點棒。
13. 一種冷凍甜點棒，係根據請求項1所述的方法製造。
14. 根據請求項13所述的冷凍甜點棒，其中，所述冷凍甜點棒具有一主體，所述主體包括一相對的表面部分、一頂部、一底部和一相對的側面部分，所述手柄構件從所述底部伸出，所述主體具有從所述頂部到所述底部的約80mm的總長度尺寸、所述相對的側面部分之間約50mm的寬度以及所述相對的表面部分之間約12mm的厚

title: Systems and methods for generating health reports based on veterinary oral care health test
abstract: Methods, systems, and non-transitory computer readable mediums are disclosed for generating health reports. Pet data associated with an entity is received from one or more data sources. Genetic test results data is received from a genetic test results database. The pet data received from the one or more data sources is analyzed with the genetic test results data received from the genetic test results database using an interpretation logic data structure. A result value associated with the pet data and the genetic test results data is determined based on the analysis. One or more result statements associated with the result value are determined and one or more health reports based on the one or more result statements are generated.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method comprising:
receiving, by one or more first processors, pet data associated with an entity from one or more data sources;
receiving, by the one or more first processors, genetic test results data from a genetic test results database;
analyzing, by the one or more first processors, the pet data received from the one or more data sources with the genetic test results data received from the genetic test results database using an interpretation logic data structure;
determining, by the one or more first processors, a result value associated with the pet data and the genetic test results data based on the analysis;
determining, by the one or more first processors, one or more result statements associated with the result value; and
generating, by the one or more first processors, one or more health reports based on the one or more result statements.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the interpretation logic data structure:
comprises a plurality of result values and a combination of result statements associated with each result value; and
defines a genetic test results range, a periodontal disease risk range, and a halitosis status for each of the plurality of result values.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein

title: Cooling device and cooling method
abstract: The present invention is capable of performing a process other than cooling such as cutting, cleaning, and storage of an object to be cooled, in addition to the cooling of the object to be cooled.　A cooling device 1 has: a cooling unit 3 for cooling a fish Q, which is the object to be cooled, by immersing the fish Q in a first ice slurry S1; a cleaning unit 4 for cleaning the fish Q cooled by the cooling unit 3; a storage unit 5 for storing the fish Q cleaned by the cleaning unit 4 by immersing the fish Q in a second ice slurry S2; a first ice slurry manufacturing unit 6 for manufacturing the first ice slurry S1 and supplying the first ice slurry S1 to the cooling unit 3; and a second ice slurry manufacturing unit 7 for manufacturing the second ice slurry S2 and supplying the second ice slurry S2 to the storage unit 5. The temperature of the first ice slurry S2 is -20° or less, and the temperature of the second ice slurry S2 is -2 to 0°C.
claims:
1. 　被冷却物を第１氷スラリーに浸漬して冷却する冷却ユニットと、 　前記冷却ユニットで冷却された前記被冷却物を洗浄する洗浄ユニットと、 　前記洗浄ユニットで洗浄された前記被冷却物を第２氷スラリーに浸漬して保管する保管ユニットと、を有することを特徴とする冷却装置。
2. 　前記第１氷スラリーを製造して前記冷却ユニットに供給する第１氷スラリー製造ユニットと、 　前記第２氷スラリーを製造して前記保管ユニットに供給する第２氷スラリー製造ユニットと、を有する請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
3. 　前記第１氷スラリーの温度は、－２０°以下である請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
4. 　前記第２氷スラリーの温度は、－２～０℃である請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
5. 　前記第１氷スラリーおよび前記第２氷スラリーは、それぞれ、塩水から生成されている請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
6. 　前記洗浄ユニットは、前記被冷却物に洗浄液を吹き付けることで前記被冷却物を洗浄する請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
7. 　前記洗浄液は、－２～０℃である請求項６に記載の冷却装置。
8. 　前記被冷却物は、魚であり、 　前記第１氷スラリーに浸漬する前に、前記魚の血管を断ち切る切断ユニットをさらに有する請求項１に記載の冷却装置。
9. 　被冷却物を第１氷スラリーに浸漬して冷却し、 　前記冷却された前記被冷却物を洗浄し、 　前記洗浄された前記被冷却物を第２氷スラリーに浸漬して保管することを特徴とする冷却方法。

title: Shelf-stable and satisfying soft-baked snack product
abstract: A shelf-stable, satisfying, soft-baked snack product (e.g., a soft-baked snack bar) having reduced saturated fat, sodium, and/or sugar levels ("reduced SFSS") compared to prior art soft-baked snack products, but still being satisfying and flavorful to the consumer. A dough composition for making reduced-SFSS, shelf-stable, satisfying, soft-baked snack products includes a flour component, a fat component consisting of sunflower oil (e.g., high oleic sunflower oil), and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose. Sodium-containing leaveners are partially or completely replaced, e.g., by potassium bicarbonate. If present, cocoa powder is used in reduced amounts compared to prior art soft-baked snack products. A method of making a reduced-SFSS, shelf-stable, satisfying, soft-baked snack product includes a step of baking the dough composition.
claims:
1. A dough composition for making a shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product having reduced saturated fat, sodium and/or sugar levels (“reduced SFSS”), the composition comprising:
a flour component;
a fat component consisting of sunflower oil; and
a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose.
2. The dough composition of claim 1, wherein the flour component comprises at least 20% of the dough composition.
3. The dough composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the sunflower oil is high oleic sunflower oil.
4. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the sucrose-free sugar component comprises a flavor modulator that enhances sweetness upfront and a flavor modulator that enhances long lasting sweetness.
5. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the sucrose-free sugar component includes inulin or its hydrolyzed form, oligofructose.
6. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-5, further comprising potassium bicarbonate.
7. A reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product comprising: a flour compone

title: Extruded protein product and methods of making
abstract: The present invention relates to a method of making a frozen or refrigerated food product, comprising combining a first food component with at least a second food component to produce the frozen or refrigerated food product, the first food component comprising extruded pieces that include protein granules with an average size greater than 75µm within a protein matrix comprising a protein matrix disruptive ingredient forming a protein matrix composition having a protein content of from about 10% to about 65% by weight, a moisture content of from about 25% to about 55% by weight and an oil content of from about 1% to about 15% by weight, the oil being substantially uniformly distributed throughout the extruded pieces, wherein the method comprises: processing the protein matrix composition under extrusion conditions comprising a specific mechanical energy (SME) of from about 8 Wh/kg to about 100 Wh/kg, a die pressure of from about 150 PSI to about 1000 PSI, and a die temperature of from about 200 °F to about 350 °F.
claims:
1. A method of making a frozen or refrigerated food product, comprising combining a first food component with at least a second food component to produce the frozen or refrigerated food product, the first food component comprising extruded pieces that include protein granules with an average size greater than 75µm within a protein matrix comprising a protein matrix disruptive ingredient forming a protein matrix composition having a protein content of from about 10% to about 65% by weight, a moisture content of from about 25% to about 55% by weight and an oil content of from about 1% to about 15% by weight, the oil being substantially uniformly distributed throughout the extruded pieces, wherein the method comprises: processing the protein matrix composition under extrusion conditions comprising a specific mechanical energy (SME) of from about 8 Wh/kg to about 100 Wh/kg, a die pressure of from about 150 PSI to about 1000 PSI, and a die temperature of from about 200 °F to about 350 °F.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the frozen or refrigerated food product is a frozen or refrigerated pizza, or a frozen or refrigerated pasta product.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the extruded pieces are formulated to perform as a substitute for bacon bits or as a substitute for ground meat.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the protein product includes protein granules that have a substantially non-linearly oriented protein matrix.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein

title: Multi-layer bottle
abstract: A multi-layer beverage container includes a multi-layer wall having an outer layer, a middle layer, and an inner layer. At least the inner layer is configured to flex inwards to accommodate a change in the sealed internal volume of the beverage container after a hot-filled beverage is filled inside the container and allowed to cool. The outer layer and inner layer delaminate from each other to accommodate this volume change, which allows the outer layer to retain its original shape. The middle layer functions to encourage delamination of the layers with respect to each other. A space corresponding to the volume change of the interior volume of the container is formed between the wall layers.
claims:
1. A beverage bottle, comprising:
a layered wall, the layered wall comprising:
an outer layer;
an inner layer; and
an intermediate layer, wherein the outer layer and the inner layer are formed of the same material;
wherein the intermediate layer is a barrier layer, wherein the outer layer is thicker than the inner layer.
2. The beverage bottle of claim 1, wherein the intermediate layer comprises a different material than the outer layer and the inner layer.
3.     The beverage bottle of claim 2, wherein the outer layer and the inner layer comprise PET.
4.     The beverage bottle of claim 1, wherein a thickness of the outer layer is between 2 and 5
times a thickness of the inner layer.
5. The beverage bottle of claim 1, wherein the outer layer is thicker than the inner layer from a shoulder of the bottle to a base of the bottle.
6. The beverage bottle of claim 1, wherein a thickness of the intermediate layer is between 0.25 and 0.75 times the thickness of the inner layer.

title: Cold energy utilization method and cold energy utilization apparatus
abstract: The present invention makes it possible to effectively use the cold energy of a liquefied gas. A cold energy utilization apparatus 200 includes: a first heat exchange unit 300 that cools carbon dioxide N1 by heat exchange with an LNG; and a second heat exchange unit 400 that cools a brine N2 by heat exchange with the carbon dioxide N1. The cold energy utilization apparatus 200 is connected, upon use, to a plant 160 that includes a tank 110 for storing the LNG and a vaporizer 120 for vaporizing the LNG fed from the tank 110. The LNG is introduced from the tank 110 into the first heat exchange unit 300. The LNG introduced into the first heat exchange unit 300 is returned in a liquid state into the plant 160 on an upstream side of the vaporizer 120.
claims:
1. 　液化ガスを貯留するタンクを有するプラントに接続して用いられ、 　前記タンクに貯留される前の前記液化ガスとの熱交換により対象物を冷却することを特徴とする冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
2. 　前記プラントは、前記液化ガスを輸送する輸送体と前記タンクとを繋いで、前記輸送体から前記タンクへ前記液化ガスを導く受け入れ配管を有し、 　前記受け入れ配管から前記液化ガスが導入される請求項１に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
3. 　前記液化ガスとの熱交換により一次冷媒を冷却する第１熱交換ステップと、 　前記一次冷媒との熱交換により二次冷媒を冷却する第２熱交換ステップと、を有する請求項１に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
4. 　前記第１熱交換ステップの用に供された前記液化ガスは、液状の状態で前記プラントに戻される請求項３に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
5. 　前記第１熱交換ステップは、前記液化ガスとの熱交換により前記一次冷媒を冷却する一次冷媒冷却ステップと、 　前記一次冷媒冷却ステップにより少なくとも一部がガス化した前記液化ガスを凝縮する凝縮ステップと、を有する請求項３に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
6. 　前記第１熱交換ステップは、前記一次冷媒冷却ステップに先立って、前記液化ガスを減圧する減圧ステップをさらに有する請求項５に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
7. 　前記凝縮ステップでは、前記一次冷媒冷却ステップを経ていない前記液化ガスとの熱交換により、前記一次冷媒冷却ステップを経た前記液化ガスを凝縮する請求項５に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
8. 　前記第２熱交換ステップで冷却された前記二次冷媒を用いて前記対象物を冷却する対象物冷却ステップをさらに有する請求項３に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
9. 　前記第２熱交換ステップで冷却された前記二次冷媒を用いて、前記対象物冷却ステップで冷却された前記対象物を冷却状態のまま保管する保管ステップをさらに有する請求項８に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
10. 　前記第２熱交換ステップでは、前記二次冷媒の一部を凍結させてスラリー状とする請求項８に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
11. 　前記対象物は、蓄冷材であり、 　前記対象物冷却ステップでは、未凍結の前記蓄冷材を凍結し、 　前記保管ステップでは、前記蓄冷材を凍結状態のまま保管する請求項９に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
12. 　前記液化ガスは、液化天然ガスまたは液化石油ガスである請求項１に記載の冷熱エネルギー利用方法。
13. 　液化ガスを貯留するタンクを有するプラントに接続して用いられ、 　前記タンクに貯留される前の前記液化ガスとの熱交換により対象物を冷却することを特徴とする冷熱エネルギー利用装置。

title: Refrigerated merchandise display system
abstract: REFRIGERATED MERCHANDISE DISPLAY SYSTEM A merchandise display system, the display system comprising: an outer housing having a top wall, a bottom wall, side walls, and a back wall; and a door, the door including: a frame surrounding a transparent front surface, the frame including: a top frame having a bracket that extends away from the transparent front surface; a first side frame having a first channel positioned adjacent the top frame; a second side frame having a second channel positioned adjacent the top frame; and a bottom frame, and an extended canopy, the extended canopy including: a bottom surface having a recess to engage the bracket; a first member to engage the first channel; and a second member to engage the second channel; wherein the extended canopy is detachably attached to the top frame, the first side frame, and the second side frame.
claims:
1.     A merchandise display system, the display system comprising:
an outer housing having a top wall, a bottom wall, side walls, and a back wall; and a door, the door including:
a frame surrounding a transparent front surface, the frame including:
a top frame having a bracket that extends away from the transparent front surface;
a first side frame having a first channel positioned adjacent the top frame;
a second side frame having a second channel positioned adjacent
the top frame; and
a bottom frame, and
an extended canopy, the extended canopy including:
a bottom surface having a recess to engage the bracket;
a first member to engage the first channel; and
a second member to engage the second channel;
wherein the extended canopy is detachably attached to the top frame, the first side frame, and the second side frame.
2. The merchandise display system of claim 1, wherein the extended canopy extends above the top wall of the outer housing.
3. The merchandise display system of claim 1 or 2, wherein a width

title: Three-dimensional modeling of mixtures for determining activation levels of taste receptors
abstract: Disclosed herein are systems and methods for preparing pet food by generating and using a model for predicting the response of taste receptors. In certain embodiments, the model is generated based on a function, where the function is close to a set of experimental data, and where the experimental data maps a combination of taste modulator concentrations to a measured response of a taste receptor. Once generated, the model may then be used to predict expected recipient responses beyond those taste modulator concentrations present in experimental data.
claims:
1.一种生成模型的方法，所述模型用于确定味觉受体对至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的浓度的反应，所述方法包括通过一个或多个计算系统：
访问多个数据点，每个数据点包括至少所述第一味觉调节剂的一个浓度水平、所述第二味觉调节剂的一个浓度水平和所述第三味觉调节剂的一个浓度水平；
对于每个数据点，确定所述味觉受体对根据每个数据点的浓度水平的至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的相应反应；
为所述模型选择至少所述第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的浓度水平的函数，所述函数包括一个或多个未知系数；和
通过将所述函数拟合到所述多个数据点及其对应的味觉受体的反应来确定所述一个或多个未知系数的值；和
基于所述一个或多个未知系数的确定值基于所述函数生成所述模型。
2.一种使用预测模型制备或增强食品的适口性的方法，所述预测模型用于确定味觉受体对至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的浓度的反应，所述方法包括通过一个或多个计算系统：
选择至少第一浓度的所述第一味觉调节剂、第二浓度的所述第二味觉调节剂和第三浓度的所述第三味觉调节剂；
分析和转换所述至少第一浓度、第二浓度和第三浓度以使用所述预测模型得出计算的味觉受体的反应，
其中，所述预测模型包括所述至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的浓度水平的函数，所述函数包括一个或多个系数，和
其中，所述一个或多个系数通过将所述函数拟合到多个数据点而确定，每个数据点包括所述至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的预定浓度水平及其对应的味觉受体的反应；和
当计算的所述味觉受体的反应超过阈值时，制备包含分别处于所述第一浓度、第二浓度和第三浓度的所述第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂的食品。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的方法，其中，所述对应的味觉受体的反应通过体外测定来确定。
4.根据权利要求3所述的方法，其中，所述体外测定包括使所述味觉受体与根据每个数据点的浓度水平的所述至少第一味觉调节剂、第二味觉调节剂和第三味觉调节剂接触，并检测所述味觉受体的生物活性。
