assignee: 苏州银炙新材料科技有限公司

title: Process and apparatus for the production of a meat analogue
abstract: Processes for the production of a meat analogue, comprising: a) introducing a meat batter which comprises protein into a first heating unit and heating the meat batter to a temperature above the denaturation temperature of the protein in the meat batter, but below the melting point of the protein to produce a first heat-treated product, and b) transferring the first heat-treated product to a second heating unit and heating the first heat-treated product to a temperature above the melting temperature of the protein to produce a second heat-treated product, c) cooling the second heat-treated product by moving through a cooling unit, so that the second heat-treated product has a temperature below water boiling temperature at ambient pressure when exiting the cooling unit, and d) dividing the cooled second heat-treated product into pieces; as well as an apparatus for the production of a meat analogue.
claims:
1. A process for the production of a meat analogue, comprising: a) introducing a meat batter which comprises protein into a first heating unit and heating the meat batter to a temperature above a denaturation temperature but below a melting temperature of the protein in the meat batter using steam having a temperature from 155° C. to 162° C. to produce a first heat-treated product, and b) transferring the first heat-treated product to a second heating unit and heating the first heat-treated product to a temperature above the melting temperature of the protein to produce a second heat-treated product using steam having a temperature from 165° C. to 170° C., wherein a volume ratio of the first heating unit to the second heating unit is above 1.5:1; c) cooling the second heat-treated product by moving through a cooling unit, so that the second heat-treated product has a temperature below water boiling temperature at ambient pressure when exiting the cooling unit, and d) dividing the cooled second heat-treated product into pieces, wherein a ratio of a residence time of the meat batter in the first heating unit to a residence time of the first heat-treated product in the second heating unit is from about 3:2 to about 14:2.
2. The process of claim 1, wherein the first and second heating units are heated by supplying the steam to respective heat jackets.
3. The process of claim 1, wherein at least one of the first and second heating units comprises a scraped surface heat exchanger.
4. The process of claim 1, wherein

title: Disposable container and packaging system for molten food product
abstract: The device described herein relate to a packaging system including: a box having two or more side panels and a base panel, each of the two or more side panels including a respective compartment; a lid including a top panel and two or more side walls, each of the two or more side walls perpendicular to the top panel, wherein: in a closed position, the two or more side panels of the box are substantially vertical and perpendicular to the base of the box, the two or more side walls of the lid engage the two or more side panels of the box, and the compartments face an interior space of the box defined by the two or more side panels, the base panel, and the top panel; and in an open position, the two or more side panels of the box are substantially horizontal and parallel to the base panel of the box, and the compartments face upward from a plane defined by the base panel.
claims:
1.A packaging system comprising:
a box having two or more side panels and a base panel, each of the two or more side panels comprising a respective compartment;
a lid comprising a top panel and two or more side walls, each of the two or more side walls perpendicular to the top panel, wherein:
in a closed position,
the two or more side panels of the box are substantially vertical and perpendicular to the base panel of the box,
the two or more side walls of the lid engage the two or more side panels of the box, and
the compartments face an interior space of the box defined by the two or more side panels, the base panel, and the top panel; and
in an open position,
the two or more side panels of the box are substantially horizontal and parallel to the base panel of the box, and
the compartments face upward from a plane defined by the base panel.
2.The packaging system of claim 1, wherein removing the lid disengages the two or more side walls from the two or more side panels.
3.The packaging system of claim 1, wherein a self-heating assembly including a pot, a dish, and a pot lid is disposed in the interior space.

title: Intelligent torque wrench for dual-band WiFi communication
abstract: The utility model discloses an intelligent torque wrench for dual-band WiFi communication, which belongs to the technical field of intelligent torque wrenches and comprises a middle shell, one side of the middle shell is connected with one corresponding end of a connecting rod, a movable sleeve is arranged on the outer wall of the connecting rod, a movable plate is fixedly connected to the outer wall of the movable sleeve, and the movable plate is fixedly connected with the middle shell. And one side of the movable plate is connected with the corresponding sides of the two fixed plates. According to the intelligent torque wrench for dual-band WiFi communication, by arranging a movable sleeve, a movable rod, a clamping plate and a spring, when the length of the torque wrench needs to be adjusted, the movable rod is pulled, the movable rod drives the clamping plate to move, so that the clamping plate and a connecting rod are unfixed, then the movable plate is pulled to drive the movable sleeve to move, and the movable sleeve is pulled to move; when the torque wrench is used, the distance between the movable sleeve and the connecting rod can be increased, so that the length of the wrench is increased, when the torque wrench is used, the labor-saving effect can be achieved by adjusting the length of the wrench, and a worker can disassemble and assemble a bolt and a nut conveniently.
claims:
1.一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，包括中部壳体(1)，其特征在于：所述中部壳体(1)的一侧与连接杆(2)对应的一端相连接，所述连接杆(2)的外壁设置有移动套(3)，所述移动套(3)的外壁固定连接有移动板(4)，所述移动板(4)的一侧分别与两个固定板(5)对应的一侧相连接，两个固定板(5)的内壁分别与两个套筒(6)的外壁相连接，所述套筒(6)的内壁滑动连接有活动杆(7)，所述活动杆(7)的一端与夹持板(8)对应的一端相连接，所述夹持板(8)的内径与连接杆(2)的外径相适配，所述套筒(6)的外壁和活动杆(7)的外壁均固定连接有托盘(9)，且两个托盘(9)相对的一端与同一个弹簧(10)的两端相连接。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述活动杆(7)的一端与拉杆(11)对应的一端相连接，所述拉杆(11)内固定连接有把手(12)，所述把手(12)内开设有第一插孔(13)。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述移动板(4)的两端均固定连接有限位板(16)，且两个限位板(16)内均开设有第二插孔(14)，所述第一插孔(13)的位置与第二插孔(14)的位置相对应，所述第一插孔(13)和第二插孔(14)与同一个插杆(15)插接。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述中部壳体(1)的侧面与连接件(17)对应的一端相连接，所述连接件(17)内设置有扳头(18)，所述连接件(17)的内壁和扳头(18)的外壁均开设有螺纹槽，且连接件(17)和扳头(18)通过螺纹槽螺纹连接。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述中部壳体(1)的顶部设置有显示器(19)，所述显示器(19)的两侧均设置有控制按钮(20)。
6.根据权利要求4所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述中部壳体(1)靠近连接件(17)的内部一侧设置有扭矩传感器(21)，用于采集扳头(18)使用过程中扭矩数据。
7.根据权利要求6所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述中部壳体(1)内设置有控制模块(22)，所述控制模块(22)分别与WiFi通讯模块(23)和扭矩传感器(21)电性连接，用于控制和适配外界WiFi信号。
8.根据权利要求7所述的一种双频段WiFi通讯的智能扭力扳手，其特征在于：所述WiFi通讯模块(23)包括双工位器(2301)，所述双工位器(2301)分别与2.4G频段WiFi收发器(2302)和5.0G频段WiFi收发器(2303)电性连接，用于适配不同WiFi内的数据传递频段。

title: Compositions and methods for improving taste of non-nutritive sweeteners
abstract: The present disclosure provides a novel sweetener composition of improved taste of the sweetener (e.g., reduced bitterness and/or astringency, and improved overall sweet quality of the composition); food and beverage products containing the same; and methods of making the same.
claims:
1.     A sweetener composition, comprising: (1) water (2) from about 5 wt% to about 15 wt% of one or more steviol glycosides; (3) trans-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone; (4) 3-methylbutanol; and (5) one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of furfural, 4-hexen-1-ol, trans-2,4-hexadienal, 2,4-hexadien-1-ol, 5-methyl-furfural, delta-tetradecalactone, cis-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, butyl acetate, 2-methylbutanol, ethyl octanoate, ethyl decanoate, ethyl hexadecanoate, and combinations thereof.
2.     The sweetener composition of claim 1, comprising two or more compounds selected from the group consisting of furfural, 4-hexen-1-ol, trans-2,4-hexadienal, 2,4-hexadien-1-ol, 5-methyl-furfural, delta-tetradecalactone, cis-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, trans-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, butyl acetate, 2-methylbutanol, ethyl octanoate, ethyl decanoate, ethyl hexadecanoate, and combinations thereof.
3.     The sweetener composition of claim 1, comprising three or more compounds selected from the group consisting of furfural, 4-hexen-1-ol, trans-2,4-hexadienal, 2,4-hexadien-1-ol, 5-methyl-furfural, delta-tetradecalactone, cis-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, trans-4-methyl-5-butyldihydro-2(3H)-furanone, butyl acetate, 2-methylbutanol, ethyl octanoate, ethyl decanoate, ethyl hexadecanoate, and combinations thereof.
4.     A sweetener composition, comprising: (1) water

title: Confectionary with Improved Opacity
abstract: A confectionary that contains 3.0% to 3.5% of a short fiber length cellulose is described. The confectionary maintains a good opacity and texture after heating and good visual and textural stability over shelf life or at least one freeze/thaw cycle. A confectionary can typically have a relatively high moisture content, relatively low fat content, and relatively low non-fat solids content and retain the desired stability, opacity, and texture attributes. In some cases, a confectionary can exclude certain ingredients that consumers prefer to avoid.
claims:
1. A confectionary, comprising: a. cellulose in an amount of 3.0% to 3.5% by weight of the confectionary, the cellulose having an average fiber length of less than 35 μm; b. a fat content of about 10% to about 20% by weight of the confectionary, with at least 75% of the fat content being provided by a structuring fat having a melting point above room temperature; c. a water content of at least 30% by weight of the confectionary; d. a non-fat total solids content of 35% to 45% by weight of the confectionary; and e. essentially no titanium dioxide and essentially no calcium carbonate.
2. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the amount of cellulose is about 3.2% to about 3.4% by weight of the confectionary.
3. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the cellulose has an average fiber length of about 20 μm to about 25 μm.
4. The confectionary of claim 3, wherein the cellulose has a particle size where least 95% of the particles pass through a No. 400 US Mesh Size sieve.
5. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the non-fat solids content comprises sweet whey solids in an amount of about 3% to about 4.5% by weight of the confectionary.
6. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the confectionary has a sugar content of less than 40% by weight of the confectionary.
7. The confe

title: A process for fat reduction in frozen dairy products
abstract: Methods of making a homogenized and pasteurized mix for making low overrun ice cream are disclosed. The methods include a high-pressure homogenization step and/or a high temperature pasteurization step to improve creaminess and/or melt resistance in an ice cream. Mixes and ice creams made using the methods described are also disclosed.
claims:
CA 03214780 2023-09-25 WO 2022/200823 PCT/IB2021/000194 2. CLAIMS
1. - A process for preparing a homogenized and pasteurized mix for an ice cream that has an overrun of less than 75%, wherein said process comprises a homogenization step for homogenizing the ingredients of said mix and a step of pasteurization of the mix, wherein said mix comprises at least 11% by weight of fat with respect to the total weight of the mix, wherein said homogenization step is performed at a pressure of more than 8 MPa (80 bars) if said mix comprises at least 15% by weight fat, and wherein said homogenization step is performed at a pressure of at least 1.5 MPa (150 bars) if said mix comprises
11. to 15% by weight fat.
2. A process for preparing a homogenized and pasteurized mix for an ice cream that has an overrun of less than 75%, wherein said process comprises a homogenization step for homogenizing the ingredients of said mix and a step of pasteurization of the mix, wherein said mix comprises at least 11% by weight of fat with respect to the total weight of the mix, wherein said pasteurization step is performed at a temperature in the range of
8. to 92 C.
3. The process according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the homogenizing step is performed at a pressure of at least 9.5 MPa (95 bars) and less than 60 MPa (600 bars).
4. The process according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the homogenizing step is performed at a pressure of 10 MPa (100 bars) to 30 MPa (300 ba

title: Continuous coating method
abstract: Disclosed are methods and systems for continuously coating food pieces. The methods include a steps of directing and uncoated food stream through an enrober to apply a first coating to at least a portion of a surface of each food piece to form a coated stream and continuously redirecting a portion of the coated stream back through the enrober along with the stream of uncoated food pieces to apply at least one additional coating to the portion of the coated stream.
claims:
1. A system for making a food composition, the system comprising: a. an enrober configured to apply a first coating to at least a portion of a surface of each food piece in a stream of food pieces to produce a stream of first coated food pieces; b. a dryer configured to receive the stream of first coated food pieces and produce a stream of dried first coated food pieces; c. a splitter configured to split the stream of dried first coated food pieces into at least two stream portions; and d. a conveyor apparatus configured to redirect at least one stream portion, representing from about 20% to 60% of the stream of dried first coated food pieces, back to the enrober for application of a second coating on the at least one stream portion, wherein the conveyor apparatus is configured to continuously redirect the at least one stream portion back to the enrober to produce the food composition which comprises a plurality of food pieces, wherein food pieces having one coating layer represent about 35% to about 80% of the plurality of food pieces, and food pieces having two coating layers represent about 16% to about 23% of the plurality of food pieces.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein the enrober is configured to separately apply a liquid component of the first coating and a dry component of the first coating.
3. The system of claim 2, wherein the enrober comprises a first portion that applies the liquid component and a second portion that applies the dry component.
4. The system of claim 1, further comprising a selector configured to select coated pieces

title: Novel antifouling developing coating material as well as preparation method and application thereof
abstract: The invention provides a novel antifouling developing coating material and a preparation method and application thereof.The antifouling developing coating material has the structure shown in the formula I. The antifouling developing coating material has excellent antifouling performance and developing performance at the same time, the stability and durability of the developing effect can be ensured, good safety is achieved, and the antifouling developing coating material can be applied to the field of chemical engineering. And the method has a wider application range.

5.根据权利要求4所述的制备方法，其特征在于，所述步骤(1)具体包括以下步骤：2-甲基丙烯酰氧乙基磷酸胆碱与硅氧烷化合物以及(2-(甲基丙烯酰基氧基)乙基)二甲基-(3-磺酸丙基)氢氧化铵反应，得到所述经过硅氧烷和磺酸根修饰的改性磷酸胆碱聚合物；

优选地，所述2-甲基丙烯酰
assignee: 苏州银炙新材料科技有限公司

title: Fat composition comprising lauric fat and a crystal modifier
abstract: Fat compositions are described that comprise 95% by weight of a blend of a first lauric fat and a crystal modifier. A crystal modifier included in fat compositions described herein is an interesterified blend of a second lauric fat and a palmitic fat. Additional fat compositions are described herein that include a first lauric fat, a crystal modifier, and a liquid oil. Also described are methods of making a fat composition described herein, and food ingredients and food products that include a fat composition described herein.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A fat composition, comprising: a. at least 70% by weight of the fat composition of a solid fat, the solid fat including at least 9.% by weight of a blend including: i. 55% to 90% by weight of the solid fat of a first lauric fat, and ii. 5% to 45% by weight of the solid fat of a crystal modifier consisting of an interesterified blend of: 1. 10% to 18% by weight of the interesterified blend of a second lauric fat, the second lauric fat having an iodine value of 14 to 21; and 2. 80% to 90% by weight of the interesterified blend of a palmitic fat having an iodine value of from 25 to 40, and b. 5% to 30% by weight of the fat composition of a liquid oil, such that the solid fat and the liquid oil combine to comprise at least 95% of the fat composition; the fat composition having a solid fat content (SFC) of about 5% to about 15% at 26.7 C and a Mettler Drop Point of about 30 C to about 45 C.
2. The fat composition of claim 1, wherein the fat composition has a Mettler Drop Point of about 3. C to about 40 C.
3. The fat composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the fat composition is a beta prime crystal tending forming fat composition as determined by x-ray diffractometry (XRD).
4. The fat composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the first lauric fat is a non-hydrogenated whole coconut oil.
5. The fat com

title: Shelf stable confection
abstract: A food product made with simple ingredients, including fruit paste and cocoa butter-based particles, is disclosed. The food product is shelf stable and provides an eating experience resembling a chocolate truffle. Methods of making a food product are also described.
claims:
1. A food product, comprising discrete cocoa butter-based particles in an amount of from 25% to 40% by weight of the food product, wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles are embedded in a matrix that includes a fruit paste having a water activity of less than 0.73, nut butter, and cocoa powder, wherein the matrix comprises: •      fruit paste in an amount of 30% to 55% by weight of the food product; •      nut butter in an amount of 14% to 35% by weight of the food product; and •     cocoa powder in an amount of 7% to 15% by weight of the food product; wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles have a size range wherein at least 90% pass through a sieve with 1.41 mm openings and are retained on a sieve with 0.105 mm openings.
2.     The food product of claim 1, wherein the fruit paste is a date paste.
3.     The food product of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the discrete cocoa butter-based particles are chocolate.
4. The food product of claim 1, wherein the cocoa powder has a fat content of from about 10% to about 22% by weight.
5. The food product of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the food product is portioned into pieces that weigh from about 5 g to about 10 g.
6. The food product of any one of claims 1-5, wherein the fo

title: Automatic vending machine
abstract: To provide an automatic vending machine that reduces the occurrence of a trouble as much as possible that a commodity is jammed in an automatic vending machine after payment of the commodity, thereby eliminating the need for refunding process of the paid amount to the user.SOLUTION: Provided is an automatic vending machine 100 comprising: a commodity accommodation unit 30; a commodity selection button 13; a commodity outlet 12; a selected commodity forwarding mechanism 40 for sending a selected commodity 20 to the commodity outlet 12; an automatic opening/closing shutter 14 for shuttering the commodity outlet 12 for locking as a base state; a payment unit 50; an operation control unit 70; and an unpaid commodity storage 90 for storing a commodity 20 sent out to the commodity outlet 12 when payment at the payment unit 50 is not completed. The operation control unit 70 executes a process for sending out a selected commodity 20 to the commodity outlet 12, a process for unlocking the automatic opening/closing shutter 14 when payment is completed and opening the commodity outlet 12, and a process for storing a commodity 20 from the commodity outlet 12 in the unpaid commodity storage 90 in the event of payment failure.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
claims:

assignee: 株式会社マースウインテック

title: Moisture barrier films
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. An article comprising: a foodstuff; and a package containing the foodstuff, the package including a multilayer moisture barrier having a first outer layer, a second outer layer, and at least one inner layer between the first and second outer layers, wherein the at least one inner layer comprises desiccant particles having a size of less than
5. nanometers dispersed in a polymeric matrix of the at least one inner layer, and the desiccant comprises silica particles, wherein the polymeric matrix defines plurality of cavities, and wherein at least some of the cavities have one or more of the desiccant particles in communication therewith, wherein the at least one inner layer is an oriented layer comprising biaxially oriented polypropylene, biaxially oriented polyethylene, or biaxially oriented polyethylene terephthalate, and the at least one inner layer is configured to maintain a desired range of moisture content within the package.
2. An article according to claim 1, wherein the at least one inner layer comprises
0.1 wt.% or more of the desiccant particles.
3. An article according to claim 2, wherein the at least one inner layer comprises from 1 wt.% of the desiccant particles to 25 wt.% of the desiccant particles.
4. An article according to claim 3, wherein the at least one inner layer comprises from 6 wt.% of the desiccant particles to 12 wt.% of the desiccant particles.

title: Degradable composite film coating food box
abstract: The utility model discloses a degradable composite film coating food box, which comprises a base, a chopstick slot, a self-heating bag inner groove, a side enclosure, an anti-slip texture patch, an upper cover plate and an embedded limit support, the chopstick slot is transversely arranged on the base, the self-heating bag inner groove is arranged at the upper end of the base, the base and the side enclosure are integrally formed, and the anti-slip texture patch is arranged on the side enclosure. According to the degradable composite film coating food box, disposable chopsticks are stored in the chopstick slots in a storage mode, the paper frame of a triangular structure avoids deformation of the frame body in the heating process, and the disposable chopsticks can be stored in the chopstick slots in a storage mode. After heating is completed, chopsticks are inserted into the auxiliary breaking through holes to prize the frame body to break the whole triangular-structure paper frame, hot water makes contact with cold water outside the self-heating bag inner groove, cold and hot are mixed, hot water scalding is avoided, hot air upwelling heats the sealing adsorption type adhesive tape, and the hollow adhesive tape is heated to deform; the pressure balance through hole performs internal and external pressure balance so that the whole rubber strip can be stably adsorbed to the inner wall of the side fence.
claims:
1.一种可降解复合膜涂层食品盒，其特征在于，包括底座(1)、筷子插槽(2)、自热袋内槽(3)、侧围挡(4)、防滑纹理贴片(5)、上盖板(6)、内嵌式限位支架(7)，底座(1)横置设置有筷子插槽(2)，底座(1)上端设置安装有自热袋内槽(3)，底座(1)与侧围挡(4)为一体成型设计，侧围挡(4)两侧黏贴有防滑纹理贴片(5)，上盖板(6)与内嵌式限位支架(7)组合式安装，内嵌式限位支架(7)与侧围挡(4)内壁对接安装。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种可降解复合膜涂层食品盒，其特征在于：所述自热袋内槽(3)由三角结构纸质框架(8)、辅助破拆通孔(9)和自热包(10)组成，三角结构纸质框架(8)一侧边中心位置加工成型有辅助破拆通孔(9)，三角结构纸质框架(8)内置有自热包(10)。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种可降解复合膜涂层食品盒，其特征在于：所述内嵌式限位支架(7)由外框架(11)、内十字支架(12)、密封吸附式胶条(13)和透气孔(14)组成，外框架(11)内部黏贴安装有内十字支架(12)，外框架(11)侧壁黏贴安装有密封吸附式胶条(13)，外框架(11)一侧设置有透气孔(14)。
4.根据权利要求3所述的一种可降解复合膜涂层食品盒，其特征在于：所述密封吸附式胶条(13)由中空式胶条(15)和压力平衡通孔(16)组成，中空式胶条(15)外侧加工成型有压力平衡通孔(16)。

title: Reduced sodium food products
abstract: Naturally-derived compounds having various structures elicit the perception of salty taste or enhance the perception of salty taste of a salt. Food products may include such salty compounds, which may be used to reduce the sodium content, while parting a similar level of saltiness.
claims:
1. A food product comprising:
a salt that elicits a salty taste; and
at least one isolated compound selected from the group consisting of

title: Spraying equipment for coating medical phosphorylcholine coating
abstract: The utility model discloses spraying equipment for medical phosphorylcholine coating, which comprises an equipment main body, two groups of door plates and a spraying mechanism arranged in the equipment main body, the spraying mechanism comprises a front-back moving rail, a left-right moving rail and a lifting plate, an ultrasonic spraying head is fixedly arranged on the lifting plate, and the left-right moving rail is arranged on the left-right moving rail. The door plate is provided with a transparent observation window, the surface of the door plate is provided with a scraping mechanism, the scraping mechanism comprises a scraping piece and a driving piece, and the scraping piece comprises a rubber scraping strip and a vertical strip; by means of the designed scraping mechanism, liquid can be scraped off through a rubber scraping strip moving left and right in a reciprocating mode after being sprayed to the surface of the transparent observation window in the spraying process, the definition of the transparent observation window is improved, personnel can clearly see the spraying condition of the interior of a medical support, and the spraying efficiency of the medical support is improved. And the spraying effect of the spraying equipment is improved.
claims:
1.一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，包括设备主体(100)、两组门板(101)以及安装在设备主体(100)内部的喷涂机构，所述喷涂机构包括前后移动轨(105)、左右移动轨(106)和升降板(107)，所述升降板(107)上固定设置有超声波喷头(103)，其特征在于：所述门板(101)上设置有透明观察窗(102)，所述门板(101)的表面设置有刮除机构，所述刮除机构包括刮除件和驱动件，所述刮除件包括橡胶刮条(209)和竖条(200)，所述橡胶刮条(209)固定在所述竖条(200)的背面，所述橡胶刮条(209)的背面与所述透明观察窗(102)的表面接触，所述驱动件包括螺杆(201)、电机(203)和固定板(202)，所述螺杆(201)的外部设置有螺母座(207)，所述螺母座(207)上固定设置有L形架(208)，所述螺母座(207)的背面固定设置有后板(205)，所述后板(205)的背面固定设置有滚孔，所述滚孔的内部设置有滚珠(210)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述固定板(202)的两端部分别固定设置有左板(204)、右板(206)，所述左板(204)的内部嵌入安装有轴承。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述螺杆(201)的两端部均穿入所述轴承的内部，所述电机(203)固定在所述左板(204)的侧面，所述电机(203)的工作端与所述螺杆(201)固定连接。
4.根据权利要求3所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述滚珠(210)的外壁与所述固定板(202)的正面接触，所述螺杆(201)固定在所述门板(101)的正面。
5.根据权利要求4所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述L形架(208)的底部固定设置有更换板(300)，所述更换板(300)与所述竖条(200)之间通过两组螺丝固定连接。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述门板(101)的一侧与所述设备主体(100)之间通过两组转轴转动连接，所述设备主体(100)的顶部固定设置有指示灯。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用喷涂设备，其特征在于：所述设备主体(100)的内部设置有放置板(104)，所述设备主体(100)的背面设置有电源线。
assignee: 苏州银炙新材料科技有限公司

title: Extra thin tortilla and method of making
abstract: Thin, strong tortillas are formed from a dough containing a wheat component, that includes gluten in an amount of about 1.5% to about 10% by dry weight of the dough, and a tapioca starch in an amount of about 2.5% to about 25% by dry weight of the dough. With this formulation, a tortilla can be formed to be less than 1.2 mm in thickness, yet have toughness comparable to thicker, commercially available tortillas.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A packaged, ready-to-eat (RTE) tortilla, comprising: a. a wheat component in an amount of about 55% to about 75% by dry weight of the tortilla, including a gluten content of about 1.5% to about 10% by dry weight of the tortilla; b. tapioca starch in an amount of about 2.5% to about 25% by dry weight of the tortilla; c. a fat content of about 3.5% to about 14% by dry weight of the tortilla; d. a glycerol content of about 4% to about 9% by dry weight of the tortilla; e. a thickness of about 0.5 mm to less than 1.2 mm; f. a toughness over thickness value of at least 500 g/mm; g. a water activity of less than 0.90; and h. a shelf life of at least 3 months.
2. The packaged, RTE tortilla of claim 1, wherein the tortilla is a flat tortilla.
3. The packaged, RTE tortilla of claim 1, wherein the tortilla is a preformed 3 -dimensional shape.
4. The packaged, RTE tortilla of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the thickness is from about 0.7 mm to less than 1 mm.
5. The packaged, RTE tortilla of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the toughness over thickness value is about 600 g/mm to about 1000 g/mm.
6. The packaged, RTE tortilla of any one of claims 1-5, wherein the tortilla has a weight of less than 0.1 g/cm2.

title: Water dispensing station
abstract: A drink station is provided with an alkaline filter cartridge in fluid communication with an ambient temperature water line provide alkaline water, and with a chilled water mixed with the alkaline water at a spigot to provide chilled alkaline water. A hot water heating element is located below the spigot so hot water flows upward for dispensing from the spigot, with a vent line between the heating element and spigot helping hot water to flow from the spigot to the heating element. A refrigeration system and a carbonation system is also provided. The refrigeration system uses the ice-bank technology. A submersible agitator pump improves heat exchanged between ice-bank and water by forced convection. The agitator pump operating based on the temperature of the drinking water. A figure eight evaporator coil can provide two cylindrical ice banks and two chilled water coils to increase the chilled water capacity.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing apparatus, comprising: a chilled water reservoir; a refrigeration system comprising an evaporator coil, wherein the evaporator coil is arranged within the chilled water reservoir and is configured to freeze water within the chilled water reservoir to form an ice bank; an ice sensor configured to detect a presence of ice within the chilled water reservoir; a controller in communication with the ice sensor, wherein the controller is configured to deactivate the refrigeration system when the presence of ice is detected; a chiller coil arranged within the chilled water reservoir configured to circulate drinking water; an agitator pump arranged within the chilled water reservoir and configured to circulate the chilled water in the chilled water reservoir; and a temperature sensor arranged adjacent to the chiller coil and in communication with the controller, wherein the controller is configured to operate the agitator pump based on a temperature determined by the temperature sensor.
2. The beverage dispensing apparatus of claim 1, wherein the ice sensor comprises an ice contact temperature sensor that is in electrical communication with the controller and that is located in the chilled water reservoir at a location so that the ice contact temperature sensor is configured to contact the ice bank during use of the beverage dispensing apparatus when the ice bank grows.
3. The beverage dispensing apparatus of claim 1 or 2, wherein the controller configured to deactivate the refrigeration system comprises that the controller is configured to power off a compressor and fans of the refrigeration system when a growth of the ice bank

title: Modular refrigeration system for storing products
abstract: Embodiments described herein can include one or more modular storage units for use with a refrigerator system. The modular storage units can include a door that is movable from a closed position to an open position; a back wall; side walls; and a base. The modular storage unit can have an air inlet disposed in the back wall for receiving chilled air from the refrigeration system. The modular storage unit can include a temperature sensor that detects the temperature within the interior volume and an insulating wall comprising a phase change material disposed within the insulating wall. The modular storage unit can include a locking system configured to lock the door. Multiple modular storage units can be used in one refrigerator system, and each can be removably coupled to an interior storage compartment of the refrigerator system. Embodiments described herein can be integrated into existing refrigeration systems.
claims:
1. A system for refrigerating a product, the system comprising:
a storage compartment;
a cooling system, the cooling system configured to deliver chilled air to the storage compartment;
a modular unit removably coupled to the storage compartment, wherein the modular unit comprises an interior volume, and
wherein the system is configured to adjust a temperature within the interior volume independently of a temperature within the storage compartment.
2. The system of claim 1, further comprising a damper configured to move between a first position and a second position to redirect chilled air the modular unit.
3. The system of claim 2, wherein the damper is configured to move between the first position and the second position in response to a change in temperature within the modular unit as detected by a temperature sensor.
4. The system of claim 1, further comprising a fan, wherein the fan is configured to direct air from a first end of the modular unit to a second end of the modular unit.
5. The system of claim 1, further comprising a wall extending between a top end of the storage compartment to a bottom end of the storage compartment.
6. The system of claim 5, whe

title: Packaging films
abstract: A packaging film and method for sealing packaging films with the packaging film being made from recyclable materials and having a high barrier to water vapor and gasses such as oxygen. The packaging film being made of a plastic and the packaging film being recyclable and suitable for high speed commercial packaging.
claims:
CLAIMS What is claimed is:
1. A packaging film, comprising: (a) a single polymer film having a first surface and an opposing second surface; (b) a seal layer disposed on the first surface of the single layer polymer film layer; and (c) a heat-resistant layer disposed about the second surface of the single layer polymer film layer
2. The packaging film of claim 1, wherein the single polymer film comprises a polyolefin.
3. The packaging film of claim 2, wherein the polyolefin is selected from polyethylene.
4. The packaging film of claim 2 or 3, wherein the polyolefin is selected from high density polyethylene.
5. The packaging film of any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the single polymer film is biaxially oriented.
6. The packaging film of any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the single polymer film is machine direction oriented.
7. The packaging film of any of claims 1 to 6 further comprising a barrier layer.
8. The packaging film of claim 7, wherein the barrier layer is disposed between the single polymer film and the heat-resistant layer.
9. The packaging film of claims 7 or 8, wherein the barrier

title: System and Method for Coating Soft and Sticky Food Cores
abstract: A product conveying and coating system includes multiple, sequentially arranged conveyor units, with at least one conveyor unit being an open belt type. A carrier sheet is placed on a first of the conveyor units, a web of coating material in liquid form is deposited on the carrier sheet and spaced ropes of soft and sticky material are deposited on and settle into the web. The carrier sheet, web and ropes are transferred to a second conveyor unit after the coating material of the web solidifies, whereupon the ropes are cut into bar-length pieces. Thereafter, the carrier sheet is removed while the web and pieces are transferred to the open belt conveyor unit and exposed to an enrober. The enrober coats the pieces while melting portions of the web between the pieces in order to form full coated or encapsulated food products with soft and sticky cores.
claims:
1. A method of producing coated food products comprising:
applying a carrier sheet upon a first conveyor unit;
dispensing a web of coating material laterally across a portion of the carrier sheet, with the coating material being in liquid form;
delivering a plurality of laterally spaced ropes upon the web, with the ropes being made of a soft and sticky material;
solidifying the coating material to form a solid web;
transferring the soft and sticky material upon the carrier sheet and solid web onto a second conveyor unit;
cutting the plurality of laterally spaced ropes into food pieces;
removing the carrier sheet from beneath the solid web;
transferring the soft and sticky material upon the solid web, without the carrier sheet, onto a third conveyor unit; and
enrobing the food pieces while removing portions of the solid web between the food pieces in forming the coated food products having cores of the soft and sticky material.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the third conveyor unit includes an open conveyor belt and removing portions of the solid web comprises melting the portions, with the coating material of the portions flowing through the open conveyor belt.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein

title: Unattended beverage dispensing systems and methods
abstract: Unattended beverage dispensing Systems and methods Unattended beverage dispensers configured to dispense one or more beverages after authenticating a customer and associating the customer with a customer account. An unattended beverage dispenser may include a user interface with a biometric sensor configured to identify a biometric characteristic of a customer. A controller associated with the unattended beverage dispenser may authenticate a customer based on a biometric characteristic and associate the authenticated customer with a customer account. After authenticating a customer, the controller may allow beverage dispensing from the unattended beverage dispenser in accordance with a beverage dispensing rule associated with the customer's account.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing system, comprising:
a customer mobile device configured to collect a biometric characteristic of a customer and send data comprising the biometric characteristic via a wireless communication link; and
a beverage dispenser comprising a wireless communication device configured to communicate with the customer mobile device via the wireless communication link; and
a controller configured to:
wirelessly receive the data comprising the biometric characteristic from
the customer mobile device via the wireless communication link,
associate the customer with a customer account based on the biometric
characteristic, and
allow a beverage to be dispensed from the beverage dispenser after associating the customer with the customer account.
2. The beverage dispensing system of claim 1, wherein the customer mobile device comprises a biometric sensor that collects the biometric characteristic of the customer.
3. The beverage dispensing system of claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the controller is configured to compare the biometric characteristic against a database of authorized biometric characteristics.
4. The beverage dispensing system of any one of claims 1

title: Core for writing, drawing and/or painting implements and method for the production thereof
abstract: The invention relates to a core for writing, drawing and/or painting implements, comprising at least one binder, at least one wax, at least one coloring substance and at least one filler, characterized in that the core is in the form of a lead core and/or colored core, that the at least one binder is hyroxypropyl cellulose (HPC) and that the content of the at least one binder is 7 to 45 wt.%.
claims:
- 7 - CLAIMS
1. A core for writing, drawing and/or painting implements, at least comprising at least one binder, at least one coloring substance and at least one filler, wherein: the core is a colored pencil core, the coloring substance is a colored pigment, the at least one binder is hydroxypropyl cellulose (HPC), and the core contains: 10 to 35 weight% HPC (binder) 9 to 50 weight% fillers 1.5 to 14 weight% coloring substance (pigment) 0 to 30 weight% binder 2 0 to 30 weight% wax and/or oils 0 to 10 weight% surfactant.
2. A method for producing a colored pencil core according to claim 1, wherein the core is formed by extrusion.
3. A method for producing a colored pencil core according to claim 1, wherein the core is formed by performing the following steps: mixing and granulating the at least one binder, the at least one coloring substance and the at least one filler of the core to a core granulate, extruding the core granules at a temperature in the range of 100 to 180°C in an extruder through a suitable mouthpiece to form endless core strands,8 5 cooling and solidifying the endless core strands, and cutting the endless core strand to a given length. Date Recue/Date Received 2023-07-20

title: Preparation process of spicy salad dressing containing diced meat and product of spicy salad dressing
abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of salad preparation and processing, in particular to a preparation process of spicy salad sauce containing meat granules and a product thereof, and the preparation process comprises the following preparation steps: pretreating the meat granules: cutting fresh meat into granules, adding pickling materials, uniformly stirring, adding rapeseed oil, uniformly stirring, baking the meat granules, jointly grinding the baked meat granules, spices and beewax, adding the spice into the meat granules, and uniformly stirring to obtain the spicy salad sauce containing the meat granules. Pre-treated meat granules are obtained; the preparation method comprises the following steps: heating mixed oil, egg yolk and polyglycerol fatty acid ester, and uniformly mixing the components to obtain the component A; component B: uniformly mixing sodium alginate, modified starch, an emulsifier, a thickener, a seasoning and water to obtain the component B; and mixing: fully and uniformly mixing the component A and the component B, emulsifying, homogenizing, adding the pretreated meat granules and protein powder, uniformly stirring, sterilizing and packaging to obtain a finished product. According to the technology, the meat granules and the spices can be uniformly dispersed in the meat granules, and the precipitation phenomenon can be effectively slowed down under the action of external force such as vibration in the transportation process.
claims:
1.一种含肉粒的香辛味沙拉酱制备工艺，其特征在于，包括以下制备步骤：
预处理肉粒：将新鲜肉切粒后，加入腌制料搅拌均匀，再加入菜籽油搅拌均匀，静置，将肉粒烤干，再将烤干后的肉粒、香辛料和蜂蜡共同研磨，得到预处理肉粒；
所述新鲜肉粒、所述腌制料和所述菜籽油的重量比为10：（4-6）：1；
所述烤干后的肉粒、所述香辛料和所述蜂蜡的重量比为10：（3-5）：4；
A组份：将混合油、蛋黄和聚甘油脂肪酸酯加热至70-80℃，搅拌至所有成分混合均匀，得到A组份；
所述混合油、所述蛋黄和所述聚甘油脂肪酸酯的重量比为（10-12）：（5-7）：3；
B组份：将海藻酸钠、改性淀粉、乳化剂、粘稠剂、调味料和水混合均匀，得到B组份；
所述海藻酸钠、所述改性淀粉、所述乳化剂、所述粘稠剂、所述调味料、所述水的重量比为（3-5）：（4-6）：（1-2）：（1-3）：（3-4）：20；
混合：将A组份和B组份充分混合均匀，乳化，均质，再加入预处理肉粒和蛋白粉，搅拌均匀，杀菌，包装，得到成品；
所述A组份和所述B组份、所述预处理肉粒、所述蛋白粉的重量比为（18-22）：（22-36）：25：4。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种含肉粒的香辛味沙拉酱制备工艺，其特征在于：所述预处理肉粒的粒度为10-140目。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种含肉粒的香辛味沙拉酱制备工艺，其特征在于，所述改性淀粉由以下方法得到：
1）取新鲜柠檬榨汁，再将柠檬汁与淀粉水混合，在60-70℃慢慢搅拌，直至整体成透明状，降温至40-50℃，再加入复合酶，保持加热2-4h，升温至80-90℃，使复合酶失活，降温至40-50℃，再加入磷酸类交联剂搅拌1-2h，得到粗品；
所述淀粉水由淀粉和水按照重量比为（5-7）：12混合得到；
所述柠檬汁、所述淀粉水、所述复合酶和所述磷酸类交联剂的重量比为（3-5）：10：（0.5-1.5）：1；
2）向粗品中加入水，然后进行离心、洗涤、干燥，得到改性淀粉。
4.根据权利要求3所述的一种含肉粒
assignee: 广东百利食品股份有限公司

title: System and method for detecting anomalies in pet radiology images
abstract: In one embodiment, a method includes accessing radiographic images of an animal, where one or more first radiographic images of the radiographic images depict the animal from one or more perspectives, respectively, and wherein one or more second ones of the radiographic images depict one or more body parts of the animal, respectively, determining a disease classification associated with the animal based on analyzing the radiographic images by a machine learning model, generating a diagnostic report associated with the animal based on the machine learning model, wherein the diagnostic report includes a disease classification and a natural language text radiology report, and sending an instruction to the user device for presenting the diagnostic report.
claims:
1.一种方法，其包括由一个或多个计算系统：
访问动物的多个放射影像图像，其中所述多个放射影像图像中的一个或多个第一放射影像图像分别从一个或多个视角描绘所述动物，并且其中所述多个放射影像图像中的一个或多个第二放射影像图像分别描绘所述动物的一个或多个身体部位；
基于通过机器学习模型分析所述多个放射影像图像，确定与所述动物相关联的一个或多个疾病分类；
基于所述机器学习模型生成与所述动物相关联的诊断报告，其中所述诊断报告包括所述一个或多个疾病分类和自然语言文本放射学报告；和
向用户设备发送用于呈现所述诊断报告的指令。
2.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述多个放射影像图像中的每一个放射影像图像均被格式化为医学数字成像和通信DICOM图像。
3.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述机器学习模型基于至少一个第一神经网络和至少一个第二神经网络，所述至少一个第一神经网络和所述至少一个第二神经网络彼此耦合。
4.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，生成所述诊断报告包括：
访问多个参考报告；
将所述多个参考报告编码到特征空间中；
将所述多个放射影像图像编码到所述特征空间中；和
基于所述特征空间中的相似度搜索确定所述诊断报告。
5.根据权利要求1所述的方法，其中，所述一个或多个疾病分类中的一个疾病分类指示异常组织。
6.根据权利要求5所述的方法，还包括：
将所述异常组织识别为心血管、肺部结构、纵隔结构、胸膜腔或胸腔外中的至少一种。
7.根据权利要求1所述的方法，还包括：
访问多个训练放射影像图像，其中，所述多个训练放射影像图像分别与多个训练放射学报告相关联；和
基于所访问的训练放射影像图像及其各自的训练放射学报告训练所述机器学习模型。

title: Stack strapping device
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of stacks, in particular to a stack strapping device which comprises a bottom plate, a fixing disc and a pressing plate, the top of the bottom plate is provided with a first bearing, the inner side of the first bearing is fixedly provided with a supporting rod, the outer side of the supporting rod is welded with a gear ring, the top of the supporting rod is provided with a bearing plate, and the bearing plate is fixedly connected with the fixing disc. A supporting plate is welded to the front end of the bottom plate, a top plate is welded to the rear end of the supporting plate above the bearing plate, a hydraulic cylinder is installed at the bottom of the top plate, a second bearing is installed at the top of a pressing plate, and a connecting plate is welded to the side face of the bottom plate. A supporting column is welded to the middle of the top of the connecting plate, and a third bearing is installed at the bottom of the fixing disc. The utility model has the advantages that the position of a stack filled with goods can be adjusted, and workers can conveniently fix the goods by using strapping tapes.
claims:
1.一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，包括底板(1)、固定盘(4)和压板(7)，其特征在于：所述底板(1)顶部安装有轴承一(10)，所述轴承一(10)内侧固定安装有支撑杆(18)，所述支撑杆(18)外侧焊接有齿环(17)，所述支撑杆(18)顶部安装有承载板(9)，所述轴承一(10)一侧的底板(1)顶部安装有电机(11)，所述电机(11)传动结构顶部安装有齿盘(19)，所述底板(1)前端焊接有支撑板(8)，所述承载板(9)上方的支撑板(8)后端焊接有顶板(6)，所述顶板(6)底部安装有液压缸(14)，所述压板(7)顶部安装有轴承二(15)，所述底板(1)侧面焊接有连接板(2)，所述连接板(2)顶部中间焊接有支柱(3)，所述固定盘(4)底部安装有轴承三(16)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述齿盘(19)和齿环(17)啮合连接。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述承载板(9)底部两侧分别安装有滑竿(12)，两个滑竿(12)底部与底板(1)顶部接触。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述顶板(6)与底板(1)相平行。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述支柱(3)顶部与轴承三(16)内环固定连接，固定盘(4)顶部焊接有限位杆(5)。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述底板(1)底部四角处分别安装有固定座(13)，固定座(13)与底板(1)底部相垂直。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种堆栈打带捆扎装置，其特征在于：所述液压缸(14)传动杆与轴承二(15)内环固定连接。
assignee: 郑州百事饮料有限公司

title: Systems and methods of integrated platforms for generating a unique identifier for a user-to-pet relationship
abstract: A computer-implemented method for dynamically managing electronic pet care data including hosting a user portal corresponding to at least one user and at least one pet, the user portal including at least one user profile and at least one pet profile, receiving a first data set from a first external system, wherein the first data set includes at least one user identifier and at least one pet identifier, retrieving the at least one user profile and the at least one pet profile based on the at least one user identifier and the at least one pet identifier respectively, updating the at least one pet profile based on the first data set, generating an electronic key based on the at least one user profile and the at least one pet profile, and displaying the electronic key on a user interface of the user portal.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for dynamically managing electronic pet care data, the method comprising:
hosting, by one or more processors, a user portal corresponding to at least one user and at least one pet, the user portal including at least one user profile and at least one pet profile, wherein one or more database records store the at least one user profile and the at least one pet profile;
receiving, by the one or more processors, a first data set from a first external system, the first external system including at least one of: a wellness system, a diagnostic system, a homing system, a genetics system, or a third party services system, wherein the first data set includes at least one user identifier and at least one pet identifier;
retrieving, by the one or more processors, the at least one user profile and the at least one pet profile based on the at least one user identifier and the at least one pet identifier respectively;
updating, by the one or more processors, the at least one pet profile based on the first data set;
generating, by the one or more processors, an electronic key based on the at least one user profile and the at least one pet profile; and
displaying, by the one or more processors, the electronic key on a user interface of the user portal.
2. The computer-implemented method of claim 1, wherein the electronic key includes a QR code.
3. The computer-implemented met

title: Shelf stable aggregate food product
abstract: Shelf stable aggregate foods are described that include a chewy binder that  includes  essentially no non-intact sugar sources. A binder in a shelf stable aggregate  food remains  chewy over shelf life and contains a sprouted whole grain ingredient, gum  Arabic, an oil,  and glycerin. Also described are methods of making a shelf stable aggregate  food.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A shelf stable food product, comprising an aggregate of particulates bound
together by a
pliable binder, the aggregate including:
a. the particulates in an amount of about 50% to about 70% by weight of the
aggregate; and
b. the pliable binder in an amount of about 30% to about 50% by weight of the
aggregate, the pliable binder comprising:
i. sprouted whole grain ingredient in an amount of 25% to about 55% by
weight of the pliable binder;
ii. gum acacia in an amount of 6% to about 18% by weight of the pliable
binder, wherein the ratio of the amount of sprouted whole grain ingredient
to the amount of gum acacia is at least 2:1 to about 6:1;
iii. oil in an amount of about 12% to 20% by weight of the pliable binder;
iv. glycerin in an amount of about 12% to 20% by weight of the pliable
binder, wherein the combined amount oil and glycerin does not exceed
35% by weight of the pliable binder;
v. moisture content of about 8% to less than 25% by weight of the pliable
binder; and
vi. essentially no non-intact sugar sources.
2. The shelf stable food product of claim 1, wherein the sprouted whole grain
ingredient is
included in an amount of about 30% to about 45% by weight of the pliable
binder.
3. The shelf stable food product of claim 1, wherein the ratio of sprouted
whole grain
ingredient to gum acacia is about 3:1 to about 4:1.<

title: Boil over reduction compositions for microwave cooking
abstract: An anti -boil-over composition comprising about 30% to about 60% powdered cauliflower or powdered pea fiber is added to dried rice or dried pasta within a container suitable for cooking in a microwave upon further adding water into the container. The amount of composition employed constitutes about 5% to about 13%, by weight, of the dried rice or dried pasta and can additionally include about 10% to about 45% purified starch, about 5% to about 10% fat, and up to 6% sodium chloride, potassium chloride and/or calcium chloride. A shelf stable food product including the anti-boil-over composition and a method of preparing the shelf stable food product are also encompassed.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. An anti -boil-over composition suitable for use in cooking dried rice or dried pasta in a microwave oven, said composition comprising about 30% to about 60% powdered cauliflower or powdered pea fiber, wherein an effective amount of the anti-boil-over composition is configured to reduce or eliminate boil-over when dried rice or dried pasta is cooked in water in a limited volume container with microwave oven heating relative to cooking the dried rice or dried pasta in the same manner in the limited volume container without the anti -boil-over composition.
2. The anti -boil-over composition of claim 1, wherein the composition additionally comprises about 10% to about 45% purified starch, about 5% to about 10% fat, and up to 6% sodium chloride, potassium chloride and/or calcium chloride.
3. The anti -boil-over composition of claim 2, wherein the purified starch comprises tapioca starch and/or com starch.
4. The anti-boil-over composition of claim 2, wherein the fat comprises coconut oil.

6. A shelf stable food product comprising: a. dried rice or dried pasta; <

title: Cereal food product and method of making the same
abstract: Cocoa or cinnamon is mixed at least one enzyme to form a mixture, and the mixture is combined with a cereal food composition. In one embodiment, the cereal food composition is extruded or otherwise formed into a plurality of cereal pieces after the mixture is combined with the food composition. In another embodiment, the mixture is coated onto cereal pieces formed from the food composition. Preferably, the at least one enzyme includes at least two carbohydrases, and can also include soluble fiber enzymes, and even one or more fat soluble enzymes. In each case, the at least one enzyme is deactivated, either during working of the cocoa or cinnamon after combining with the cereal food composition or prior to the mixture being combined with the cereal food composition.
claims:
8.296079 CLAIMS:
1. A method of producing a ready to eat cereal food product comprising: mixing a plurality of ingredients to form an intermediate cereal food composition; mixing cocoa or cinnamon with at least one enzyme to foim a mixture, wherein the at least one enzyme is a combination of at least two carbohydrases and at least one soluble fiber enzyme; and combining the mixture with the intermediate cereal food composition in forming the ready to eat cereal food product.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the two carbohydrase enzymes include cellulase and xylanase.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein mixing the cocoa or cinnamon with the at least one enzyme includes mixing cocoa with cellulase, xylanase and at least two additional, soluble fiber enzymes.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein mixing cocoa with the cellulase, xylanase and at least two additional, soluble fiber enzymes includes mixing cocoa with cellulase, xylanase, pectinase and protease.
5. The method of claim 3, further comprising mixing the cocoa, cellulase, xylanase, and at least two additional, soluble fiber enzymes with at least one fat soluble enzyme.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein mixing the cocoa with cellulase, xylanase, at least two additional, soluble fiber enzymes and at least one fat soluble enzyme includes mixing cocoa with cellulase, xyl

title: Mouthfeel modulation in reduced and sugar-free beverages using a blend of pectin and xanthan gum
abstract: This disclosure provides novel compositions comprising a pectin, a first xanthan gum, and optionally a second xanthan gum. These compositions are useful for improving mouthfeel properties of non-nutritive sweeteners, such as steviol glycosides and blends thereof, in food and beverages containing the same.
claims:
1. A beverage, comprising: (1) a pectin having an average molecular weight ranging from about 50,000 Daltons (Da) to about 400,000 Da; (2) a first xanthan gum having an average molecular weight ranging from about 3,000,000 Da to about 6,000,000 kDa; (3) a non-nutritive sweetener; and (4) water; wherein the beverage has a viscosity ranging from about 1.0 cP to about 1.5 cP; and a coefficient of friction ranging from about 0.9 to about 1.4.
2. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the pectin is selected from the group consisting of apple pectins, citrus pectins, grape pectins, and carrot pectins.
3. The beverage of claim 2, wherein the pectin is apple pectin.
4. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the first xanthan gum has an average molecular weight of about 4,500,000 Da.
5. (canceled)
6. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the pectin has a degree of esterification ranging from about 50% to about 99%.
7. The beverage of claim 6, wherein the pectin has a degree of esterification ranging from about 80% to about 99%.
8. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the pectin is present in the beverage at a concentration ranging from about 50 ppm to about 4000 ppm.

title: Satisfying and non-perishable soft-baked snack product with crispy pieces
abstract: A shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product (e.g., a soft-baked snack bar) having reduced saturated fat, sodium, and/or sugar levels ("reduced SFSS") compared to prior art soft-baked snack products but that is indulgent and flavorful to the consumer. The snack product has a relatively high moisture content, preferably about 5 wt% to about 20 wt%. A dough composition for making reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack products includes a flour component, a fat component consisting of sunflower oil (e.g., high oleic sunflower oil), a plurality of crispy protein inclusions, and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose. Sodium-containing leaveners are partially or completely replaced, e.g., by potassium bicarbonate. If present, cocoa powder is used in reduced amounts compared to prior art soft-baked snack products. A method of making the reduced SFSS, shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product with the crispy protein inclusions includes a step of baking the dough composition.
claims:
1. A dough composition for making a shelf-stable, indulgent, soft-baked snack product having reduced saturated fat, sodium and/or sugar levels ("reduced SFSS"), the composition comprising: a flour component; a fat component consisting of sunflower oil; crispy protein inclusions greater than 3 mm in size; and a sucrose-free sugar component including isolated fructose.
2. The dough composition of claim 1, wherein the flour component comprises at least 20% of the dough composition.
3. The dough composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the sunflower oil is high oleic sunflower oil.
4. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the sucrose-free sugar component comprises a flavor modulator that enhances sweetness upfront and a flavor modulator that enhances long lasting sweetness.
5. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the crispy protein inclusions include crisps or puffs having a white chocolate coating.
6. The dough composition of any one of claims 1-5, wherein the crispy protein inclusions are in the form of particulates sized from about 5 mm to about 8 mm.
7. The dough composition of any on claims 1-6, further comprising additional inclusions which are sugar free, fat free and/or

title: Beverage container dispenser and method for dispensing beverage container
abstract: To provide a beverage container dispenser that makes a consumer experience a unique beverage dispensation experience.SOLUTION: There is provided a method for dispensing a beverage container to a consumer. The method includes receiving a first beverage container containing a beverage corresponding to a user's beverage choice by a beverage container dispenser. The method further includes dispensing a second beverage container containing a beverage from a temperature control section of the beverage container dispenser. The second beverage container dispensed from the temperature control section corresponds to the user's beverage choice.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
claims:

title: Slow feeding device for feeding equine animals
abstract: A slow feeder for feeding equine animals comprises a container (110) for containing feed. The slow feeder comprises a feeding restrictor (120) disposed on the feed in the container (110) and having an aperture through which the equine ingests feed from the container (110). The slow feeder comprises a strap (130) connecting the feeding restrictor (120) to the container (110), the strap providing tension between the feeding restrictor (120) and the container (110) and allowing the feeding restrictor (120) to translate in a vertical direction within the container (110).
claims:
1.一种用于给马科动物喂食饲料的慢食器，所述慢食器包括：
容器，其用于容纳饲料；
喂食限制器，其设置在所述容器中的饲料上并且具有孔，马科动物通过所述孔从所述容器中摄取饲料；以及
带子，其将所述喂食限制器连接到所述容器以在所述喂食限制器和所述容器之间提供张力，并允许所述喂食限制器在所述容器内沿垂直方向平移，
其中，所述慢食器是模块化的，并且能够针对马科动物进行配置，
其中，当马科动物摄取饲料时，所述慢食器更自然地跟随马科动物的运动，并且
其中，所述慢食器减少从所述容器中取出饲料所需的力的量，同时充分延长了觅食的时间，因此能够限制每日消耗的饲料量，而不会显著损害安全和健康。

abstract: This disclosure provides novel compositions comprising a pectin, a first xanthan gum, and optionally a second xanthan gum. title: Co-Extruded Dough Product with High-Particulate Filling
abstract: A co-extruded filled dough product comprises a dough shell casing and a filling material co-extruded with the dough shell casing. The filling material includes greater than about 40% of a particulate component and less than about 60% of a sauce component. The sauce component has a Bostwick consistency greater than about 7 cm and can be, e.g., a cheese-based sauce or a tomato-based sauce. A method of producing a filled dough product comprises co-extruding a dough shell casing and a filling material. A system for producing a filled dough product comprises a dough shell casing extruder die for forming a dough shell casing and a filling material die configured to extrude a filling material within the dough shell casing.
claims:
1. A co-extruded filled dough product comprising
a dough shell casing; and
a filling material co-extruded with the dough shell casing, the filling material including:
about 40% to about 45% of a particulate component; and
about 55% to about 60% of a sauce component, the sauce component having a Bostwick consistency greater than 7 cm.
2. The dough product of claim 1, wherein the filling material has a dynamic viscosity of over about 1000 cP at a temperature between about 30° F. and about 40° F.
3. The dough product of claim 2, wherein the filling material has a dynamic viscosity between about 2000 cP and about 3000 cP at a temperature of between about 30° F. and about 40° F.
4. The dough product of claim 1, wherein the particulate component includes egg or egg substitute.
5. The dough product of claim 1, wherein the sauce component includes starch in an amount configured to give the sauce component the Bostwick consistency greater than 7 cm.
6. A method of producing a filled dough product, the method comprising
co-extruding a dough shell casing and a filling material, where the filling material includes

title: Coating made of erythrital and sucharose
abstract: FIELD: food industry.SUBSTANCE: coated dried food piece containing a piece of food that has a surface, and a coating having a crystallinity of 20% to 60% on at least a portion of the said surface. The said coating contains soluble solids, including erythritol, where at least part of the erythritol is crystalline erythritol, and sucrose, where at least part of the sucrose is crystalline sucrose. title: Pet food product
abstract: A pet food product comprising a fat component in an amount of from 2.0 wt % to 8.0 wt % by total weight of the pet food product, and a proteinaceous component in an amount of from 6.0 wt % to 14.0 wt % by total weight of the pet food product, wherein said proteinaceous component comprises polypeptides and free amino acids, wherein the ratio of the fat component to the proteinaceous component is from about 0.45:1.0 to about 1.0:1.0, and wherein the amount of free amino acids in the pet food product is at least 0.5 wt % by total weight of the pet food product.
claims:

A pet food product comprising a fat component in an amount of from about 5.5 wt % to about 6.7 wt % by total weight of the pet food product, and a proteinaceous component in an amount of from about 9.5 wt. % to about 10.5 wt % by total weight of the pet food product, wherein the ratio of the fat component to the proteinaceous component in the pet food product is about 0.58,
wherein the proteinaceous component comprises the free amino acid glycine in an amount of from 12 wt % to 30 wt %, by total weight of the proteinaceous component,
wherein the amount of the free amino acid glycine in the pet food product is about 1 wt. % to about 2 wt. %, by total weight of the pet food product,
wherein the total fiber content of the pet food product is from at least about 0.1 wt % to about 5 wt % by total weight of the pet food product,
wherein the pet food product comprises reconstituted animal material, and wherein the pet food product is a wet pet food product.
2. The pet food product according to claim 1, wherein the reconstituted animal material further comprises at least one of fat(s), antioxidant(s), carbohydrate source(s), fibre source(s), additional source(s) of protein, seasoning, colorant(s), flavouring(s), mineral(s), preservative(s), vitamin(s), emulsifier(s), farinaceous material(s), and combinations thereof.

title: Extruded puffed high protein grain-based food pieces and methods of making
abstract: The present disclosure relates to low density, high protein, grain-based ready-to-eat food pieces, compositions including such food pieces, and methods of making such food pieces. The pieces include a grain flour in an amount of about 28% to about 55% by dry weight, about 28% to about 40% by dry weight protein, where at least a portion of the protein ingredients include a protein with a PDCAAS greater of at least 60%, such as pea protein, fava bean protein, or soybean protein, and about 10% to about 35% by dry weight low DE carbohydrate.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A composition comprising a plurality of food pieces, the food pieces consisting of: a. a grain flour in an amount of about 30% to about 55% by dry weight of the food pieces; b. a plant-based protein ingredient in an amount of about 28% to about 40% by dry weight of the food pieces, comprising pea protein, fava bean protein, chickpea protein, canola protein, or soybean protein, the protein ingredient having a protein content of at least 60% protein by dry weight of the protein ingredient; c. maltodextrin in an amount of 10% to about 35% by dry weight of the food pieces, the maltodextrin having a DE of from 1 to about 10; d. other ingredients, the combined other ingredients included in an amount of up to 20% by dry weight of the food pieces; and e. a moisture content of up to 5% by weight of the food pieces, wherein the food pieces have a bulk density range of from 110 to 200 grams per 100 cubic inches.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein at least a portion of the grain flour is a whole grain flour.
3. The composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the grain flour comprises oat flour or com flour.
4. The composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the plant-based protein ingredient is included in an amount of about 50% to about 72% relative to the amount of grain flour.
5. The composition of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the plant-based protein ing

title: Cat food compositions for treating chronic kidney disease
abstract: The present disclosure relates to food compositions comprising an effective amount of one or more tripolyphosphate salt, as a source of inorganic phosphorus, for use in a method for treating and/or delaying the progression of chronic kidney disease in a cat in need thereof.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A food composition including from about 0.1 g/Mcal to about 1.5 g/Mcal of inorganic phosphorus and comprising an effective amount of one or more tripolyphosphate salt, as a source of inorganic phosphorus, for use in a method for treating and/or delaying the progression of chronic kidney disease in a cat in need thereof.
2. The food composition for use according to claim 1 , wherein the one or more tripolyphosphate salt consists of sodium tripolyphosphate (STPP), potassium tripolyphosphate (KTPP) or a mixture thereof, in particular the one or more tripolyphosphate salt consists of sodium tripolyphosphate.
3. The food composition for use according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the food composition includes about 1.0 g/Mcal or less of inorganic phosphorus.
4. The food composition for use according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein at least about 0.2 g/Mcal of inorganic phosphorus originates from the one or more tripolyphosphate salt.
5. The food composition for use according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the inorganic phosphorus originates from one or more inorganic pyrophosphate and the one or more tripolyphosphate salt.
6. The food composition for use according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the total amount of inorganic phosphorus originates from the one or more tripolyphosphate salt.

title: Genetic test for liver copper accumulation in dogs
abstract: The present disclosure provides methods of determining the susceptibility of a dog to liver copper accumulation, comprising detecting in a biological sample obtained from the dog the presence or absence in the genome of the dog of one or more polymorphisms, and methods of treating or breeding the dog based on such determination.
claims:
1. A method of treating or breeding a dog, comprising: (a) genotyping a biological sample obtained from the dog to determine in a genome of the dog presence or absence of a polymorphism of Chr22_3167534 (position 101 of SEQ ID NO: 144; and (b) administering to the dog a low copper food stuff or a therapeutic amount of a copper chelator when the polymorphism is present; or breeding the dog when the polymorphism is absent.
2. title: Cheese compositions and related methods
abstract: Described are cheese compositions and methods of making cheese compositions, including methods of formulating cheese compositions, wherein the cheese compositions may include combinations of casein protein, fiber, non-casein protein, non-pregelatinized, modified starch, and a fat component.

from 1 to 5 weight percent non-casein protein, and

title: Hard TACO shell and method for producing the hard TACO shell
abstract: A taco shell (10) is produced by applying a plasticizing agent (coating 100) to a base or spine portion (25) of a hard taco shell, such as by targeted spraying, rolling, brushing or dipping of the taco shell, thereby softening the base or spine portion (25), preferably across a strip width between 4mm-20mm. As a result, when the taco shell (10) is bitten, the softened base portion (25) has some hinging flexibility or pliability which reduces the potential for any crack propagation. Therefore, the structural integrity of the hard taco shell (10) can be better maintained while be eaten, resulting in retention of the fillings and less mess. If desired, an anti- migration agent can also be applied to assure containment of the plasticizing agent in the targeted region.
claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A method of producing a hard taco shell having two hard shell sidewall portions joined by a base portion comprising applying a plasticizing agent along at least one targeted section of the base portion to soften the at least one targeted section, thereby increasing hinging flexibility or pliability of the at least one targeted section to better maintain an overall structural integrity of the hard taco shell upon subsequent consumption, wherein the plasticizing agent is limited to the base portion of the hard taco shell.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width between 4-
20.m.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width between 8-
16.m.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied to a strip width of about
14.m.
5. The method of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the plasticizing agent is applied as a coating through one of spraying, rolling, brushing or dipping of the taco shell.
6. The method of any one of claims 2-4, wherein the plasticizing agent is glycerin.

abstract: A new and distinct variety of cacao plant named ‘ISC-1’, particularly selected for its self-compatibility, is disclosed.
