title: Shelf Stable Food with Flavor
abstract: Methods are disclosed for making a shelf stable food containing a flavorant having improved intensity over shelf life. Methods include applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces prior to combining the dried fruit pieces with a binder to form an aggregate. Shelf stable foods made according to the disclosed methods are also disclosed.
claims:
1. A method of making a shelf stable food, the method comprising: a. applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces to produce powder coated fruit pieces, the powder coated fruit pieces including the powdered flavorant in an amount of 0.1% to 20% by weight of the dried fruit pieces; b. combining the powder coated fruit pieces with a fluid binder to form an aggregate; and c. setting a structure of the fluid binder in the aggregate to form the shelf stable food including particulates and bound by a set binder, the particulates including the dried fruit pieces having the powdered flavorant localized to the surface of the dried fruit pieces.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the powdered flavorant comprises an encapsulated flavorant.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the step of applying the powdered flavorant to the surface of dried fruit pieces is performed during a delumping process.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of greater than 130° F. during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of less than 200° F. during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the step of setting the structure of the fluid binde

title: Zero-sugar and zero-net CARB dairy product and preparation thereof
System, method, and apparatus for analyzing x-ray images using multi-view classification
abstract: In one embodiment, a method includes accessing multiple X-ray images associated with an animal, wherein the multiple X-ray images correspond to multiple views, respectively, generating multiple feature maps for the multiple X-ray images, respectively, by a first machine-learning model, and determining diagnosis labels indicating diseases associated with the animal based on the multiple feature maps by a second machine-learning model which includes an attention mechanism.
claims:
1. A method comprising, by one or more computing systems:
accessing a plurality of three-dimensional (3D) X-ray images associated with an animal, wherein the plurality of 3D X-ray images correspond to a plurality of views, respectively;
generating, by a first machine-learning model comprising one or more convolutional neural networks, a plurality of 3D feature maps for the plurality of 3D X-ray images, respectively, wherein the plurality of 3D feature maps correspond to the plurality of views, respectively;
generating, based on one or more data augmentation mechanisms, one or more additional 3D feature maps from the plurality of 3D feature maps;
generating an integrated 3D feature map based on the plurality of 3D feature maps and the one or more additional 3D feature maps;
inputting the integrated 3D feature map to a second machine-learning model comprising one or more adapted vision transformers configured for processing 3D inputs;
modeling, by the second machine-learning model, a contextual relationship associated with the integrated 3D feature map based on a self-attention mechanism associated with the second machine-learning model;
determining, by the second machine-learning model based on the integrated 3D feature map and the contextual relationship associated with the integrated 3D feature map, one or more diagnosis labels, wherein the one or more diagnosis labels indicate one or more diseases associated with the animal; and

title: Dough product packaging assembly and method of packaging
abstract: A dough product packaging assembly includes one or more dough pieces arranged a first container having a closed, internal cavity, a second container supported upon the first container with an open top portion, a third container housing one or more additional ingredients, such as icing, within the second container, and an outer container extending across the open top portion of the second container and encapsulating each of the first, second and third containers. In connection with production, transportation and consumer displaying of the product, the second container provides support and transfers weight from any cartons stacked above a lower dough product directly onto the first container, thereby allowing the outer or fourth container to act as a containment vessel only, versus something needed to directly provide vertical structural support.
claims:
1. A food product assembly comprising:
a first container having first and second spaced end portions and an interior cavity, with the first container being closed at each of the first and second end portions;
at least one dough product within the interior cavity of the first container;
a second container supported on the first end portion of the first container, said second container having an opening exposing an interior compartment of the second container;
a third container housed within the interior compartment of the second container;
at least one additional ingredient housed within the third container; and
a fourth container enveloping each of the first and second containers, maintaining relative positioning of the first and second containers within the fourth container, and extending directly across the opening of second container to maintain the third container within the second container.
2. The food product assembly of claim 1, wherein the first container includes, at the first end portion, a projecting portion, said second container being received against the projecting portion.
3. The food product assembly of claim 2, wherein the second container is a tubular member which establishes a structural support for the food product assembly and the fourth container acts as a containment vessel.

title: Infused cranberries and methods of making
abstract: Described are dried cranberries with reduced sugar content, while retaining a desired sweetness and texture, and methods of making such dried cranberries. Dried cranberries include erythritol and a sweetener that interferes with erythritol crystallization.
claims:
1. A method of making a food composition, comprising: a. providing cranberries, b. applying a solution to the cranberries to form a mixture, the solution including: i. about 20% to about 50% erythritol; ii. soluble fiber; iii. glycerol; and iv. a compound selected from allulose, xylitol, maltitol, sorbitol, and any combination thereof, and present in an amount configured to interfere with crystallization of the erythritol, wherein the solution is at a temperature of from about 200 to about 250° F., the temperature being configured to improve solubility of the erythritol; c. incubating the mixture for sufficient time to infuse the cranberries with the solution to produce infused cranberries.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the solution comprises: a. about 30% to about 45% erythritol; b. about 5% to about 50% soluble fiber; c. about 5% to about 50% glycerol; and d. about 5% to about 20% of the compound selected from allulose, xylitol, maltitol, sorbitol, and any combination thereof.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the mixture has a pH of from about 3.0 to 3.3 following the incubating step.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the solution further comprises an alkalizing agent.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the cranberries ar

title: Vegetable- and/or fruit-containing snack food products and manufacture thereof
abstract: A non-fried fruit-and/or vegetable-containing snack food product comprising a rigid starch matrix comprising potato starch and one or more fruit and/or vegetables; and one or more phytochemicals comprising a carotenoid, a glucosinolate, a flavonoid or a mixture thereof; wherein the fruit and/or vegetable content of the product is between 15-28 wt% based on the weight of the product; and derived from non-dehydrated, non-powdered fruit and/or vegetables A dough for making the snack food product and a method of manufacture are also disclosed.
claims:
Claims
1. A non-fried fruit- and/ or vegetable-containing snack food product comprising a rigid starch matrix comprising potato starch and one or more fruit and/or vegetables ; and one or more phytochemicals comprising a carotenoid, a glucosinolate, a flavonoid or a mixture thereof; wherein the fruit and/or vegetable content of the product is: between 15-28 wt% based on the weight of the product; and derived from non-dehydrated, non-powdered fruit and/or vegetables.
2. A snack food product as claimed in claim 1, wherein at least some of the fruit and/ or vegetable content of the product is visible in the form of pieces or particles.
3. A snack food product as claimed in claim 1 or claim 2, wherein at least some of the fruit and/ or vegetable content of the product has an intact cellular structure.
4. A snack food product as claimed in in any one of claims 1 - 3, wherein the fruit and/or vegetable content of the product is between 18-27 wt% based on the weight of the product.
5. A snack food product as claimed in any one of claims 1 -4, wherein the fruit and/ or vegetable content of the product is derived from fresh or individually quick frozen (IQF) fruit and/ or vegetables.
6. A snack food product as claimed in any one of claims 1 -5, wherein the product has a carotenoid content of about 2 to about 25 mg/ 100g of snack food product; a glucosinolate content of about 10 to about 58 mg/ioog of snack food product; and/or a f

title: Modular blow mold system for blow molding a container
abstract: A modular system for blow molding a container. The system may include a first portion, a second portion, and a third portion. The first portion and second portion may each include a shell, a mold removably coupled to the shell, and a top plate. The third portion may include a base and a base mold. The molds may be 3D printed. The molds together may define a blow mold cavity. The modular system may be used at lab scale, pilot scale, or full production scale. The molds may be durable and smooth enough for full production scale. Some embodiments are directed to methods for making a modular system for blow molding a container.

title: Dough composition and baked food products with whey protein cream
abstract: A dough composition can be formulated using a whey protein cream ingredient to reduce or replace certain emulsifying agents while maintaining or extending the shelf-life of the final baked food product. The whey protein cream may further be used to reduce or replace additional protein ingredients used in dough formulations. In some formulations, the dough composition may include a comparatively low amount of emulsifying agent or a casein salt, while other formulations are substantially free of an emulsifying agent or casein salt. The inclusion of whey protein cream may beneficially maintain freshness and shelf-life of baked food products from the dough compositions.
claims:
1. A dough composition comprising:
a flour;
a shortening;
whey protein cream; and
water.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition comprises the flour in an amount of between about 3 wt-% and about 70 wt-%.
3. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition comprises the shortening in an amount of between about 0.1 wt-% and about 30 wt-%.
4. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition comprises the whey protein cream in an amount of between about 0.05 wt-% to about 5 wt-%.
5. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition comprises the water in an amount of between about 1 wt-% to about 50 wt-%.
6. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition comprises a casein salt in an amount of less than 1 wt-%.
7. The composition of claim 6, wherein the composition is substantially free of the casein salt.
8. The composition of claim 1, wherein the composition is substantially free of a monoglyceride and/

title: Cooking device provided with preheating structure and used for corn tabletting
abstract: The utility model discloses a cooking device provided with a preheating structure and used for corn tabletting. The cooking device comprises a machine body, a water tank is fixedly installed on the left side of the lower end of the machine body, a steam generator is connected to the left side of the upper end of the water tank, a pump body is arranged on the right side of the steam generator, and a steam pipe is connected to the right side of the pump body; the mounting plate is fixedly mounted on the rear side of the middle of the machine body, and a connecting wheel is connected to the middle side of the front end of the mounting plate; the stirring rod is installed on the middle side of the interior of the preheating box body, a stirring structure is connected to the outer side of the right end of the stirring rod, a feeding hopper is fixed to the middle side of the upper end of the preheating box body, and a shielding structure is connected to the outer side of the upper end of the feeding hopper; the air cylinder is fixedly arranged on the left side of the upper end of the machine body, and a moving plate is fixedly installed on the right side of the air cylinder. According to the cooking device provided with the preheating structure and used for the corn flakes, the corn flakes can be preheated conveniently, feeding of the corn flakes is facilitated, and the cooking effect on the corn flakes is good.
claims:
1.一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，包括：
机体(1)，其下端左侧固定安装有水箱(2)，且水箱(2)的上端左侧连接有蒸汽发生器(3)，所述蒸汽发生器(3)的右侧设置有泵体(4)，且泵体(4)的右侧连接有蒸汽管(5)，并且蒸汽管(5)的外侧连接有滤网(18)，所述机体(1)的内部下侧与机体(1)的内部中侧均固定安装有固定板(6)，且机体(1)的下端右侧固定安装有出料管(7)，所述机体(1)的上端右侧固定安装有预热箱体(12)，且预热箱体(12)的下端左侧连接有进料管(19)；
其特征在于，包括：
安装板(8)，其固定安装在机体(1)的中部后侧，且安装板(8)的前端中侧连接有衔接轮(9)，并且衔接轮(9)的左侧固定安装有绞龙(10)，所述机体(1)的左端上侧固定安装有衔接管(11)；
搅拌杆(13)，其安装在预热箱体(12)的内部中侧，且搅拌杆(13)的右端外侧连接有搅拌结构，所述预热箱体(12)的上端中侧固定有进料斗(16)，且进料斗(16)的上端外侧连接有遮挡结构；
气缸(20)，其固定设置在机体(1)的上端左侧，且气缸(20)的右侧固定安装有移动板(21)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：所述衔接轮(9)单体之间采用啮合的方式相连接，且衔接轮(9)与安装板(8)之间采用转动的方式相连接。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：所述遮挡结构包含有盖板(17)，该盖板(17)安装在进料斗(16)的上端左侧，且盖板(17)的右端外侧固定设置有弹簧(24)，并且弹簧(24)的外侧固定安装有限位杆(25)。
4.根据权利要求3所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：所述盖板(17)与进料斗(16)之间采用转动的方式相连接，且盖板(17)的竖截面形状为“L”字形结构。
5.根据权利要求4所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：所述盖板(17)与限位杆(25)之间采用滑动的方式相连接，且限位杆(25)与进料斗(16)之间采用卡合的方式相连接。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：所述移动板(21)与进料管(19)之间采用卡合的方式相连接。
7.根据权利要求1所述的一种设有预热结构的玉米压片用蒸煮装置，其特征在于：
assignee: 宁夏马氏兄弟饲料有限公司

title: Rolled dough product and method of producing
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A method of producing laminated dough products, the method comprising: cutting a laminated dough sheet to form individual pieces; stretching the individual pieces; curling the individual pieces to establish curled pieces; compressing the curled pieces to form compressed, curled pieces; and surface treating the compressed, curled pieces such that exposed surface portions of each compressed, curled piece are coated.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein, after cutting to form the individual pieces and before curling the individual pieces, re-orientating the individual pieces.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the individual pieces are stretched from 50% to 100%.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the individual pieces are stretched about 75%.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the curled pieces are pressed so as to be flattened to a range 10-22 mm in forming the compressed, curled pieces.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the surface treating includes applying a formulation of water, a hydrocolloid and/or polysaccharide blend, and egg yolk or whole eggs.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the hydrocolloid blend includes a hydrocolloid, a gum and a starch.

title: Stator winding structure and disc type motor thereof
abstract: The utility model discloses a stator winding structure and a disc type motor thereof, comprising a stator seat plate and a stator coil assembly composed of a plurality of coil winding units, a magnet yoke is arranged corresponding to each coil winding unit, the plurality of coil winding units are uniformly arranged on the stator seat plate around the center of the stator seat plate, and the coil winding units are arranged on the stator seat plate. One surface of the stator base plate is provided with surrounding grooves corresponding to the coil winding units, and the surrounding grooves are internally provided with flat metal wires to form the coil winding units. The flat metal wire, generally copper, is adopted, the flat metal wire is inserted and fixed in a groove surrounding mode, the effective copper sectional area of the winding is guaranteed, meanwhile, the number of turns is increased, and the current passing capacity is improved.
claims:
1.一种定子绕组结构,其特征在于，包括定子座板、多个线圈绕组单元组成的定子线圈组件，对应每一所述线圈绕组单元设置有磁轭，多个所述线圈绕组单元在所述定子座板上环绕所述定子座板中心均匀设置，在所述定子座板其中一表面上对应每一个所述线圈绕组单元设置有环绕槽，所述环绕槽内设置有扁型金属线形成所述线圈绕组单元。
2.根据权利要求1所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述扁型金属线沿着宽度方向一侧插入固定到所述环绕槽内，围绕所述磁轭形成所述线圈绕组单元。
3.根据权利要求1所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所有所述线圈绕组单元被均匀划分为三个相极组，每个相极组的所述线圈绕组单元成对中心对称；若干绕组连接线在所有所述线圈绕组单元外圈环绕接线后分别连接到第一接线部、第二接线部、第三接线部。
4.根据权利要求3所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述线圈绕组单元的扁型金属线两端分别设置有第一绕组端头和第二绕组端头，所述第一绕组端头和所述第二绕组端头分别通过单元连接线与对应的所述绕组连接线相互连接。
5.根据权利要求1所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述定子座板中间开设有中心孔，所有所述环绕槽均匀沿着周向设置在所述中心孔周围。
6.根据权利要求1所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述环绕槽内开设有磁轭安装孔，用于安装所述磁轭。
7.根据权利要求6所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述磁轭包括磁轭柱体以及设置在所述磁轭柱体一端的磁轭端头，所述磁轭柱体插入设置在所述磁轭安装孔，所述磁轭端头与所述磁轭安装孔底部相抵接。
8.根据权利要求4所述的定子绕组结构,其特征在于，所述定子座板对应每一所述第一绕组端头，所述第二绕组端头和所述单元连接线分别设置有第一端头座，第二端头座，单元连接线安装座。
9.一种盘式电机，其特征在于，包括如权利要求1-8任意一项所述的定子绕组结构。
assignee: 火星之上(东莞)科技有限公司

title: Oat flour-based crÈme confection
abstract: Described herein is a food composition that is suitable for use as a filling or topping for a shelf stable snack. The food composition includes an oat flour in an amount of 30-50%, a fat component that includes a shortening and an oil, sugar, a total moisture content of 2.5-5%, and a water activity of less than 0.58. The food has an extended shelf life at room temperature and resists moisture migration despite containing a significant amount of oat flour, which has a moisture content of 6-10%.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A food composition, comprising: a. oat flour in an amount of about 30% to about 50% by weight of the food composition, the oat flour having a moisture content of 6% to 10%; b. a fat component, comprising: i. a shortening in an amount of about 18% to about 35% by weight of the food composition, the shortening having a Mettler Dropping Point (MDP) of from about 40° C to about 50° C; and ii. an oil in an amount of about 7% to about 10% by weight of the food composition, where the oil to shortening is at a ratio of from about 0.2: 1 to about 0.5: 1; c. sugar in an amount of about 15% to about 25% by weight of the food composition; d. a total moisture content of about 2.5% to about 5% by weight of the food composition; and e. a water activity of less than 0.58.
2. The food composition of claim 1, wherein the oat flour is included in an amount by weight that is greater than the amount of the shortening.
3. The food composition of claim 1 or 2, wherein the shortening has a 10° C to 40° C solid fat content (SFCKMO) profile, the SFC10-40 profile having a formula of y = mx + b, where y is solid fat content, x is temperature in Celsius, m is slope having a value between about -1.5 and about -2.2, and b is a value between about 70 and about 90.
4. The food composition of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the shortening has a rate of crystallization (ROC) measured between 30 seconds and 300 seconds having a formula of y = mx + b, whe

title: System and method for assessing wellness
abstract: To provide a system, method, and apparatus for assessing pet wellness.SOLUTION: This method includes the steps of: receiving data related to a pet; based on the data, determining one or more health indicators of the pet; and, based on the one or more health indicators, performing a wellness assessment of the pet. Also, the method further includes the steps of: determining a recommendation to a pet owner based on the wellness assessment; and transmitting the recommendation to a mobile device of the pet owner, where the recommendation is displayed at the mobile device to the pet owner.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:
【請求項1】
着用型装置であって、
上蓋と、
前記上蓋と結合された基部と
を有するハウジングを備え、
前記ハウジングは、ペットに関するデータを監視するためのセンサーと、前記ペットに関する前記データを送信するための送受信機と、表示器とを備え、
前記表示器は照明装置、音響装置、又は振動装置のうち少なくとも１つであり、
前記ハウジング内に備えられた前記表示器は、該着用型装置がジオフェンス・ゾーンを出た後、オンにされるように構成される、着用型装置。
【請求項2】
前記ペットに関する前記データは、前記ペットによる舐める、引っ掻く、かゆみ、歩行、または眠るについてのメトリックを含む前記ペットの１つ以上の健康指標を決定するステップであって、前記データを、ＬＳＴＭモデル、ＣＮＮモデル、またはその組み合わせを含む活動認識モデルによって処理し、前記活動認識モデルの出力に基づいて前記１つ以上の健康指標を決定することを含むステップおよび前記ペットの前記1つ以上の健康指標に基づいて前記ペットの健康評価を実行するステップのうち少なくとも１つのために使用される、請求項１記載の着用型装置。
【請求項3】
該着用型装置は前記ペットに関する前記データを１つ以上のサーバー又はクラウドコンピューティングプラットフォームに送信するように構成され、前記１つ以上の健康指標を決定する前記ステップは、前記着用型装置、前記１つ以上のサーバー、又は前記クラウドコンピューティングプラットフォームのうち少なくとも１つによって実行される、請求項２記載の着用型装置。
【請求項4】
以下の条件：
（ｉ）前記ペットに関する前記データは１つ以上のサーバー又はクラウドコンピューティングプラットフォームに送信される、
（ｉｉ）前記表示器は前記上蓋の上に配置される、
（ｉｉｉ）前記照明装置は電灯又は発光ダイオードを含む、
（ｉｖ）前記照明装置は前記ハウジング内に配置され該着用型装置の少なくとも前記上蓋を照明するように構成される、

（ｖｉ）前記上蓋は前記側壁と一体である、

（ｖｉｉｉ）前記ハウジングは首輪バンドに結合される取り付け器を備える、
assignee: マース インコーポレーテッド

title: Baking Ingredients Suitable for Fat Replacement
abstract: Baking ingredients that can be used as a fat replacement in dough compositions and baked goods are described. Baking ingredients include a thermo-reversible hydrocolloid and can be included in a dough composition or layered with a laminated dough. The baking ingredients lead to improved flavor, improved appearance, improved texture, and improved lubricity in reduced fat bakery products. Methods of making and using baking ingredients are also described.
claims:
1. A baking ingredient piece, the baking ingredient piece having a melting point between 0° C. and about 37° C., and comprising: a. about 1.5% to about 15% by weight thermo-reversible hydrocolloid; b. up to about 60% by weight fat; and c. about 40% to about 98% by weight water, wherein the baking ingredient piece is configured to be a fat replacement in a dough product.
2. The baking ingredient piece of claim 1, wherein the thermo-reversible hydrocolloid includes gelatin in an amount of from about 3% to about 10% by weight of the baking ingredient piece.
3. The baking ingredient piece of claim 1, further comprising starch in an amount of up to about 10%.
4. The baking ingredient piece of claim 1, wherein the baking ingredient piece has a melting point between about 20° C. and about 37° C.
5. The baking ingredient piece of claim 1, further comprising (i) a flavorant selected from the group consisting of bacon, lemon, vanilla and butter flavorants; (ii) a colorant; (iii) a water activity modifier comprising a salt or sugar; or (iv) a combination thereof.
6. The baking ingredient piece of claim 1, wherein the baking ingredient piece is frozen.
7. The b

title: Shelf stable food with flavor
abstract: Methods are disclosed for making a shelf stable food containing a flavorant having improved intensity over shelf life. Methods include applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces prior to combining the dried fruit pieces with a binder to form an aggregate. Shelf stable foods made according to the disclosed methods are also disclosed.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A method of making a shelf stable food, the method comprising: a. applying a powdered flavorant to a surface of dried fruit pieces to produce powder coated fruit pieces, the powder coated fruit pieces including the powdered flavorant in an amount of 0.1% to 20% by weight of the dried fruit pieces; b. combining the powder coated fruit pieces with a fluid binder to form an aggregate; and c. setting a structure of the fluid binder in the aggregate to form the shelf stable food including particulates and a set binder, the particulates including the dried fruit pieces having the powdered flavorant localized to the surface of the dried fruit pieces.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the powdered flavorant comprises an encapsulated flavorant.
3. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the step of applying the powdered flavorant to the surface of dried fruit pieces is performed during a delumping process.
4. The method of any of claims 1-3, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of greater than 130° F during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the fluid binder is at a temperature of less than 200° F during the step of combining the powdered coated fruit pieces with the fluid binder.
6. The method of any of claims 1-5, wherein the step of setting the structure of the fluid binder comp

title: Extruded puffed high insoluble fiber food and high total fiber pieces and methods of making
abstract: The present disclosure relates to low density, high fiber-containing ready-to-eat food pieces, compositions including such food pieces, and methods of making such food pieces. The food pieces include at least 35% and up to 50% by dry weight total fiber, an insoluble fiber content of at least 25% to about 40% by dry weight, and a soluble fiber content of about 5% to about 15% by dry weight. The food pieces consist essentially of bran, optionally a second insoluble fiber source, psyllium husk, and a starch ingredient, with a moisture content of up to 4% by weight. Compositions containing such high fiber food pieces and methods of making them are also described.
claims:
1. A ready-to-eat (RTE) puffed food piece having a bulk density of 100 to 200 g per 100 in3, the puffed food piece having a total fiber content of at least 32% to about 50% by dry weight of the puffed food piece, an insoluble fiber content of at least 25% to about 40% by dry weight of the puffed food piece, and a soluble fiber content of about 5% to about 15% by dry weight of the puffed food piece, the insoluble fiber content and the soluble fiber content being at a ratio of at least 2:1, the puffed food piece consisting essentially of: a. an amount of bran sufficient to provide insoluble fiber in an amount of at least 20% by dry weight of the puffed food piece; b. psyllium husk in an amount of about 5% to about 15% by dry weight of the puffed food piece; c. a starch ingredient having a starch content of at least 50% by dry weight of the starch ingredient, wherein the starch ingredient, the psyllium husk, and the bran contribute a total starch content in an amount of about 30% to about 65% by dry weight of the puffed food piece; and d. a moisture content of up to 4% by weight of the puffed food piece.

title: Contactless beverage dispensing methods
abstract: A method of selecting and dispensing a custom beverage in a contactless manner using a mobile electronic device. The method includes launching a microsite on the mobile electronic device. The method further includes receiving a beverage selection via the microsite on the mobile electronic device, and receiving a selection of a volume of the custom beverage to be dispensed via the microsite. The method further includes generating a QR code via the microsite, wherein the QR code corresponds to the beverage selection and the volume selection and displaying the QR code on a display of the mobile electronic device such that when the QR code is read by a reader of a beverage dispenser, the selected beverage is dispensed in the selected volume based on the QR code.
claims:
1. A method of dispensing a custom beverage from a beverage dispenser in a contactless manner, the method comprising:
displaying a QR code, by the beverage dispenser, wherein the QR code corresponds to a microsite for selecting a custom beverage;
after a mobile device reads the QR code and accesses the microsite, receiving a selection of a custom beverage and a volume of the custom beverage to be dispensed via the microsite;
generating, via the microsite, a QR code corresponding to the selected custom beverage and the selected volume;
reading the generated QR code displayed on the mobile device by a reader of the beverage dispenser;
displaying a pause icon on a user interface of the beverage dispenser, wherein the beverage dispenser is configured to pause dispensing of the beverage when the pause icon is selected; and
dispensing the selected custom beverage in the selected volume based on the generated QR code.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein receiving the selection of the custom beverage comprises receiving a selection of a type of beverage and receiving a selection of a flavoring.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein receiving the selection of the custom beverage comprises receiving a selection of a carbonation level of the beverage.
4. The method of claim 1, wher

title: Feed Roller with Raised Portions for Feeding Dough to Mold Roller
abstract: A feed roller is formed with a generally cylindrical outer surface having raised portions arranged in a pattern that extends circumferentially around the surface. The raised portions are formed in distinct shapes. Preferably the distinct shapes are chevron shapes that retain dough between successive chevron shapes. The roller preferably has an annular ridge which prevents dough from escaping axially off the edge of the roller. In use, dough is feed between the feed roller and a mold roller. Some of the dough is retained on the outer cylindrical surface of the feed roller to provide a smooth surface for inserting the rest of the dough in mold cavities located in the mold roller.
claims:
1. A feed roller comprising:
a main body forming a generally cylindrical outer surface of the feed roller having an end portion and extending in a longitudinal direction, the generally cylindrical outer surface having raised portions forming distinct shapes of a certain height, arranged in a pattern that extends circumferentially around the generally cylindrical outer surface and configured to retain some dough between the raised portions up to the certain height to transform the generally cylindrical outer surface into a smooth generally cylindrical outer surface.
2. The feed roller of claim 1, wherein the distinct shapes are chevron shapes, each chevron shape formed of two diagonal legs of raised portions meeting at a point and forming an angle.
3. The feed roller of claim 2, wherein the height ranges between 1 and 5 mm.
4. The feed roller of claim 3, wherein the height ranges between 3 and 3.6 mm.
5. The feed roller of claim 2, wherein the chevron shapes have a width ranging between 3 to 10 degrees along an arc on the cylindrical surface.
6. The feed roller of claim 2, wherein the chevron shapes have a width ranging between 5 and 15 mm.
7. The feed roller of claim 6, wherein the width ranges between 9 an

title: Gift box and gift display method
abstract: The present invention provides a gift box to display a gift resting on a product support tray slidably positioned within a main housing body and supported by at least one flexible belt member having first and second ends and a central portion, the first end and the second end are attached to a panel of the cover assembly, the panel is mounted to be movable relative to the main housing body, and the central portion supports the product support tray within the main housing body. With this structure, when the panel of the cover assembly is moved away from the main housing body, the at least one flexible strap member is pulled, thereby withdrawing a portion of the central portion of the at least one flexible strap member from within the main housing body and lifting the product support tray at least partially away from the main housing body for display.
claims:

主壳体本体，所述主壳体本体包括互连的前壁、后壁和相对的侧壁，这些壁共同地建立内部储藏空腔；
产品支撑托盘，所述产品支撑托盘包括基部和多个侧部，所述产品支撑托盘的尺寸被确定成滑动配合在所述主壳体本体的所述内部储藏空腔内；
盖组件，所述盖组件包括第一侧部面板和第二侧部面板以及第一顶部面板和第二顶部面板，其中所述第一侧部面板和第二侧部面板中的每一者包括下部子面板和上部子面板，下部子面板固定到所述主壳体本体，上部子面板铰接到所述下部子面板以及所述第一顶部面板和第二顶部面板中的对应一者，从而能够相对于所述主壳体本体枢转运动；以及
至少一个柔性带构件，所述至少一个柔性带构件具有第一端部和第二端部以及中央部分，所述第一端部和第二端部中的每一者附接到所述盖组件以便相对于所述主壳体本体运动，所述中央部分延伸进入所述内部储藏空腔并且在所述内部储藏空腔内支撑所述产品支撑托盘，其中所述盖组件和所述至少一个柔性带构件被构造成能够使得将所述盖组件的所述上部子面板以及第一顶部面板和第二顶部面板移离所述主壳体本体会拉动所述至少一个柔性带构件，由此将所述至少一个柔性带构件的一部分中央部分从所述主壳体本体内抽出，并且使所述产品支撑托盘相对于所述主壳体本体提升。

title: Auxiliary mechanism for pneumatic grinding machine
abstract: The utility model discloses an auxiliary mechanism for a pneumatic grinding machine, which comprises a bottom supporting column, a middle supporting column mounted at the top of the bottom supporting column, a fixing disc connected to the top of the middle supporting column, an air pump arranged at the top of one side of the bottom supporting column, a base frame fixedly connected to one side of the top of the fixing disc, a cross beam hinged to the top of the base frame, and a limiting mechanism arranged in the middle of the cross beam. A second mounting seat is mounted on the surface of the fixing disc, a first mounting seat is mounted on one side of the bottom of the cross beam, the bottom of the air cylinder is rotationally connected with the second mounting seat, the output end of the air cylinder is rotationally connected with the first mounting seat, a traction chain is connected to the bottom of the limiting mechanism, and a fixing strip is connected to the bottom of the traction chain; according to the auxiliary mechanism for the pneumatic grinding machine, the whole auxiliary mechanism can assist in jacking up a grinding roller, the grinding roller of the grinding machine can be conveniently put in and taken out, and the working efficiency is improved.
assignee: 青岛金木石实验室科技有限公司

title: Blessing lamp module and blessing lamp device
abstract: The present disclosure illustrates a blessing lamp module, comprising: a plurality of blessing lamps, a power line, a power receiving end, a signal line, and a signal receiving end. The blessing lanterns are arranged in at least one row. The power line is electrically connected to the blessing lamps. The power receiving end is arranged at one end of the power line. The signal line is independent of the power line and is electrically connected to the blessing lamp. The signal receiving end is independent of the power receiving end and is arranged at one end of the signal line. The signal receiving end is a wireless signal receiving module, thereby realizing wireless transmission of control signals. In addition, the modular design and the design in which the signal receiving end is independent to the power receiving end can make it easy for on-site craftsmen to assemble the blessing lamp modules to form the blessing lamp device and reduce complex wiring.
claims:
1. 一種祈福燈模組，包括： 複數個祈福燈，以至少一列的方式排列； 一電力線路，電性連接該複數個祈福燈； 一電力接收端，設置於該電力線路的一端； 一信號線路，獨立於該電力線路，電性連接該複數個祈福燈；以及 一信號接收端，獨立於該電力接收端，設置於該信號線路的一端； 其中該信號接收端為一無線信號接收模組。
2. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，其中該無線信號接收模組為一藍芽信號接收模組、一WiFi信號接收模組、一Zigbee信號接收模組、一無線通用序列匯流排信號接收模組、一近場信號接收模組或一LoRa信號接收模組。
3. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，其中該電力接收端為包括至少一第一磁吸元件與至少一電源端子的一電源連接器，或為一無線電力接收模組，以及該無線電力接收模組為一短距無線電力接收模組、一近場無線電力接收模組、一紅外線電力轉換模組或一微波電力轉換模組。
4. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，其中該複數個祈福燈以複數列的方式排列。
5. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，其中該複數個祈福燈之兩者的尺寸及/或類型彼此不相同。
6. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，更包括： 一可撓性框體，用於供該複數個祈福燈、該電力接收端與該信號接收端設置於其上。
7. 如請求項6所述的祈福燈模組，其中該可撓性框體的一第一側設有至少一第一固定件，以及該可撓性框體之相對於該第一側的一第二側設有至少一第二固定件。
8. 如請求項6所述的祈福燈模組，其中該可撓性框體更具有至少一中空空間，用於接收該電力線路及該信號線路。
9. 如請求項1所述的祈福燈模組，其中每一個該祈福燈包括： 一信號接收模組，電性連接該信號線路； 一控制器模組，電性連接該信號接收模組； 至少一照明單元，電性連接該控制器模組； 至少一顯示單元，電性連接該控制器模組；以及 一電源模組，電性連接該電力線路、該控制器模組、該照明單元以及該顯示單元。
10. 一種祈福燈裝置，包括： 複數個祈福燈模組，其每一者為如請求項1～9其中任一項所述的祈福燈模組，其中該祈福燈裝置由該複數個祈福燈模組組合而成，而成為一祈福燈牆、一祈福燈柱或一祈福燈櫃。

title: Flexible screen U-shaped jig capable of adjusting shape of bending area

2.根据权利要求1所述的可调节弯折区形态的柔性屏U型治具，其特征在于，所述调节旋钮(7)穿过底座(1)俯视面的中点。

6.根据权利要求1所述的可调节弯折区形态的柔性屏U型治具，其特征在于，所述同步齿轮(4)固定连接有连接杆(41)，所述连接杆(41)固定连接于第一翻转板(2)及第二翻转板(3)的上表面。

title: Single tank carbonation for carbonated soft drink equipment
abstract: A carbonated beverage dispenser includes a tank to store carbonated water, a carbon dioxide source, and a release valve configured to release gas from the tank. The release valve may be actuated to mix the contents of the tank to increase the temperature homogeny and carbon dioxide homogeny in the tank. The tank may include sensors to monitor the temperature of the water and the amount of carbon dioxide dissolved therein.
claims:
1. A method of dispensing a carbonated beverage from a carbonated beverage dispensing system, the method comprising:
determining a concentration of carbon dioxide dissolved in water contained in a beverage dispensing system at a first time;
opening a release valve configured to release gas from the beverage dispensing system to agitate the water;
monitoring the concentration of carbon dioxide dissolved in water while the release valve is opened;
closing the release valve when the concentration of carbon dioxide dissolved in the water reaches a threshold concentration; and
dispensing the water with carbon dioxide dissolved therein.
2. The method of claim 1, further comprising the step of adding carbon dioxide to the carbonated beverage dispensing system from a carbon dioxide source.
3. The method of claim 1, further comprising the step of adding water to the carbonated beverage dispensing system.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein no agitation fan is used to agitate the water.
5. The method of claim 1, further comprising closing the release valve after an actuation period.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein

title: Plant-based protein beverage
claims:
1. A beverage comprising: a. lecithin; and b. one or more oilseed proteins; wherein the beverage has one or both of the following: i. a protein solubility of at least 80%; and ii. a viscosity of less than 250 cP as measured at about 20 °C and 60 RPM.
2. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the lecithin is plant-derived lecithin.
3.     The beverage of claim 1 or 2, wherein the lecithin is from sunflower.
4.     The beverage of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the lecithin is native.
5.     The beverage of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the lecithin is hydrolyzed.
6.     The beverage of any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the one or more oilseed proteins is selected from the group consisting of canola protein, hemp seed protein, pumpkin seed protein, sesame seed protein, sunflower seed protein, chia seed protein, cotton seed protein, flax seed protein, and a mixture thereof.
7. The beverage of any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the one or more oilseed proteins is canola protein.
8. The beverage of any one of claims 1 to 7, further comprising

title: Processing system for handling pieces of product
abstract: A processing system for packaging pieces of product utilizing high-speed sorting includes an infeed conveyor for supplying the pieces of food product and a linear motor sorter is connected to the infeed conveyor. The sorter includes a main conveyor with several lanes for moving the pieces of food product, with one of the lanes being a first lane which receives the pieces of food product. The sorter also has one or more diverters for diverting determined ones of the pieces of food product from the first lane to at least one other lane. The sorter includes a linear motor and carts connected to the linear motor and is configured to move the pieces of food between the lanes.
claims:
CLAIMS
1. A processing system for sorting pieces of product comprising: an infeed conveyor for supplying the pieces of product; a sorter connected to the infeed conveyor and including a main conveyor having several lanes for moving the pieces of product, one of the several lanes being a first lane receiving the pieces of product and a diverter for diverting the pieces of product between the several lanes, said diverter including a linear motor and carts connected to the linear motor configured to move the pieces of product between the several lanes; and an output conveyor receiving the pieces of product from the sorter.
2. The processing system according to claim 1, wherein the main conveyor is arranged along a longitudinal axis and the diverter is located above the main conveyor and extends from a first lane of the several lanes to a second lane of the several lanes.
3. The processing system according to claim 2, further comprising a control system connected to the sorter and configured to have the carts engage the pieces of product, move in a direction angled to infeed conveyor to move the pieces of product between the several lanes.
4. The processing system according to claim 3, wherein the diverter constitutes a first diverter and the sorter further includes a second diverter located above the
main conveyor and extending from the first lane of the several lanes to a third lane of the several lanes.
5. The pro

title: Treated soybean oil
abstract: Methods of treating edible oils, such as soybean oil, to reduce furan fatty acid content to produce edible oils that are more resistant to off-flavor development when used in food applications are described. Some methods include heat treatment of an edible oil in the presence of oxygen followed by deodorization to produce a heat-treated oil. Some methods includes treating an edible oil under conditions that promote conversion of furan fatty acids to 3-methyl-2,4-nonanedione (3MND) and/or 3-hydroxy-3MND (3H-3MND) in the presence of activated carbon to produce a carbon-treated oil. Also described are treated edible oils and foods that include treated edible oils.
claims:
1. A method of making a carbon-treated soybean oil, comprising: a. providing a soybean oil; b. treating the soybean oil under conditions that promote conversion of furan fatty acids to 3MND in the presence of an amount of activated carbon to produce a carbon-treated soybean oil; and c. collecting the carbon-treated soybean oil, wherein the carbon-treated soybean oil has a reduced furan fatty acids content relative to the soybean oil.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein, the conditions comprise maintaining the soybean oil at a temperature of about 90° F (32.2° C) to about 120° F (48.9° C) in the presence of oxygen.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the conditions comprise oil movement.
4. The method of any of claims 1-3, wherein the amount of activated carbon is at least 6% by weight of the soybean oil.
5. The method of any of claims 1-4, wherein the carbon-treated soybean oil has a furan fatty acids content is less than 100 mg/kg.
6. The method of any of claims 1-5, wherein the soybean oil comprises a high oleic soybean oil.
7. The method of any of claims 1-6, wherein the soybean oil is bleached or deodorized.
8. A carbon-treated soybean oil having a furan fatty acids content of less tha

title: Container for dosing a flowable solid
abstract: Embodiments are directed to a container for dispensing equal doses of a flowable solid. The container may include a body defining an interior volume including a storage volume, an outlet passage, and a dosing chamber in communication with the storage volume and the outlet passage. The container may include a closure that has a lid and a plunger. The lid may be rotatably coupled to the body such that it rotates about a first axis from a closed position to an open position. The plunger may be rotatably coupled to the lid and configured to seal the dosing chamber. The container may be configured to dispense a dose of the flowable solid when the plunger is in the unsealed position and the container is at least partially inverted, and each dose may have an equal volume.
claims:
1. A container for dispensing a flowable solid, the container comprising:
a body defining an interior volume, the interior volume comprising:
a storage volume;
an outlet passage;
a dosing chamber in communication with the storage volume and the outlet passage; and
a closure for sealing the container, the closure comprising:
a lid rotatably coupled to the body, wherein the lid is configured to rotate about a first axis from a closed position to an open position; and
a plunger rotatably coupled to the lid within a top quarter of a height of the container, wherein the plunger is configured to move in a direction of a second axis from a sealed position to an unsealed position when the lid is rotated about the first axis, wherein the second axis is perpendicular to the first axis, and wherein the plunger extends within the outlet passage to form a seal within a bottom quarter of the height of the container when the plunger is in the sealed position,
wherein the container is configured to dispense a dose of the flowable solid when the plunger is in the unsealed position and the container is at least partially inverted, and wherein each dose has an equal volume.
2. The container of claim 1, further comprising a partition separating the storage volume from the outlet passage.
3. The con

title: Defrosting system for a cold plate and method of defrosting a cold plate
abstract: A cooler including a cabinet defining an interior volume for storing a perishable product. A cold plate is disposed within the cabinet, and the cold plate is configured to absorb heat within the cabinet. The cooler further includes a defrosting system that includes a sensor configured to detect a presence of frost on a surface of the cold plate, a heating element affixed to the surface of the cold plate that is configured to at least partially melt frost on the cold plate, and a control unit configured to selectively activate and deactivate the heating element when the presence of frost is determined by the sensor.
claims:
1. A cooler, comprising:
a cabinet comprising a door and a plurality of interior walls defining a storage area for storing a perishable product, the door configured to move between an open position and a closed position;
a cold plate disposed on a first interior wall of the plurality of interior walls of the cabinet, wherein the cold plate comprises a jacket enclosing a phase-change material and a tube configured to circulate a refrigerant, wherein the cold plate is configured to absorb heat within the cabinet; and
a defrosting system comprising:
a sensor configured to detect a presence of frost on a surface of the cold plate;
a heating element affixed to the surface of the cold plate configured to at least partially melt frost on the cold plate; and
a control unit configured to selectively activate and deactivate the heating element when the presence of frost is detected by the sensor and configured to activate the heating element when the cold plate absorbs heat within the cabinet,
wherein the sensor is arranged on the surface of the cold plate, and the surface is an interior facing surface of the first interior wall of the storage area,
wherein the door comprises a transparent portion such that the cold plate and heating element are visible through the transparent portion when the door is in the closed position,
wherein the heating element comprises a heating wire arranged in a serpentine p

title: Automated sensing and control system with data analytics and artificial intelligence
abstract: The present disclosure relates to training a machine learning model based on a dataset comprising sales volume, product distribution logistics records, and product manufacturing data. The present disclosure further relate to extracting from the model a prediction of at least one item selected from a group consisting of future sales volume of an existing product, consumer interest for new products, and failure rates for product distribution equipment.

title: Rolled Food Product and Method of Producing
abstract: Rolled food products are produced by cutting a dough sheet to form a roll sheet having a continuous pattern. The pattern is comprised of an asymmetrical repeat unit. The roll sheet is transported in a first direction with a conveyor system, and the roll sheet is rolled in a second direction to form a continuous roll. The second direction is not parallel to the first direction. The continuous roll is cut to form a plurality of rolls. Each of the plurality of rolls is asymmetrical.

title: Carbonation reduction systems and methods
abstract: A beverage dispensing valve may include an inlet to receive carbonated water, a nozzle shell, and an outlet downstream of the nozzle shell configured to dispense a finished beverage. The nozzle shell may include an aperture open to ambient pressure environment. A method for dispensing a beverage may include flowing carbonated water through an inlet of a beverage dispensing valve, lowering the pressure of the carbonated water sufficient to promote carbon dioxide nucleation, flowing the carbonated water through a chamber vented to environment such that a portion of carbon dioxide nucleated is off-gassed, and introducing a beverage ingredient when the carbonated water reaches a sufficiently low carbonation level. A beverage dispensing nozzle may include an inlet configured to receive carbonated water from a beverage dispensing valve, a nozzle shell including an aperture open to ambient pressure environment, and an outlet downstream of the nozzle shell configured to dispense a finished beverage.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing valve, comprising:
an inlet configured to receive carbonated water;
a diffuser disposed downstream of the inlet, wherein the diffuser comprises a plurality of openings configured to allow the carbonated water to pass through the diffuser;
a nozzle shell, the nozzle shell comprising:
a nozzle shell chamber configured to receive carbonated water from the inlet after passing through the diffuser;
an aperture open to ambient pressure environment, wherein the aperture is disposed upstream of the nozzle shell chamber;
a conduit passing through the nozzle shell chamber and the diffuser configured to dispense a flow of syrup into the carbonated water that has passed through the nozzle shell chamber to form a finished beverage; and
an outlet downstream of the nozzle shell configured to dispense a finished beverage.
2. The valve of claim 1, wherein the pressure drop between the inlet and nozzle shell chamber is between about 5 gage pounds per square inch (-34,474 Pa) and 45 gage pounds per square inch (-310,264 Pa).
3. The valve of claim 1 or 2, wherein the nozzle shell chamber is configured to allow carbon dioxide to vent to ambient pressure environment through the aperture, and wherein the aperture is disposed between the inlet and the outlet.

title: Heat resistant chocolate
abstract: A fat based confection which is a chocolate composition comprising a polyol having a boiling point of 105°C or greater and at least one other thermal structuring component; wherein the polyol comprises glycerin and the thermal structuring component comprises dextrose monohydrate.
claims:
1. A fat based confection which is a chocolate composition comprising a polyol having a boiling point of 105°C or greater and at least one other thermal structuring component; wherein the polyol comprises glycerin and the thermal structuring component comprises dextrose monohydrate.
2. The fat based confection of claim 1, wherein the fat based confection comprises less than 0.9 wt% of water.
3. The fat based confection of claim 1, wherein the fat based confection comprises no added free water.
4. The fat based confection of any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fat based confection does not comprise lactose.
5. The fat based confection of any one of the preceding claims, further comprising an emulsifier.
6. The fat based confection of claim 5, wherein the emulsifier comprises lecithin.
7. The fat based confection of any one of the preceding claims, which further comprises sucrose.
8. A method of making a fat based confection which is a chocolate composition, the method comprising mixing, in any order, a polyol having a boiling point of 105°C or greater and at least one other thermal structuring component, where

title: Package for Hard Taco Shell and Method for Packaging the Hard Taco Shell
abstract: A hard taco shell, having a plasticizing agent applied to a targeted region of a base or spine portion of the hard taco shell and lower sections of taco shell sidewalls to softening the targeted region such that, when the taco shell is bitten, the softened targeted region has some hinging flexibility or pliability which reduces the potential for any crack propagation, is hermetically sealed in a package body formed from a material establishing a barrier to the transmission of oxygen into an interior of the package body. With this arrangement, premature drying and cracking of the agent treated hard taco shell is prevented.
claims:
1. A package of hard taco shells comprising:
an outer package body establishing a package interior, said outer package body being hermetically sealed and formed from a material establishing a barrier to the transmission of oxygen into the package interior; and
at least one hard shell taco located in the package interior, with the at least one hard taco shell including a first hard shell sidewall, a second hard shell sidewall, and a base portion connecting the first and second hard shell sidewalls, wherein the base portion includes a softened, pliable spine section hingedly connecting the first and second hard shell sidewalls.
2. The package of claim 1, wherein a plurality of hard taco shells are located in the package interior.
3. The package of claim 2, wherein the plurality of hard taco shells are nested within the package interior.
4. The package of claim 1, wherein the spine section is provided with a plasticizing agent.
5. The package of claim 4, wherein the plasticizing agent is glycerin.
6. The package of claim 5, wherein the spine section is further provided with a migration limiting agent.
7. The package of claim 6, wherein the migration lim

title: Feline food composition
abstract: Nutritionally complete feline food compositions comprising EPA/DHA and carbohydrates are disclosed herein. These nutritionally complete feline food compositions can be used in dry or wet food composition. The compositions can be used to for preventing and/or treating cardiac hypertrophy in feline animals, such as cats.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A nutritionally complete feline food composition comprising eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and/or docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and carbohydrates, for use for preventing or treating a hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, wherein the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a dry food composition comprising: (i) EPA and/or DHA in an amount of at least 0.5 gram per megacalorie (g/Mcal); (ii) Nitrogen Free Extract in an amount of no more than 60 g/Mcal; and (iii) starch in an amount of no more than 50 g/Mcal, wherein g/Mcal refers to a weight amount of the component by unit of Metabolizable Energy (ME) according to the European Standard EN 16967 (ICS.65.120) dated July 2017.
2. A nutritionally complete feline food composition comprising eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and/or docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and carbohydrates, for use for preventing or treating a hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, wherein the nutritionally complete feline food composition consists of a wet food composition comprising: (i) EPA and/or DHA in an amount of at least 1.0 grams per megacalorie (g/Mcal); (ii) Nitrogen Free Extract in an amount of no more than 35 g/Mcal; and (iii) starch in an amount of no more than 20 g/Mcal, wherein g/Mcal refers to a weight amount of the component by unit of Metabolizable Energy (ME) according to the European Standard EN 16967 (ICS.65.120) dated July 2017.
3. The nutritionally complete feline food composition for use according to claim 1, wherein the dry food co

title: Method for preparing rebaudioside C by enzyme method
abstract: The invention provides a method for preparing rebaudioside C by an enzyme method, which comprises the following steps: taking rubus suavissimus glycoside or dulcoside A as a substrate, and enabling the substrate to react in the presence of a glycosyl donor under the catalysis of a recombinant cell containing UDP-glycosyl transferase and/or the UDP-glycosyl transferase prepared by the recombinant cell to generate the rebaudioside C.

title: Low-moisture pet food compositions
abstract: Low-moisture pet food compositions are provided. Such compositions can have multiple components including inner and outer components. The inner component can include a relatively soft mixture (e.g., softer than the outer component) and the outer component can include a relatively hard mixture providing for pet food compositions having a dual texture. The outer component has a low total moisture content and partially covers the inner component.
claims:
1. A multi-component pet food composition comprising:
an inner component comprising:
one or more fat sources in an amount of from about 0% to about 60% by weight;
one or more protein sources in an amount of from about 0% to about 40% by weight; and
one or more carbohydrate sources in an amount of from about 15% to about 70% by weight, based on the total weight of the inner component; and
an outer component partially covering the inner component, the outer component having a total moisture content of from about 1% to about 15% and a water activity of less than about 0.75.
2. The multi-component pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the outer component has a total moisture content of from about 6% to about 10%.
3. The multi-component pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the inner component and the outer component are present in a ratio of from about 7:3 to about 3:7.
4. The multi-component pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the inner component is exposed on at least two surfaces of the pet food composition.
5. The multi-component pet food composition of claim 1, wherein the pet food composition has a water activity of less than about 0.65.

title: Confectionary with improved opacity
abstract: A confectionary that contains 3.0% to 3.5% of a short fiber length cellulose is described. The confectionary maintains a good opacity and texture after heating and good visual and textural stability over shelf life or at least one freeze/thaw cycle. A confectionary can typically have a relatively high moisture content, relatively low fat content, and relatively low non-fat solids content and retain the desired stability, opacity, and texture attributes. In some cases, a confectionary can exclude certain ingredients that consumers prefer to avoid.
claims:
1. A confectionary, comprising: a. cellulose in an amount of 3.0% to 3.5% by weight of the confectionary, the cellulose having an average fiber length of 20 μm to 25 μm; b. a fat content of 10% to 20% by weight of the confectionary, with at least 75% of the fat content being provided by a structuring fat having a melting point above room temperature; c. a water content of 45% to 55% by weight of the confectionary; d. a non-fat total solids content of 35% to 45% by weight of the confectionary; and e. 0% to less than 0.01% by weight of the confectionary titanium dioxide and 0% to less than 0.01% by weight of the confectionary calcium carbonate, wherein the confectionary is a frosting, an icing, or a filling.
2. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the amount of cellulose is 3.2% to 3.4% by weight of the confectionary.
3. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the cellulose has a particle size where least 95% of the particles pass through a No. 400 US Mesh Size sieve.
4. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the non-fat solids content comprises sweet whey solids in an amount of 3% to 4.5% by weight of the confectionary.
5. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the confectionary has a sugar content of less than 40% by weight of the confectionary.
6. The confectionary of claim 1, wherein the confectionary has a viscosity of at least 40,000

title: Flavor composition, food product comprising same, and method for increasing taste intensity of thick taste in food product
abstract: The present application discloses a flavor composition and a food product comprising the flavor composition, the flavor composition comprising an oligopeptide, the oligopeptide being selected from the group consisting of Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Thr-Glu-Asp-Gln-Ala, Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Thr-Glu-Asp-Gln-Ala, and any combination thereof, the oligopeptide being selected from the group consisting of Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-Asp-Gln-Gln-Gln, Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Gln-Gln-Gln-Gln-Gln-Gln-Gln and wherein the oligopeptide binding to a calcium-sensitive receptor imparts a thick taste to the companion animal. Methods of increasing the taste intensity of a thick taste in a food product are also disclosed. The flavor composition disclosed by the invention contains the oligopeptide, so that the taste intensity of the thick taste in the food can be improved.
claims:
1.一种风味组合物，所述风味组合物包括寡肽，其中所述寡肽选自由Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Thr-Glu-Asp-Gln、Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Thr-Glu-Asp-Gln-Ala、Glu-Ile-Val-Pro-Asn-pSer-Ala-Glu-Glu、Asp-Ile-Gly-pSer-Glu-pSer-Thr-Glu-Asp-Gln-Ala及它们的任意组合所组成的组中，并且
其中所述寡肽结合钙敏感受体向伴侣动物赋予厚味。
2.根据权利要求1所述的风味组合物，其中所述伴侣动物是猫或狗。
3.根据权利要求1或2所述的风味组合物，其中所述伴侣动物是猫。
4.根据前述权利要求1或2所述的风味组合物，其中所述寡肽在食品的制造过程中产生。
5.根据前述权利要求3所述的风味组合物，其中所述寡肽在食品的制造过程中产生。
6.一种食品，所述食品包含根据权利要求1-5中任一项所述的风味组合物，其中所述风味组合物以有效增加所述食品的厚味的量存在。
7.一种食品，所述食品包含根据权利要求1-5中任一项所述的风味组合物，其中所述风味组合物以有效增加食品的适口性的量存在。
8.根据权利要求6或7所述的食品，其中所述风味组合物在食品中以1nM至1M、1μM至1M、0.0001％至10％w/w、0.001％至5％w/w、或0.01％至1％w/w的浓度存在。
9.根据权利要求6或7所述的食品，其中所述食品包括宠物食品。

12.根据权利要求10所述的食品，其中所述宠物食品是猫科动物宠物食品或犬科动物宠物食品。
13.根据权利要求9所述的食品，其中所述宠物食品是湿宠物食品。
14.根据权利要求10所述的食品，其中所述宠物食品是湿宠物食品。
15.根据权利要求9所述的食品，其中所述宠物食品是干宠物食品。
16.根据权利要求10所述的食品，其中所述宠物食品是干宠物食品。
17.根据权利要求6或7所述的食品，其中所述风味组合物在所述食品的制造过程中产生。
18.根据权利要求8所述的食品，其中所述风味组合物在所述食品的制造过程中产生。
19.根据权利要求9所述的食品，其中所述风味组合物在所述食品的制造过程中产生。
20.根据权利要求10所述的食品，其中所述风味组合物在所述食品的制造过程中产生。

title: Constant-temperature heating reaction equipment for coating medical phosphorylcholine coating
abstract: The utility model discloses constant-temperature heating reaction equipment for coating a medical phosphorylcholine coating, which comprises a reaction equipment main body, the reaction equipment main body comprises a reaction tank, an inlet, a motor, a discharge pipe, a reaction stirrer and a constant-temperature heater, the inlet is arranged at one side of the top end of the reaction tank, and the motor is arranged at the other side of the top end of the reaction tank; the motor is fixedly mounted at the top end of the reaction tank through a bolt; by designing a heat insulation protection mechanism, when the reaction equipment main body processes and reacts a medical phosphorylcholine coating, a heat insulation protection cover is fixedly mounted on the outer surface of a reaction tank, and when the reaction equipment main body heats the outer surface, a heat insulation groove and the heat insulation protection cover are used for heat insulation protection; and when excessive heat is collected in the heat insulation groove, the heat is discharged to the outside through the heat discharge holes, an operator is not prone to danger when touching, and meanwhile when the reaction operation outer surface of the reaction equipment body is impacted by an external object, the heat insulation protective cover can be conveniently used for protecting the outer surface.
claims:
1.一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，包括反应设备主体（100），所述反应设备主体（100）包括反应罐（101）、进口（102）、电机（103）、出料管（104）、反应搅拌器（105）与恒温加热器（106），所述进口（102）设置在反应罐（101）顶端的一侧，所述电机（103）通过螺栓固定安装在反应罐（101）的顶端，所述反应搅拌器（105）转动连接在电机（103）的端部位于反应罐（101）的内部，所述恒温加热器（106）设置在反应罐（101）的内部边缘处，所述出料管（104）设置在反应罐（101）的底端，其特征在于：所述反应设备主体（100）上还设置有：
隔热防护机构，且该隔热防护机构包括隔热防护组件、旋转连接组件与固定安装组件，所述隔热防护组件设置在反应罐（101）的外表面，所述旋转连接组件设置在隔热防护组件的底端，所述固定安装组件设置在隔热防护组件的顶端；
排料机构，且该排料机构包括推动组件与引流组件，所述推动组件设置在反应搅拌器（105）的底端接触于反应罐（101）的内部底端，所述引流组件设置在反应罐（101）的内部底端中间位置处。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，其特征在于：所述隔热防护组件包括设置在反应罐（101）外表面的隔热防护罩（1011），所述隔热防护罩（1011）的内表面与反应罐（101）的外表面连接处形成隔热槽（1013），所述隔热防护罩（1011）的外表面两端均开设有排热孔（1012）。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，其特征在于：所述反应罐（101）贯穿于隔热防护罩（1011）的内部，且所述排热孔（1012）与隔热防护罩（1011）为一体式结构。
4.根据权利要求2所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，其特征在于：所述旋转连接组件包括设置在隔热防护罩（1011）底端的内螺纹环（1014），所述反应罐（101）的外表面底端开设有外螺纹结构（1017），所述隔热防护罩（1011）的底端与反应罐（101）的底端表面通过所述内螺纹环（1014）与所述外螺纹结构（1017）旋转固定连接。
5.根据权利要求2所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，其特征在于：所述固定安装组件包括旋转连接在隔热防护罩（1011）顶端边缘处的固定螺栓（1016），所述反应罐（101）的外表面顶端开设有内螺纹孔（1015），且所述隔热防护罩（1011）的顶端与反应罐（101）的外表面顶端通过所述固定螺栓（1016）与所述内螺纹孔（1015）旋转固定连接。
6.根据权利要求1所述的一种医用磷酸胆碱涂层涂覆用恒温加热反应设备，其特征在于：所述推动组件包括通过螺钉固定安装在反应搅拌器（105）底端的固定环（1045），所述固定环（1045）的一侧焊接固定有连接杆（1043），所述连接杆（1043）的下表面设置有推板（1044），所述推板（1044）的下表面与反应罐（101）的内部
assignee: 苏州银炙新材料科技有限公司

title: Metagenomic filtering and using the microbial signatures to authenticate food raw materials
Composition comprising rebaudioside j
abstract: To provide a method for modifying functional attributes of sweetener in a food product.SOLUTION: A method comprises adding rebaudioside J to a food product in a sufficient amount to achieve rebaudioside J of modification concentration in the food product, and the rebaudioside J is present in an amount that is less than taste recognition threshold concentration of the rebaudioside J. It is preferable that the sweetener is rebaudioside A.SELECTED DRAWING: None
claims:

約８５重量パーセントよりも高い純度を有する単離レバウディオサイドＪ。

約９９重量パーセントよりも高い純度を有する、請求項１に記載の単離レバウディオサイドＪ。

約９９．９重量パーセントよりも高い純度を有する、請求項１に記載の単離レバウディオサイドＪ。

前記レバウディオサイドＪは、前記甘味料組成物の少なくとも９０重量パーセントを構成する、請求項７に記載の甘味料組成物。

香味

title: Mobile vending machine
abstract: Mobile vending machines for storing and dispensing products to consumers at various locations. A mobile vending machine may include a product storage system, a user interface, a powertrain system, and a control unit. A consumer may view a list of products in the mobile vending machine using a mobile device, such as a smart phone. The consumer may summon the mobile vending machine to a location using the mobile device, and the mobile vending machine may automatically complete a transaction with the consumer, where the consumer receives a product from the mobile vending machine. The control unit may enable the mobile vending machine to autonomously travel to the location of the consumer.
claims:
1.     A method of vending a product from a mobile vending machine, the method comprising:
receiving, from a mobile device of a consumer, a location for performing a transaction; automatically maneuvering the mobile vending machine to the location received from the mobile device;
detecting a biometric characteristic of the consumer by the mobile vending machine; identifying the consumer based on the detected biometric characteristic;
providing access to a product compartment of the mobile vending machine after identifying the consumer;
detecting removal of a product from the product compartment by a product sensor; and receiving a payment for the removed product as detected by the product sensor.
2.     The method of claim 1, wherein the location is a location of the mobile device.
3.     The method of claim 1, wherein the biometric characteristic comprises a face of the
consumer.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the biometric characteristic comprises a fingerprint of the consumer.
5. The method of claim 1, further comprising accessing an account of the consumer based on the detected biometric characteristic.</

title: High-frequency electromagnetic shielding film performance detection device with good conductivity
assignee: 火星新材料科技(深圳)有限公司

title: Automatic vending machine
abstract: To provide an automatic vending machine having means for specifically handling a commodity in the event of payment error even when a commodity is properly taken out from a commodity accommodation unit.SOLUTION: Provided is an automatic vending machine 100 comprising: a commodity accommodation unit 30; a commodity selection button 13; a commodity outlet 12; an automatic opening/closing shutter 14 for shuttering the commodity outlet 12 for locking as a base state; a payment unit 50; an operation control unit 70; and an unpaid commodity storage 90 for storing a commodity 20 taken out from the commodity accommodation unit 30 when payment at the payment unit 50 is not completed. The operation control unit 70 executes a process for unlocking the automatic opening/closing shutter 14 and opening the commodity outlet 12 when payment is completed and a process for returning to the base state, executes a process for storing the commodity 20 in the unpaid commodity storage 90 in the event of payment failure, and when the commodity 20 selected by the commodity selection button 13 is the commodity 20 stored in the unpaid commodity storage 90, executes a commodity-in-storage sale process for sending it out to the commodity outlet 12.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
claims:
【請求項1】
商品が収容された複数の商品収容部と、
商品選択ボタンと、
前記商品選択ボタンにより選択された前記商品を取り出しする商品取出口と、
前記商品取出口に取り付けられていて、前記商品取出口を閉塞したロック状態を基本状態とする自動開閉シャッタと、
決済部と、
自動販売機の全体動作を制御する動作制御部と、
前記決済部において決済が完了しなかった場合に、前記商品収容部から取り出された前記商品を収納する決済未完遂商品収納庫と、を具備し、
前記動作制御部は、
前記決済部において決済が完了した場合に、前記商品取出口から前記商品を取り出せるように前記自動開閉シャッタのロックを解除して、前記商品取出口を開口する処理と、前記商品取出口から前記商品が取り出された後、または、予め設定されたロック解除時間の経過後に前記自動開閉シャッタを前記基本状態にする処理と、を実行し、
前記決済部において決済が完了しなかった場合に、前記商品を前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収納させる決済未完遂商品収納処理を実行し、
前記商品選択ボタンにより選択された前記商品が前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収容されている前記商品である場合に、前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収容されている前記商品を前記商品取出口に送り出しする収納庫商品販売処理を実行することを特徴とする自動販売機。
【請求項2】
前記商品収容部に収容されている前記商品と、前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収容されている前記商品の優先販売順序が予め記憶部に記憶されており、
前記動作制御部は、前記優先販売順序に基づいて前記収納庫商品販売処理を実行することを特徴とする請求項１記載の自動販売機。
【請求項3】
前記決済未完遂商品収納庫は、各々に識別子が設定された状態で複数設けられており、
前記動作制御部は、前記決済未完遂商品収納処理の実行時以降に前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収納された前記商品について、少なくとも商品名を前記決済未完遂商品収納庫の前記識別子と紐づけした状態で記憶部に収納庫商品データとして記憶させる収納庫商品データ記憶処理をさらに実行し、
前記収納庫商品販売処理は、
前記商品選択ボタンにより選択された前記商品が前記収納庫商品データに対応する前記商品と一致した場合、前記決済未完遂商品収納庫に収納された前記商品を前記商品取出口に送り出しすることを特徴とする請求項１または２記載の自動販売機。
