1. A food, comprising:
a. nut butter in an amount of at least 50% by weight of the food;
b. at least 25% protein by weight of the food, the protein including a powdered
protein ingredient contributing at least 12% protein by weight of the food;
c. a stabilizing fat in an amount of about 10% to about 20% by weight of the food;
d. a powdered food ingredient in an amount of about 8% to about 25% by weight
of the food;
e. a differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) profile having a stabilizing fat

title: Extruded puffed high soluble fiber food and high total fiber pieces and methods of making
abstract: The present disclosure relates to low density, high fiber-containing ready-to-eat food pieces, compositions including such food pieces, and methods of making such food pieces. The food pieces include at least 40% and up to 95% by dry weight high molecular weight soluble fiber, and include 25% or less net carbohydrate content on a dry weight basis. Food pieces can optionally contain an insoluble fiber content of up to about 35% by dry weight, up to 25% of a protein ingredient, and/or total other ingredients in an amount of up to 8% by dry weight.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A low-density base food piece, comprising: a. a soluble fiber ingredient contributing high molecular weight (HMW) soluble fiber in an amount of 40% to about 95% by dry weight of the food piece, the HMW soluble fiber having: i. an average degree of polymerization (DP) at least 20; or ii. an average dextrose equivalent (DE) of less than 4; b. a balance by dry weight comprising: i. an insoluble fiber ingredient contributing insoluble fiber in an amount of about 0% to about 35% by dry weight of the food piece; ii. a protein ingredient in an amount of 0% to 25% by dry weight of the food piece; iii. a net carbohydrate content of 0% to 25% by dry weight of the food piece; and iv. total other ingredients in an amount of 0% to 8% by dry weight of the food piece; and c. a moisture content of less than 5% by weight of the food piece.
2. The food piece of claim 1, wherein the insoluble fiber ingredient comprises a bran.
3. The food piece of claim 1 or 2, wherein the HMW soluble fiber has an average DE of about 1 to about 2.
4. The food piece of any one of claims 1-3, wherein the HMW soluble fiber comprises a resistant maltodextrin, soluble corn fiber, and/or inulin.
5. The food piece of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the other ingredients comprise:

title: Pneumatic grinding machine with improved structure
abstract: The pneumatic grinding machine with the improved structure comprises a grinding machine base, a carrying plate is arranged on one side of the top end of the grinding machine base, an opening and closing mechanism is fixedly installed on the other side of the top end of the grinding machine base, and the opening and closing mechanism comprises a first sealing plate and a second sealing plate. According to the pneumatic grinding machine with the improved structure, the opening and closing mechanism is arranged to replace a traditional mode that a sealed plate is opened and closed manually, the first sealing plate is opened and closed along the second sealing plate under the action of the opening and closing air cylinder, and sealing of the plate is completed; by arranging the two grinding rollers, the two grinding rollers grind a product from the two sides, traditional single-face grinding is replaced, the grinding efficiency of the grinding machine is improved, the two bowl grinding rollers or the multiple grinding rollers are used for grinding the product, the equipment does not need to be replaced, and the grinding efficiency of the grinding machine is improved. And the device can be quickly realized only by replacing the limiting seat, the sliding rod, the connecting spring, the mounting plate and the grinding table.
claims:

title: Sweetened food product and methods of preparation
abstract: Described are coated food products having a sugar (sucrose) coating, the coating exhibiting desirable levels of sucrose crystallinity and a desired sucrose ratio (total sucrose per total soluble solids), as well as methods or preparing such coated food products and coating.
claims:
1. A method for preparing a pre-sweetened comestible comprising a base and a coating, the method comprising:
providing a base, and
forming a coating on the base by:
applying a non-sucrose slurry to the base
separately applying a sucrose slurry comprising sucrose and water to the non-sucrose slurry-coated base, wherein the sucrose slurry is different from the non-sucrose slurry and directly applied to the non-sucrose slurry-coated base.
2. The method according to claim 1 wherein
the sucrose slurry comprises from about 80 to about 100 weight percent sucrose and from about 0 to about 20 weight percent non-sucrose solids on a dry basis, and
the non-sucrose slurry comprises at least about 70 weight percent non-sucrose soluble solids on a dry basis.
3. The method according to claim 1 wherein the sucrose slurry, the non-sucrose slurry, or the sucrose slurry and the non-sucrose slurry together, comprise from about 0 to about 1 weight percent soluble salt, and from about 0 to about 15 weight percent insoluble flavorant, on a dry basis.
4. The method according to claim 1 wherein the sucrose slurry comprises at least about 80 weight percent sucrose, and the non-sucrose slurry comprises at least 80 weight percent non-sucrose soluble soli

title: Mobile product dispenser
abstract: To relate to an autonomous mobile product dispenser capable of discharging a product (for example, fountain beverage) to a user via being called to a certain place by the user.SOLUTION: There is provided a mobile product dispenser for storing products and discharging the products to consumers at various places. The mobile product dispenser may comprise a user interface, a power train system, and a control unit. The mobile product dispenser may move freely or follow a predetermined route in an operation environment, and service may be provided in response to the consumers along the route. The consumers each may also call the mobile product dispenser to a certain place by using a user device such as a smartphone, a smart watch, or the like. It may be made possible by the control unit that the mobile product dispenser autonomously moves in the operation environment, and/or navigates to the places of the consumers.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
claims:

前記製品吐出システムが、第３の製品成分チャンバと、前記第３の製品成分チャンバ内に配置された第３の製品成分と、を更に備え、前記製品吐出システムが、前記第１及び第２の製品成分を含む第１の種類の飲料を吐出するように構成され、前記製品吐出システムが、前記第１及び第３の製品成分を含む第２の種類の飲料を吐出するように構成されている、請求項１に記載の移動製品ディスペンサ。

title: Self-serve kiosk
abstract: Aspects of the present disclosure include a self-serve kiosk with a door that allows access to products inside the kiosk. A bar is disposed on the door and contains a user interface that allows the user to purchase products. The bar also includes a handle that the user can grasp to open and close the door. The bar can rotate with respect to the door into an access position that improves maintenance access to the user interface and related components. In aspects, the bar and related components improve integration of self-serve functionality into existing product storage devices.
claims:

a lock that is configured to lock the door to restrict access to the interior of the housing;
a bar comprising a base member and an end members disposed at an end of the base member and pivotally connected to an exterior of the door such that the bar can rotate with respect to the door;
a controller configured to lock and unlock the lock; and
a user interface mounted to the bar.
2. The product cooler of claim 1, wherein the bar has a longitudinal length that is longer than a longitudinal length of the door, and
wherein the end member is attached to a portion of a frame of the door.

title: Clear protein beverage enhancer
abstract: The present disclosure provides methods for removing the color in protein-containing water beverages. Colorless protein-containing water beverages are also disclosed.
claims:

2. The beverage of claim 1, further comprising from about 0.01 to about 0.5 wt percent of tripotassium phosphate.
3. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the water is carbonated.
4. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the water is not carbonated.
5. The beverage of claim 1, wherein the plant-based protein is pea protein, soy protein, rice protein, canola protein, or sunflower protein.

title: Yogurt Composition
abstract: A yogurt core is described that contains yogurt or a yogurt analog, cream cheese or a cream cheese analog, and dairy-derived powder or dairy-free powder. A yogurt core provides a less tart flavor due to a pH above 4.6, yet remains safe over an extended refrigerated shelf life due to a water activity of less than 0.92. A yogurt core can be enrobed to provide a hand-holdable yogurt-containing snack.
claims:

i. Core A, consisting of:
a) yogurt in an amount of about 28% to about 40% by weight of the yogurt core;
b) cream cheese in an amount of about 60% to about 90% by weight of the yogurt, wherein the combined amount of yogurt and cream cheese comprises about 45% to about 60% by weight of the yogurt core;
c) dairy-derived powder in an amount of about 14% to about 25% by weight of the yogurt core, wherein the amount of dairy-derived powder is included in an amount of from about 55% to about 75% by weight of the yogurt;
d) sugar in an amount of 10% to 20% by weight of the yogurt core; and
e) other ingredients in an amount of up to 15% by weight of the yogurt core;
ii. Core B, consisting of:
a) a strained yogurt in an amount of about 28% to about 32% by weight of the yogurt core;
b) cream cheese in an amount of about 60% to about 70% by weight of the yogurt, wherein the combined amount of yogurt and cream cheese comprises about 45% to about 55% by weight of the yogurt core;
c) dairy-derived powder in an amount of about 18% to about 24% by weight of the yogurt core, wherein the amount of dairy-derived powder is included in an amount of from about 65

title: Aroma device applications
abstract: Methods of using an aroma device associated with food experiences are disclosed. A method can include obtaining food-product data corresponding to a food product; based on such data, selecting an aroma profile for the food product; emitting an aroma based on the profile; obtaining modification data; and generating a new aroma profile for the food product based on the modification data. A method can include decoupling two or more aromas based on human and pet aroma sensitivity and/or preferences. Systems configured to use an aroma device are also provided.
claims:
1. A method for use with an aroma-emitting device, the method comprising:
obtaining food-product data corresponding to a food product;
selecting, based on the food-product data, an aroma profile for the food product;
emitting, by the aroma-emitting device, an aroma based on the aroma profile;
obtaining modification data corresponding to an instruction to modify the aroma; and
generating a new aroma profile for the food product based on the modification data.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the modification data indicates an increase or decrease of one or more predetermined flavors.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the obtaining the food-product data includes reading an optical code corresponding to the food product.
4. A system comprising: an aroma-emitting device; a controller including one or more processors; and one or more computer-readable storage media storing program instructions which, when executed by the one or more processors, are configured to cause the one or more processors to perform a method comprising:
obtaining food-product data corresponding to a food product;
selecting, based on the food-product data, an aroma profile for the food product;</

title: Methods of l-sugar production and compositions thereof
abstract: Methods of producing L-isomers of glucose from cellulose, cellulose-derived L-isomers of glucose, and uses thereof are described. The method may include precipitating cellulose from an alkaline solution of swollen or solubilized cellulose; and hydrolyzing the precipitated cellulose with an acid to produce an L-isomer of glucose.
claims:
What is claimed is:
1 . A method of producing an L-isomer of glucose from cellulose, the method comprising: precipitating cellulose from an alkaline solution of swollen or solubilized cellulose; hydrolyzing the precipitated cellulose with an acid to produce an L-isomer of glucose; and separating out the L-isomer of glucose.
2. The method of claim 1 , wherien the L-isomer of glucose is L-glucose, L-allose, L-altrose, L-mannose, or a mixture thereof.
3. The method of claim 1 , wherein the alkaline solution comprises sodium hydroxide or lithium hydroxide alone or in combination with a co-base.
4. The method of claim 1 , wherein the acid is selected from the group consisitng of sulfuric acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrobromic acid, and phosphoric acid.
5. The method of claim 1 , wherein precipitating comprises neutralizing the alkaline solution.
6. The method of claim 1 , wherien the alkaline solution of swollen or solubilized cellulose is obtained by swelling or dissolving cellulose nanocrystals in an aqueous alkaline solution and wherein the swelling or dissolution is performed at a temperature of about 0°C to about 60°C.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the aqueous alkaline solution comprises from 8 to 20% sodium hydroxide.
8. The method of claim 1 , wherein the precipitated cellulose comprises cellulose II

title: Collar with integrated device attachment
abstract: Disclosed is a mounting base (300) for attaching a portable electronic device (402) to a collar apparatus (400). Mounting base (300) includes a frame (102) and a latch (200). Latch (200) is moveable between a latched position and an unlatched position. Latch (200) includes an actuator (206) with a button (208) that may be depressed by a user to manually move latch (200) between the latched and unlatched positions. A portable electronic device (402) includes an insertion portion (410) that is received in a receiving aperture (108) in the frame (102). Once the insertion portion (410) is inserted, the device (402) may be rotated manually to engage latch (200). During rotation, a lock stub (216) on latch (200) engages a corresponding feature on insertion portion (410), thereby preventing counter-rotation of device (402). Additionally, one or more tabs (120) on frame (102) interfere with corresponding structure on insertion portion (410) to secure device (402) onto mounting base (300).

WO 2020/102799
PCT/US2019/061965

title: New antifouling developing coating material, and preparation method therefor and use thereof
abstract: A new antifouling developing coating material, and a preparation method therefor and the use thereof. In the antifouling developing coating material, barium ions are combined with the sulfonate anions, and the barium ions are introduced into the structure of a modified choline phosphate polymer, which is modified with siloxane and sulfonate anions, thereby allowing the material to have combined antifouling and developing functions; therefore, the stability of the material is ensured, and the material has wide application prospects in the field of medical imaging.
claims:
1.一种新型防污显影涂层材料，其中，所述防污显影涂层材料具有如下式I所示结构：
其中m＝1～40，n＝1～40，k＝1～5，R1和R2为含硅氧烷基团，R1和R2相同或不同。

3.根据权利要求1或2所述的新型防污显影涂层材料，其中，R1和R2独立地选自三(三甲基硅氧烷基)硅烷基或三甲氧基硅烷基，其结构如下：

(2)将钡盐加入至含有所述经过硅氧烷和磺酸根修饰的改性磷酸胆碱聚合物的溶液中，反应，得到所述新型防污显影涂层材料。
5.根据权利要求4所述的制备方法，其中，所述步骤(1)具体包括以下 步骤：2-甲基丙烯酰氧乙基磷酸胆碱与硅氧烷化合物以及(2-(甲基丙烯酰基氧基)乙基)二甲基-(3-磺酸丙基)氢氧化铵反应，得到所述经过硅氧烷和磺酸根修饰的改性磷酸胆碱聚合物。

title: Processing system for handling pieces of product
abstract: A processing system for packaging pieces of product utilizing high-speed sorting includes an infeed conveyor for supplying the pieces of food product and a linear motor sorter is connected to the infeed conveyor. The sorter includes a main conveyor with several lanes for moving the pieces of food product, with one of the lanes being a first lane which receives the pieces of food product. The sorter also has one or more diverters for diverting determined ones of the pieces of food product from the first lane to at least one other lane. The sorter includes a linear motor and carts connected to the linear motor and is configured to move the pieces of food between the lanes.
claims:
1. A processing system for sorting pieces of product comprising:
an infeed conveyor for supplying the pieces of product;
a sorter connected to the infeed conveyor and including a main conveyor having several lanes for moving the pieces of product, one of the several lanes being a first lane receiving the pieces of product and a diverter for diverting the pieces of product between the several lanes, said diverter including a linear motor and carts connected to the linear motor configured to move the pieces of product between the several lanes; and
an output conveyor receiving the pieces of product from the sorter.
2. The processing system according to claim 1, wherein the main conveyor is arranged along a longitudinal axis and the diverter is located above the main conveyor and extends from a first lane of the several lanes to a second lane of the several lanes.
3. The processing system according to claim 2, further comprising a control system connected to the sorter and configured to have the carts engage the pieces of product, move in a direction angled to infeed conveyor to move the pieces of product between the several lanes.
4. The processing system according to claim 3, wherein the diverter constitutes a first diverter and the sorter further includes a second diverter located above the main conveyor and extending from the first lane of the several lanes to a third lane of the several lanes.

title: Cat food compositions for treating chronic kidney disease
abstract: The present disclosure relates to food compositions comprising an effective amount of one or more tripolyphosphate salt , as a source of inorganic phosphorus, for use in a method for treating and/or delaying the progression of chronic kidney disease in a cat in need thereof.
claims:
1. 一種食物組合物，其包含約0.1 g/Mcal至約1.5 g/Mcal的無機磷並且包含有效量的一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽作為無機磷源，其用於治療和/或延緩有需要的貓的慢性腎病發展的方法中。
2. 根據請求項1所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽由三聚磷酸鈉（STPP）、三聚磷酸鉀（KTPP）或其混合物組成，特別地所述一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽由三聚磷酸鈉組成。
3. 根據請求項1或2所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物包含約1.0 g/Mcal或更少的無機磷。
4. 根據請求項1至3中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中至少約0.2 g/Mcal的無機磷源自一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽。
5. 根據請求項1至4中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述無機磷源自一種或多種無機焦磷酸鹽和一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽。
6. 根據請求項1至5中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中無機磷的總量源自一種或多種三聚磷酸鹽。
7. 根據請求項1至6中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物還包含鈣，並且其中鈣與磷的重量比的特徵為等於或高於1。
8. 根據請求項1至7中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物還包含約1 g/Mcal至約5 g/Mcal的鉀。
9. 根據請求項1至8中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物還包含蛋白質、脂肪、纖維和/或維生素。
10. 根據請求項1至9中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物由營養完整且均衡的食物組合物組成。
11. 根據請求項1至10中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物由濕食物組合物、幹食物組合物或半濕食物組合物組成。
12. 根據請求項11所述之用途的食物組合物，所述食物組合物是幹食物組合物。
13. 根據請求項1至12中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物具有根據NRC 2006測量的範圍為約400 kcal/kg至約5000 kcal/kg的代謝能。
14. 根據請求項12或13所述之用途的食物組合物，其中所述食物組合物具有根據NRC 2006測量的範圍為約3000 kcal/kg至約5000 kcal/kg，特別是約3800 kcal/kg至3900 kcal/kg的代謝能。
15. 根據請求項1至14中任一項所述之用途的食物組合物，其中影響貓的慢性腎病涉及腎實質的惡化；功能性腎單位的損失；和/或腎小球的損傷和/或惡化。

title: Slush beverage dispenser and slush beverage dispensing methods
Merchandise display for displaying, refrigerating, and dispensing containers of a frozen product
abstract: A merchandise display for displaying, refrigerating, and dispensing containers of a frozen product along an aisle may include a) a lower shelf and b) an upper shelf disposed above the lower shelf along a longitudinal axis of the merchandise display, c) a support portion operably coupled to the lower shelf and the upper shelf to form an assembly, radial extent of the assembly from the longitudinal axis forming a radial envelope of the merchandise display, and d) at least one refrigerating appliance configured to keep the frozen product frozen, disposed on the lower shelf or the upper shelf, and including a door configured to be moved between opened and closed positions to expose and close, respectively, the refrigerating chamber remaining within the radial envelope of the merchandise display.
claims:
1. A merchandise display for displaying, refrigerating, and dispensing containers of a frozen product along an aisle, comprising: a lower shelf disposed above a floor and an upper shelf disposed above the lower shelf along a longitudinal axis of the merchandise display; a support portion operably coupled to the lower shelf and the upper shelf to form an assembly, the radial extent of the assembly from the longitudinal axis forming a radial envelope of the merchandise display; a plurality of refrigerating appliances configured to keep the frozen product frozen, disposed on the lower shelf or the upper shelf, and each including: an enclosure enclosing at least bottom, left, right, and rear sides of the refrigerating appliance, a refrigerating chamber disposed within the enclosure and configured to accommodate the containers of the frozen product, a transparent door configured to be moved between opened and closed positions to expose and close, respectively, the refrigerating chamber while the enclosure, refrigerating chamber, and transparent door remain within the radial envelope of the merchandise display, and a protruding portion that extends radially around a perimeter of the transparent door, wherein when the transparent door is moved to the open position it moves towards the rear sides and over a portion of the protruding portion of the refrigerating appliance.
2. The merchandise display of claim 1, wherein the plurality of refrigerating appliances includes first and second refrigerating appliances

title: Method of producing roasted oats and roasted oat-based peanut butter-flavored compositions
abstract: The present disclosure relates to oat-based peanut butter- flavored compositions and methods of making such compositions. In particular, a method is disclosed of roasting substantially intact groats until CIELAB L*-value change per minute, and CIELAB b*- value change per minute achieve a negative slope to produce roasted oats having a peanut butter flavor. Compositions including roasted oats having a peanut butter flavor are also disclosed.
claims:
1. A method of producing roasted oats, the method comprising roasting a plurality of substantially intact groats at a temperature of more than 149° C (300° F) for sufficient time to achieve a negative slope in CIELAB L*-value change per minute, and a negative slope in CIELAB b*-value change minute, where slopes for L*-vahie change per minute and b*-value change per minute are based on CIELAB measurements at intervals of 5 minutes.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the substantially intact groats are roasted at a temperature of at least 177° C (350° F) for at least 15 minutes.
3. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein CIELAB a*-value change per minute has a positive slope based on CIELAB measurements at intervals of 5 minutes.
4. The method of any of claims 1-3, further comprising a step of inactivating lipase activity in the plurality of substantially intact groats prior to roasting.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the inactivating step includes exposing the plurality of substantially intact groats to steam for sufficient time to inactivate lipase activity.
6. The method of claim 4, wherein inactivating step includes soaking the plurality of substantially intact groats in water or an aqueous solution at a temperature and pressure sufficient to inactivate lipase activity.

title: Feline food composition
abstract: The present application discloses a full nutritional feline food composition comprising EPA/DHA and a carbohydrate. These full nutritional feline food compositions may be used in dry or wet food compositions. The composition is useful for the prevention and/or treatment of cardiac hypertrophy in felines, such as cats.
claims:
1.一种全营养猫科动物食品组合物，所述组合物包含二十碳五烯酸/二十二碳六烯酸(EPA/DHA)和碳水化合物，用于预防和/或治疗心脏肥大，其中：

title: Animal food composition
abstract: The present disclosure provides an animal food composition comprising a source of glycyrrhizin, in combination with a source of curcuminoids, for use for preventing and/or treating allergic inflammatory skin diseases.
claims:
1. An animal food composition comprising: (i) about 0.01 % to about 4% by weight of a source of glycyrrhizin, (ii) about 0.01% to about 10 % by weight of a source of one or more curcuminoids, and (iii) about 2% to about 10% by weight of linoleic acid; wherein the animal food composition consists of a kibble and wherein the animal food composition further comprises a source of proteins.
2. The animal food composition according to claim 1, wherein the animal food composition consists of a nutritionally complete food composition.
3. The animal food composition according to claim 1 or 2, wherein: (i) the source of glycyrrhizin consists of licorice, and/or (ii) the source of one or more curcuminoids consists of turmeric.
4. The animal food composition according to any one of claims 1 to 3, further comprising EPA/DHA, Taurine, Lutein, Vitamin E or a combination thereof.
5. A method of manufacturing an animal food composition according to any one of claims 1 to 4, comprising the steps of: a) mixing a source of a glycyrrhizin and a source of one or more curcuminoid, thereby providing a mixture; and b) heating the mixture.
6. A method for preventing and/or treating an allergic inflammatory skin disease in an animal in need thereof, comprising administering t

title: Recyclable polyethylene cold seal film for food packaging
Modular refrigeration system for storing products
abstract: Embodiments described herein can include one or more modular storage units for use with a refrigerator system. The modular storage units can include a door that is movable from a closed position to an open position; a back wall; side walls; and a base. The modular storage unit can have an air inlet disposed in the back wall for receiving chilled air from the refrigeration system. The modular storage unit can include a temperature sensor that detects the temperature within the interior volume and an insulating wall comprising a phase change material disposed within the insulating wall. The modular storage unit can include a locking system configured to lock the door. Multiple modular storage units can be used in one refrigerator system, and each can be removably coupled to an interior storage compartment of the refrigerator system. Embodiments described herein can be integrated into existing refrigeration systems.
claims:
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A system for refrigerating a product, the system comprising: a storage compartment; a cooling system, the cooling system configured to deliver chilled air to the storage compartment; a modular unit removably coupled to the storage compartment, wherein the modular unit comprises an interior volume, and wherein the system is configured to adjust a temperature within the interior volume independently of a temperature within the storage compartment.
2. The system of claim 1, further comprising a damper configured to move between a first position and a second position to redirect chilled air the modular unit.
3. The system of claim 2, wherein the damper is configured to move between the first position and the second position in response to a change in temperature within the modular unit as detected by a temperature sensor.
4. The system of claim 1, further comprising a fan, wherein the fan is configured to direct air from a first end of the modular unit to a second end of the modular unit.
5. The system of claim 1, further comprising a wall extending between a top end of the storage compartment to a bottom end of the storage compartment.
6. The system of claim 5, wherein the wall extends between a refrigeration unit and the modular unit.

title: Systems and methods for provisioning and configuring computing services
abstract: Disclosed herein are system, apparatus, article of manufacture, method and/or computer program product embodiments, and/or combinations and sub-combinations thereof, for provisioning and configuring a computing service. An embodiment operates by receiving a request for the provisioning and configuration of the computing service. A template corresponding to setting up the computing service is identified. A first portion of a template file is generated based on the template, and the first portion is applied as input to a provisioning engine to generate one or more provisioned values as a result provisioning the computing service. A second portion of the template file is generated based on the template, and the second portion of the template file is applied as input to a configuring engine to configure the computing service. It is determined that the service has been configured, and the computing service is provided for use by one or more users.
claims:
1. A computer-implemented method for provisioning and configuring a computing service comprising:
receiving a request for the provisioning and configuration of the computing service;
identifying, by at least one computer processor, a template corresponding to setting up the computing service, the template comprising a first plurality of rules for provisioning the computing service and a second plurality of rules for configuring the computing service;
generating a first portion of a template file based on the template, the first portion including values for the first plurality of rules for provisioning the computing service in accordance with the request;
applying the first portion of the template file as a first input to a provisioning engine to generate one or more provisioned values as a result of the provisioning engine provisioning the computing service, the one or more provisioned values corresponding to at least a subset of the second plurality of rules of the template, the subset of the second plurality of rules being associated with configuring the computing service;
generating a second portion of the template file based on the template, the second portion including the one or more provisioned values corresponding to at least a subset of the second plurality of rules for configuring the computing service;
applying the second portion of the template file as a second input to a configuring engine, wherein the configuring engine is configured to use the second portion of the template file, applied as the second input, to configure the computing service;

title: Beverage can with ingredient chamber
abstract: A beverage can with an ingredient chamber for storing functional ingredients separately from a base beverage until the beverage can is opened by a consumer. The ingredient chamber may be disposed on a can end of the beverage can. The ingredient chamber may be broken open to release functional ingredients automatically when the beverage can is opened by the consumer. In some embodiments, the ingredient chamber includes a membrane that forms a sealed cavity. In some embodiments, the ingredient chamber includes a deformed cavity of the can end.
claims:
WO 2023/192271 PCT/US2023/016555 - 11 - WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A beverage can end with an ingredient chamber, the beverage can end comprising: a metal body having a topside and an underside, wherein the metal body has a weakened portion configured to be broken open to create a drinking opening; a tab on the topside, configured to be actuated to break open the weakened portion; and an ingredient chamber comprising a sealed membrane containing a beverage ingredient, wherein the ingredient chamber is attached to the underside of the metal body, disposed across the weakened portion, wherein the sealed membrane is broken in response to the actuation of the tab to break the weakened portion, such that the beverage ingredient is released from the sealed membrane.
2. The beverage can end of claim 1, wherein the actuation of the tab breaks the weakened portion to create a flange and forces the flange through the sealed membrane, such that the beverage ingredient is released from the sealed membrane.
3. The beverage can end of claim 1, wherein the sealed membrane is attached to the underside of the metal body by an adhesive.
4. The beverage can end of claim 1, wherein the sealed membrane comprises a top portion disposed on the underside of the metal body and a bottom portion, and wherein the top portion and bottom portion together define a sealed cavity containing the beverage ingredient.
5. The beverage can end of claim 1, wherein the ingredient chamber has a size b

title: Mobile phone shell with folding screen protection film and express removing blade
abstract: The utility model discloses a mobile phone shell with a folding screen protective film and an express removing blade, and relates to the technical field of mobile phone shells, the mobile phone shell comprises a mobile phone shell body, the upper end of the inner side of the side wall of the mobile phone shell body is provided with a slideway, and the slideway of the side wall of the mobile phone shell body is provided with a transparent folding screen protective film in sliding connection with the slideway. The folding screen protection film is folded and unfolded in a sliding mode along the sliding way. And an express knife rotationally connected with the mobile phone shell body is arranged at the rear part of the mobile phone shell body. According to the utility model, the mobile phone screen is protected by the folding protective film, the normal use of the mobile phone can be ensured by the transparent material, and the protective film can be folded and shrunk to expose the mobile phone screen for use; the back of the mobile phone shell is provided with the push-pull express knife, which is convenient for young people to pick up expresses and meets the daily life requirements of modern people.
claims:
1.一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，包括手机壳本体(1)，其特征在于：所述手机壳本体(1)的侧壁内侧上口设有滑道(2)，所述手机壳本体(1)侧壁滑道(2)设有与其滑动连接的透明折叠屏幕保护膜(3)，所述折叠屏幕保护膜(3)沿滑道(2)滑动折叠与展开；所述手机壳本体(1)后部设有与其转动连接的快递刀(4)。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述折叠屏幕保护膜(3)呈波浪形且其折叠下凹点连接有滑块(5)，所述滑块(5)在滑道(2)内滑动。
3.根据权利要求2所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述折叠屏幕保护膜(3)的活动端设有拉动片(6)。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述手机壳本体(1)的手机嵌槽的任意一端延伸设有储物槽(7)。
5.根据权利要求1所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述快递刀(4)通过转轴(8)与手机壳本体(1)后部转动连接。
6.根据权利要求5所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述转轴(8)与手机壳本体(1)上下两端平行，所述快递刀(4)末端扣在转轴(8)外部绕其180度翻转转动。
7.根据权利要求5所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述转轴(8)自手机壳本体(1)后部与其垂直向外延伸，所述快递刀(4)的末端以转轴(8)为中心轴绕其360度转动。
8.根据权利要求6或7所述的一种带折叠屏幕保护膜和拆快递刀片的手机壳，其特征在于：所述快递刀(4)为推拉式伸缩刀，所述推拉式伸缩刀内设有刀片(10)和刀片按钮(9)。

title: petfood
abstract: Disclosed herein is a method of forming a petfood, the method comprising: providing an aqueous first liquid, in which is dispersed an animal-derived product or a meat analogue and in which is dissolved a hydrocolloid, wherein the hydrocolloid is an ionotropic gelling agent; contacting droplets of the aqueous first liquid with a second liquid, the second liquid having cations dissolved or dispersed therein, to form gelled droplets comprising the animal-derived product or the meat analogue, and a metal ionhydrocolloid; separating the gelled droplets from the second liquid containing the cations; combining the gelled droplets with a third liquid comprising water and a thickener, optionally sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener. Also disclosed herein is a petfood made according to the method. Other methods and petfoods are also described.
claims:
1. A method of forming a petfood, the method comprising: providing an aqueous first liquid, in which is dispersed an animal-derived product or a meat analogue and in which is dissolved a hydrocolloid, wherein the hydrocolloid is an ionotropic gelling agent; contacting droplets of the aqueous first liquid with a second liquid, the second liquid having cations dissolved or dispersed therein, to form gelled droplets comprising the animal-derived product or the meat analogue, and a metal ion-hydrocolloid; separating the gelled droplets from the second liquid containing the cations; combining the gelled droplets with a third liquid comprising water and a thickener, optionally sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener.
2. A method according to claim 1, wherein an alkaline substance is present in one or in all of the first, second and third liquid.
3. A method according to claim 2, wherein the alkaline substance is an alkali metal carbonate.
4. A method according to claim 2 or claim 3, wherein one or all of the first, second and third liquid have pH of greater than 6, optionally 6.5 or more, optionally 7 or more, optionally 7 to 9.
5. A method according to any one of the preceding claims, wherein the method involves sterilizing the gelled droplets before or after combining them with the third liquid comprising a thickener by heating the droplets to a temperature of 70 °C or more, option

title: Beverage dispense valve controlled by wireless technology
abstract: Methods and systems directed to dispensing fluids, such as beverages, using wireless technology are provided. Aspects relate to a beverage dispenser with a dispensing system housing, a valve housing positioned exterior to the dispensing system housing and extending from the dispensing system housing. The valve housing may be configured to dispense a beverage and include self-contained electronics disposed within an interior area of the valve housing. In some embodiments, the beverage dispenser has one or more additional valve housings positioned exterior to the dispensing system housing. The valve housing may be configured to dispense a beverage and include self-contained electronics disposed within an interior area of the valve housing.
claims:
1. A beverage dispensing system comprising:
at least one beverage container, the beverage container comprising:
a sidewall disposed around a central bottom, wherein the bottom is distal to an opening for receiving a beverage, and
a container wireless transceiver associated with the container; and
at least one beverage dispenser, the beverage dispenser comprising:
a housing,
a valve extending from the housing configured to dispense the beverage into the container located below the valve, and
a dispenser wireless transceiver located in close proximity to the beverage dispenser configured to communicate with the container wireless transceiver on the beverage container.
2. The beverage dispensing system according to claim 1, wherein the container wireless transceiver is affixed to the bottom of the container.
3. The beverage dispensing system according to claim 1, wherein the container wireless transceiver is affixed to the sidewall of the container.
4. The beverage dispensing system according to claim 1, wherein the container wireless transceiver is located in an impermeable layer between the sidewall and the bottom of the container, wherein the impermeable layer is not in fluid communicat

title: Cooler for beverage containers
abstract: A cooler for storing beverage containers. The cooler includes a housing defining an interior volume for storing a first beverage container at a first predetermined temperature and a compartment within the interior volume of the housing for storing a second beverage container at a second predetermined temperature that is at or below a freezing point of the beverage. The cooler further includes a user interface for receiving a user input to dispense the second beverage container, and a delivery portal for providing access to the second beverage container. A chute is configured to communicate the second beverage container from the compartment to the delivery portal and to cause nucleation of the beverage and form a slush beverage. A cooling unit is configured to maintain the interior volume of the housing at the first predetermined temperature and the compartment at the second predetermined temperature.
claims:
1. A cooler for beverage containers, comprising:
a housing defining a first interior volume for storing a first beverage container at a first predetermined temperature;
a compartment arranged within the first interior volume of the housing for storing a second beverage container at a second predetermined temperature that is at or below a freezing point of a beverage within the second beverage container, wherein the compartment is enclosed;
a user interface for receiving a user input to dispense the second beverage container from the compartment;
a delivery portal for providing access to the second beverage container;
a chute configured to communicate the second beverage container from the compartment to the delivery portal, the chute comprising a first funnel section extending vertically away from the compartment and arranged in a rear portion of the first interior volume, and a second section extending between a distal end of the first funnel section and the delivery portal, wherein the chute is configured to subject the second beverage container to a gravitational drop through the first funnel section and onto a surface of the second section to cause nucleation of the beverage within the second beverage container and form a slush beverage within the second beverage container; and
a cooling unit configured to maintain the first interior volume of the housing at the first predetermined temperature and the compartment at the second predetermined temperature,
wherein the chute and the compartment form an encl

title: High protein, low net carbohydrate soft snack and methods of making
abstract: A soft, shelf stable food product including a high protein matrix and particulates that retains a soft, moist eating experience over an extended shelflife is described. The high protein matrix includes hydrolyzed collagen and a soluble fiber syrup that enable high levels of vegetable protein and an overall high amount of protein, while avoiding poor eating qualities typically associated with vegetable protein. Methods of making a food product are also disclosed.
claims:
What is claimed is:

title: Modular refrigeration system for storing products
abstract: Embodiments described herein can include one or more modular storage units for use with a refrigerator system. The modular storage units can include a door that is movable from a closed position to an open position; a back wall; side walls; and a base. The modular storage unit can have an air inlet disposed in the back wall for receiving chilled air from the refrigeration system. The modular storage unit can include a temperature sensor that detects the temperature within the interior volume and an insulating wall comprising a phase change material disposed within the insulating wall. The modular storage unit can include a locking system configured to lock the door. Multiple modular storage units can be used in one refrigerator system, and each can be removably coupled to an interior storage compartment of the refrigerator system. Embodiments described herein can be integrated into existing refrigeration systems.
claims:
1. A modular storage unit for a refrigeration system, the modular storage unit comprising:
an interior volume defined by:
a door, the door being movable from a closed position to an open position;
a back wall;
side walls; and
a base;
an air inlet for receiving chilled air from the refrigeration system;
a temperature sensor configured to detect the temperature within the interior volume;
an insulating wall comprising a phase change material disposed within the insulating wall, wherein the insulating wall is oriented in a first direction that is substantially perpendicular to the back wall and substantially parallel to the side walls;
a locking system configured to lock the door,
wherein the modular storage unit is removably coupled to an interior storage compartment of the refrigeration system, wherein the interior storage compartment is defined by walls and a refrigeration system door that is movable from a closed position to an open position.
2. The modular storage unit of claim 1, further comprising a second insulating wall oriented in the first direction.
3. The modular storage unit of claim 2, wherein the insulating wa

title: Circuit board component EMI protective coating forming device
abstract: The utility model discloses a circuit board component EMI (Electro-Magnetic Interference) protective coating forming device which comprises a main cabinet body, a console, a processing cabin, a safety cabinet door, pressure relief frames, a cutting module, a material turning frame, an arc-shaped material turning plate and a material storage frame, the console is mounted on the outer side of the main cabinet body, and the pressure relief frames are mounted at the two ends of the safety cabinet door; a cutting module is arranged on the cutting module frame body, a material overturning frame is arranged on the cutting module frame body through a brake motor, and an arc-shaped material overturning plate is installed in a material storage frame at the lower end of the cutting module in an embedded mode. The circuit board component EMI protective coating forming device is suitable for balancing the pressure difference inside and outside a processing cabin and improving the discharging efficiency; when the safety cabinet door is opened, instantly and rapidly disturbed airflow passes through an air inlet of a pressure relief frame, flows along an inclined guide plate and is finally guided out through a pressure relief rubber grating plate, at the moment, no air pressure change exists in the cabin, dust is prevented from entering the cabin, and machined and formed materials freely slide to the position of an arc-shaped material turning plate after being cut by a cutting module. And the material turning frame brakes to further turn over the materials, and rapid turning over of the large materials is achieved.
claims:
1.一种电路板元器件EMI保护涂层成型装置，其特征在于，包括主柜体（1）、操控台（2）、加工舱（3）、安全柜门（4）、泄压架（5）、裁切模组（6）、翻料架（7）、弧形翻料板（8）、储料架（9），主柜体（1）外侧安装有操控台（2），主柜体（1）上端设置有加工舱（3），加工舱（3）的安全柜门（4）两端位置定位安装有泄压架（5），加工舱（3）左端位置安装有两组裁切模组（6），裁切模组（6）架体上通过制动电机安装有翻料架（7），裁切模组（6）下端位置定位安装有储料架（9），储料架（9）内嵌式安装有弧形翻料板（8）。
2.根据权利要求1所述的一种电路板元器件EMI保护涂层成型装置，其特征在于：所述弧形翻料板（8）由斜翻料板（10）和水平横置翻料柱（11）组成，斜翻料板（10）倾斜焊接安装在水平横置翻料柱（11）切点位置。
3.根据权利要求1所述的一种电路板元器件EMI保护涂层成型装置，其特征在于：所述泄压架（5）由进气口（12）、斜导流板（13）和泄压橡胶格栅板（14）组成，泄压架（5）架体前端面设置有进气口（12），泄压架（5）架体内置安装有斜导流板（13），泄压架（5）架体后端面加工成型的多组矩形开口位置通过转轴安装有泄压橡胶格栅板（14）。
4.根据权利要求1所述的一种电路板元器件EMI保护涂层成型装置，其特征在于：所述翻料架（7）的翻转支架（15）外侧定位安装有橡胶翻料辊（16）。
